loan.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, a 58-year-old widowed mother of four, lives in the Philippines where for the past 20 years she has had a food shop at the school canteen, selling snacks such as rice and pancakes. A member of HSPFI since 2011, Evelyn is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy more raw ingredients for making the snacks. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell.

loan.name: Grupo Solidario Ilusion Group

texts.es: Maria Orbelina tiene 54 a√±os de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 33 y 30 a√±os los cuales ya son independientes y vive solo con su esposo en Cuyamel, Cortes. Do√±a Maria, realiza una actividad desde hace 13 a√±os, en la venta de comida. Inicio este negocio vi√©ndose en la necesidad de generar otro ingreso extra que le ayudara a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella vende pollo frito con tajadas de banano, carne asada, chuletas frita, baleadas, tortilla con quesillo, almuerzo y refrescos. Manifiesta que es un negocio rentable y lo tiene establecido en un punto de venta del centro de Cuyamel. Empezando a atender a los clientes desde las 8.00 am hasta 9.00 pm todos los d√≠as de la semana. Este es su cuarto pr√©stamo con ODEF de 15,000 lempiras el cual invertir√° en comprar insumos para la elaboraci√≥n de comidas como ser carnes y refrescos, aprovechando la temporada alta de ventas de Semana Santa. Con los prestamos obtenidos ha surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ventas. Su meta es ampliar m√°s el negocio y vender mariscos, para incrementar sus ventas. Do√±a Maria Orbelina pertenece a un Grupo Solidario llamado Ilusi√≥n que consta de cuatro miembros siendo ella la coordinadora del grupo. En la foto se identifica por su blusa color blanco es la segunda de derecha a izquierda. Los otros tres miembros est√°n solicitando su primer pr√©stamo de 7,000 lempiras cada uno y son: Maria Issela, (camisa gris de izquierda a derecha), seguido Don Crist√≥bal, y al lado derecho blusa color rosado Ver√≥nica Maria. Quienes se dedican a la compra y venta de mercader√≠a, como ser: Ropa, zapatos, cosm√©ticos etc.
texts.en:
Maria Orbelina, age 54, is married and has two children, ages 33 and 30. They children are adults, so she lives only with her husband in Cuyamel, Cortes.
Maria has been selling food for 13 years. She started this business when she saw the need to generate extra income to help her husband with the household expenses. She sells fried chicken with sliced bananas, roasted meat, fried pork chops, "baleadas" (flour tortillas with beans, eggs, butter, cheese and meat), tortillas with soft cheese, lunch, and soft drinks.
She states that it is a profitable business, and she has it set up at a sales location in the center of Cuyamel. She starts waiting on customers at 8:00 a.m., and she works until 9:00 p.m. every day of the week.
This loan for 15,000 lempiras is her fourth loan with ODEF. She will use it to buy supplies to make food like meats and snacks. She will take advantage of the high sales season of Holy Week. With the loans she has received she has stocked her business and increased her sales. Her goal is to expand her business and to sell seafood in order to increase her sales.
Maria Oberlina belongs to the Ilusi√≥n communal bank, which has four members. She is the coordinator of the group. She is the one in the photo wearing a white blouse, and she is the second one going from right to left.
The other three members are requesting their first loan for 7,000 lempiras each. They are Maria Issela (gray shirt, from left to right), followed by Crist√≥bal, and on the right side is Ver√≥nica Maria in a pink blouse. They buy and sell merchandise like clothes, shoes, and cosmetics, etc.

loan.use: to buy supplies to make food like meats and snacks.

loan.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es: EL Banco Comuna El Triunfo est√° conformado por 9 emprendedores que son de las misma localidad donde habitan, cada uno de los emprendedores tiene sus negocios su objetivo de este grupo es bastecerse de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes y brindar un mejor servicio. Maria Jes√∫s es una emprendedora que es parte de este grupo de emprendedores que d√≠a a d√≠a lucha por salir adelante con sus negocios, la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de golosinas y refrescos el cr√©dito que esta solicitando lo necesita para invertir m√°s en el negocio, ella comprara variedad de golosinas, variedad de frutas para los frescos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Triunfo" [The Triumph] is made up of 9 entrepreneurs who live in the same area where they are from. Each one of the entrepreneurs has their own business. The group's objective is to supply products for their clients and provide a better service.
Maria Jes√∫s is an entrepreneur who is part of this enterprising group that strives on a daily basis to get ahead in their businesses. She sells snacks and fruit beverages. The loan will be used to invest more in her business. She will buy a variety of snacks and fruits for beverages.

loan.use: to buy snacks and a variety of fruits for beverages.

loan.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Se√±or de Luren, tiene 65 a√±os de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de picarones, es socia de Finca Per√∫ desde hace ya 6 a√±os, pudo aprender a ser mas responsable, la puntualidad y lo que mas le gusta es que puede ahorrar, para ella eso tiene mucho valor se pone metas para poder usar ese dinero, trata de hacer las cosas correctas, esta muy feliz en Finca, ahora el pr√©stamo lo invertir√° una parte para su negocio y para la enfermedad de su hermano.
texts.en: Irene is a member of the ‚ÄúMr. Luren‚Äù Community Bank. She is 65 years old. She sells fried bread. She has been a member of ‚ÄúProperty of Per√∫‚Äù for the past six years. She has learned how to be more responsible and punctual. What she likes the best about this organization is that she can save money. This is really important to her. She has goals for the use of this money. She tries to do the right thing. She is very happy with ‚ÄúProperty of Peru‚Äù. She will invest the money from this loan in her business and also in the health of her child.

loan.use: to buy products for her business.

loan.name: Maria Emperatriz

texts.es: Mar√≠a es socia del Banco Comunal Se√±or de Luren, tiene 20 a√±os de edad, es madre de un ni√±o, ella vende Salchipapas, es socia de Finca Per√∫ desde hace 1 a√±o y medio y en este corto tiempo y la corta edad que tienen pudo aprender muchas cosas que le sirvieron para poder tener un negocio, Mar√≠a antes de entrar a Finca no trabajaba, aqu√≠ le ense√±aron el valor que tiene el trabajo, y que tiene que ser autosuficiente, ahora es madre y trabaja mucho para darle lo necesario a su hijo y valora la oportunidad que le dieron cuando ella no tenia nada. Ahora el pr√©stamo lo invertir√° en la compra de papa, y para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mar√≠a is a member of the Se√±or de Luren communal bank. She is 20 years old, and she has one child. She sells ‚Äúsalchipapas‚Äù (fried potatoes and fried sausages).
She has been a member of Finca Per√∫ for one and a half years. During this short time, and at her young age, she was able to learn a lot of things that helped her be able to have a business.
Mar√≠a did not work before she joined Finca. Here they taught her the value of work and that she needs to be self-sufficient. She is now a mother, and she works a lot in order to give her son the necessities. She values the opportunity that she was given when she had nothing.
Now she will use the loan to buy potatoes and to pay for her education.

loan.use: to buy potatoes for her business.

loan.name: Norma Gladys

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal ‚Äúlas Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II‚Äù ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia Az√°ngaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 24 a√±os de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos, la se√±ora estudio educaci√≥n secundaria.
Su primer pr√©stamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirti√≥ en su negocio venta de animales como chanchos, ovejas, trabaja hace a√±o y medio con Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
Con su nuevo pr√©stamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, utilizar√° para comprar tres ovejas, chanchos para su respectivo engorde por dos meses, los animales lo compra y lo vende de Taraco, la se√±ora sola trabaja ya que su esposo trabaja en transporte.
Su sue√±o para el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes bien implementada.
Lo que m√°s le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la responsabilidad y el compa√±erismo con las socias.
texts.en: Norma is a member of the ‚ÄúWomen of Santa Rosa of Arapa II‚Äù Community Bank. It is located in the Arapa District, in the Az√°ngaro Province, in the department of Puno. She is 24 years old, married and has two children who are in secondary school. Her first loan was for 500.00 new soles. This money she used to buy animals such as pigs and sheep. She has been working with the Manuel Ramos Movement for the past year and a half. With this new loan of 1,000.00 new soles, she will buy three sheep. She will fatten them up for two months. She buys and sells animals in Taraco. Norma works alone as her husband works in the transportation business. Her dream for the future is to have a well-stocked grocery store. What she likes the best about the community bank is being responsible and the companionship of the other members.

loan.use: to buy three sheep that she will fatten up for two months.

loan.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. Jessie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy more inventory of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Jessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jessie hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loan.name: Necolasita

texts.en: Necolasita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. Necolasita has a shop that sells clothing like blouses and t-shirts. She is also making and selling homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy clothing for her shop and ingredients needed for making homemade sausage. Necolasita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Necolasita hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy clothing and ingredients needed for making homemade sausage

loan.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. Corazon has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Corazon hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loan.name: Nancy Marisol

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal ‚ÄúLas Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II‚Äù ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia Az√°ngaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 a√±os de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo, la se√±ora realizo estudios de educaci√≥n superior.
Desde hace 6 meses trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer pr√©stamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que increment√≥ en su negocio de cabinas de internet, servicios de copias, juegos y venta de libros, cuadernos, etc.
Solicitar√° un nuevo pr√©stamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, con la que comprara √∫tiles escolares para abastecer su negocio, ella recibe apoyo de su esposo.
Su sue√±o para el futuro es prosperar en el negocio y crecer.
Lo que m√°s le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las charlas de capacitaci√≥n.
texts.en: Nancy is a member of the ‚ÄúWomen of Santa Rosa of Arapa II‚Äù Community Bank. It is located in the Arapa District, in the Az√°ngaro Province, in the department of Puno. She is 27 years old, single and has a child who is studying in higher education. For the past six months she has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her first loan was for 500.00 new soles, money that she used to support her business that includes internet booths, a copier service and a bookstore where she buys and sells books and notebooks, etc. She is asking for a new loan of 500.00 new soles, which she will use to buy school supplies in order to grow her business. She has the support of her husband. Her dream for the future is to increase her business so it is prosperous. What she likes the most about the communal bank is it‚Äôs capacity building talks.

loan.use: to buy school supplies.

loan.name: Manilyn

texts.en: Manilyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Manilyn has a bakeshop that sells breads, pastries, and cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making breads and pastries. Manilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Manilyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads and pastries

loan.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Maria has a barbecue shop that makes and sells chicken and pork barbecue. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue. Maria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue

loan.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Flora has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages, and firewood. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks, and firewood to sell. Flora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Flora hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and firewood to sell

loan.name: Rosa Clotilde

texts.es:
La Se√±ora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, parroquia que es reconocida por la belleza de su naturaleza , su gente se dedica a la cr√≠a de animales, agricultura, comercio y muchos labora en la ciudad de Cuenca en varias actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.
Do√±a Rosa tiene 41 a√±os, es casada y ha concebido 3 hijos, dos son casados e independientes y su hija soltera trabaja y le ayuda econ√≥micamente. Su esposo es maestro carpintero y labora en un taller, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
Do√±a Rosa nos comenta que se encuentra muy bien en su salud al igual que est√°n todos los miembros de su familia. Ella labora como empleada domestica y en su casa se dedica a la cr√≠a de pollos negocio en el que le va bien, labora en estas actividades para aportar a la econom√≠a de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia.
El dinero de su cr√©dito anterior lo invirti√≥ en la compra de cerdos y su alimento y como le va bien en la crianza de estos animalitos est√° pidiendo un nuevo cr√©dito el mismo que lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cerdos para crecer m√°s en este negocio. En el pago de su cr√©dito anterior no tuvo ninguna dificultad realizando la cancelaci√≥n a la fecha. La banca comunal le gusta por la facilidad de los cr√©ditos y la atenci√≥n personalizada que les brindan los promotores de cr√©dito.
Su meta es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Siempre Amigas" communal bank. She lives in the El Valle parish in Cuenca. This parish is known for its beautiful natural surroundings. Its inhabitants devote themselves to raising animals, farming, and commerce. Many of them work at various business activities in Cuenca. They maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.
Rosa is 41, married, and has three children. Two are married and independent, and her unmarried daughter works and helps her financially. Her husband is a master carpenter, and he works in a workshop. They own the house where they live.
Rosa tells us that she is in very good health, the same as all the rest of her family members. She works as a domestic employee, and she raises chickens at her house. The business is going well for her. She works at these business activities in order to contribute to the household finances and to get her family ahead.
She used the previous loan to buy pigs and feed for them. As raising these animals is going well for her, she is requesting a new loan. She will use it to buy chickens and pigs in order for her business to grow. She did not have any difficulty paying the previous loan on time. She likes the communal bank because of the easy terms of the loans and for the personalized attention the loan facilitators provide.
Her goal is to fix her house.

loan.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loan.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: Mujeres Unidas es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Curuguaty, est√°n actualmente en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundaci√≥n paraguaya. Ellas han visto en estte programa una gran oportunidad en sus proyectos de vida, y desean poder mejorar las condiciones de sus hijos y familiares, y es por ello que siempre se esfuerzan. Myrian trabaja todos los d√≠as en la lavander√≠a que tiene en su casa. Nos comenta que empez√≥ con unas cuantas maquinas, y que luego gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicaci√≥n ha podido ir creciendo y de esa forma ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de ser posible ayudar a sus vecinos con fuentes de trabajo. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de jab√≥n, enjuagues, suavizantes y dem√°s insumos necesarios para poder seguir trabajando y ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas (Women United) is a group that was formed in the city of Curuguaty and is currently in its second loan cycle with the program for female entrepreneurs from the Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya. They have seen in this program a great opportunity for their prospects in life, and they would like to be able to improve conditions for their children and relatives, and for this they are always striving.
Myrian works every day in the Laundromat that she has in her house. She told us that she started with a few machines and later, thanks to her effort and dedication, she was able to improve on this by offering better accomodations to her customers. Her goal is to continue to grow and to make it possible to provide her neighbors with sources of work.
She is asking for the credit to buy soap, rinses, softeners and other supplies necessary to continue working and offering good service to her customers.

loan.use: to buy supplies for the laundromat.

loan.name: Menas Feliciana

texts.es:
Menas es socia del Banco Comunal ‚Äúlas Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II‚Äù ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia Az√°ngaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 63 a√±os de edad, est√° casada y tiene doce hijos, todos independientes, la se√±ora no tiene estudios.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos a√±os, su primer pr√©stamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utiliz√≥ en su negocio de venta de animales.
Solicitar√° un nuevo pr√©stamo por la suma de S/. 2,000.00 nuevo soles, con la que comprar√° toros para su respectivo engorde por tres meses, para luego venderlos a buen precio. Tambi√©n se dedican a la venta de productos de la regi√≥n, en el negocio le ayuda su esposo.
Su sue√±o para el futuro es seguir con el negocio y crecer dia a dia.
Lo que m√°s le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del pr√©stamo.
texts.en:
Menas is a member of the ‚Äúlas Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II‚Äù communal bank, located within the Arapa district, part of the Az√°ngaro province and Puno department. She‚Äôs 63 years old, married and has twelve children, all adults now. She does not have a formal education.
She‚Äôs been working with ‚ÄúMovimiento Manuela Ramos‚Äù for two years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used for her animal sales business.
She‚Äôs requesting a new loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN, which she will use to buy bulls to fatten up for three months and then sell for a good price. She also sells regional products. Her husband helps her with her business.
Her dream for the future is to continue with her business and growing it daily.
What she enjoys most about the communal bank is the ease of obtaining loans.

loan.use: to buy bulls to fatten up and sell.

loan.name: Esperanza Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: La Alcanc√≠a Comunal ‚ÄúEsperanza Para El Futuro‚Äù es un grupo conformado por 11 socios, la cual llevan 08 meses trabajando con el Programa-Prosperidad siendo Favio el tesorero del grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad. Favio tiene 31 a√±os de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos a√∫n dependientes. El Sr. Favio cuenta con una mototaxi la cual brinda servicio de transporte, lleva trabajando de esta manera hace mas de 10 a√±os, lo que pudo ahorrar con dicho trabajo, y as√≠ cumplir una de sus metas, ya que hace poco tiempo se compro un carro la cual le brinda mayores ganancias. Gracias a su arduo trabajo y dedicaci√≥n Favio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, pues ellos han sido su motivo para seguir progresando. En esta oportunidad solicito el cr√©dito para el mantenimiento de su carro. El deseo de Favio es de comprarse otro carro, y as√≠ alquilarlo como servicio de transporte. La Alcanc√≠a Comunal ‚ÄúEsperanza Para El Futuro‚Äù est√°n agradecidos y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien.
texts.en:
The communal bank ‚ÄúEsperanza Para El Futuro‚Äù [Hope for the Future] has 11 members, who have been working with the Prosperity Program for 8 months. Favio is the group's treasurer, a position he has filled responsibly. Favio is 31 years old and lives with his 2 dependent children. Favio has a motorcycle taxi with which he offers transportation service. For more than 10 years, he has worked in this business, which allowed him to save and achieve one of his goals. Recently, he bought a car, which brings him higher profits.
With hard work and dedication, Favio has been able to support his family, and they have been his motive to continue moving forward. At this time, he has requested a loan to maintain his car. Favio's wish is to buy another car, so that he can hire it out it for transportation service. The members of the communal bank ‚ÄúEsperanza Para El Futuro‚Äù are grateful and promise to continue working hard.

loan.use: to maintain his car.

loan.name: Oloitiefu

texts.en:
Oloitiefu is 54 years old and has 2 children. She owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has 1 year of experience in this business.
Oloitiefu needs a loan of 1000 Samoan talas (WST) to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas, or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.
Oloitiefu joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Oloitiefu's first loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loan.name: Selau

texts.en:
Selau is 39 years old and has 7 children. She owns and operates a business venture running bingo games. She has 2 years of experience in this business.
Selau needs a loan of 1000 Samoan talas (WST) to purchase game prizes such as boxes of noodles, mosquito coils (mosquito-repelling incense), boxes of chicken, and bags of rice. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas, or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.
Selau joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Selau's first loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase game prizes such as boxes of noodles, mosquito coils, boxes of chicken, and bags of rice.

loan.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a young man and a master of baking traditional bread. He works in someone else's bakery, and his boss pays him 50 somoni per day, on average, depending on the number of baked flat-breads. Ahmad has been a baker for 10 years, which is why he makes tasty breads that always sell well at the market. He would like to repair his apartment, which is currently in a very bad state. After working as a baker for all these years, he has been unable to find a solution to this problem on his own. This is why he would like to obtain a loan, repair his apartment, and then gradually pay back the money.

loan.use: to repair his apartment

loan.name: Juan

texts.es: El se√±or Juan, trabaja como chofer asalariado en un sindicato de trasporte publico en la ciudad de La Paz. El cr√©dito lo requiere para la construcci√≥n de una habitaci√≥n para dar m√°s comodidad a su familia. Juan, es casado y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona Kenanipata en la ciudad de El Alto. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Juan, works as a salaried driver for the public transporation union in the city of La Paz. He needs the loan for the contruction of a room to give his family more comfort. Juan is married and has two children with whom he lives in his in-law's home in the Kenanipata area of the city of El Alto. This is the first time that he is working with IMPRO and Kiva.

loan.use: to build a room for the comfort of his family.

loan.name: Traice

texts.es:
Traice 600000 colones
Traice tiene 28 a√±os de edad, en este momento su beb√© tiene 4 meses y vive con su esposo Greivin, en la casa de sus padres. Es una joven emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superaci√≥n, termino la carrera de Terapia F√≠sica en la Universidad, pero ante la dificultad de conseguir empleo, est√° trabajando en un oficio que aprendi√≥ hace mas de 10 a√±os, el arreglo de u√±as de pies y manos y actualmente se est√° especializando en la el arte de u√±as artificiales.
Se enter√≥ de Fundaci√≥n Mujer por medio de una visita realizada a la Oficina de la Mujer en la Municipalidad de Puntarenas, vive en la zona de Carrizal de Puntarenas en la costa del Pac√≠fico Central de Costa Rica, ella se ha estado capacitando en el arte de las u√±as artificiales y desea invertir el pr√©stamo en la compra de materiales para esta nueva labor, la cual le va a incrementar los ingresos y espera continuar ahorrando para apoyar a su familia y poner un local en el futuro. Desea ofrecerle a su hijo la oportunidad de contar con una buena calidad de vida. Por la ma√±ana atiende los oficios de la casa y en la tarde empiezan a llegar las clientas o va a visitarlas a domicilio. Con este pr√©stamo, la solicitante va a adquirir materiales para su negocio y continuar capacit√°ndose para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes El impacto del cr√©dito es de suma importancia, ya que les da la oportunidad de comprar materia prima y apoyar a su familia ahorrando para alquilar una casa, su moral de pago se muestra excelente, y las recomendaciones que presenta la acreditan como una persona horada y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Traice is 28 years old. She now has a 4 month-old baby, and she lives with her husband, Greivin in her parents' home. She is an enterprising young woman who has a great desire to improve herself. She finished a university degree in physical therapy but, faced with difficulty finding work, she is now working in a trade that she learned more than 10 years ago, offering manicures and pedicures. Now she is specializing in the art of artificial nails.
Tracie found out about Fundaci√≥n Mujer through a visit to a Women's Office in the town of Puntarenas. Tracie lives in Carrizal district, in Puntarenas, on the Central Pacific coast of Costa Rica. She has been training in the art of doing artificial nails and she wants to invest this loan in the purchase of supplies for this new endeavor, which should increase her income. She hopes to continue saving so that she can support her family and establish her own shop in the future.
She wants to provide her child with the opportunity to have a good quality life. In the morning, she takes care of her housework and, in the afternoon, either her customers start to arrive or she goes to visit them at home. With this loan, she will buy supplies for her business and continue to undergo training so that she can improve her service to her customers. The impact of this loan is of utmost important since it will give Tracie the opportunity to buy supplies and to support her family, saving up so that she can rent a house. Her repayment behavior is excellent and the references she has provided show her to be an honest and hard-working person.

loan.use: to invest in supplies for her manicure/pedicure business, and to take training classes in this same line of work.

loan.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
Elvira has a toy shop where she sells toy guns, cars, and mini-cartoon-character figures. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more stock (children's toys) for resale.
Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy more stock (children's toys) for resale

loan.name: Madeleine Maria Blanco Laguna

texts.es: Madeleine de 43 a√±os, es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 11 a 17 a√±os. Ella tiene un almac√©n de repuestos para motocicletas, actividad comercial que inici√≥ con un compadre de su esposo, con quien emprendi√≥ este negocio hace 9 a√±os, cuando su compadre aport√≥ la mayor parte del dinero y ella y su esposo el local y la administraci√≥n del mismo. Desde hace 3 a√±os su antiguo socio decidi√≥ invertir en otra actividad y le vendi√≥ su parte, para que su esposo y ella continuaran con el almac√©n. En la actualidad su negocio le produce lo necesario para el sostenimiento del hogar y se dedican tambi√©n a ganar comisiones por la venta de motocicletas, actividad en la que est√° totalmente encargado su esposo. En su negocio lo mas representativo, son las buenas relaciones que tienen en su entorno, con sus clientes y proveedores, pero en la medida en que su clientela crece, su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente, esta es la raz√≥n por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer cr√©dito que hace a la Fundaci√≥n Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprar√°, llantas, neum√°ticos , accesorios de lujos, pues son los productos de mayor rotaci√≥n y que requiere tener un inventario adicional, para responder efectivamente a su clientela. La fortaleza de este negocio es su estrat√©gica ubicaci√≥n, lo que potencializa el incremento de su venta, pues queda en la avenida principal del municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno, municipio del departamento de Bol√≠var.
texts.en:
Madeleine is 43 years old, married, and has three children with ages ranging from 11 to 17 years old. She has a motorcycle parts store, a business she started with her husband's friend nine years ago. At the time, her husband's friend contributed most of the funds while she and her husband provided the locale and administration of the business. Three years ago, their associate decided to invest in a different activity and sold his stake for them to continue with the store.
At present, their business provides them with what they need to support their home. They also earn commissions from motorcycle sales, which her husband is responsible for. Their business is mostly known for their good relationship with their surroundings, customers, and suppliers. As their clientele has grown, they have found their working capital to be insufficient. This is the reason why they have requested a credit, their first with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. The loan will be used to buy tires, inner tubes of tires, and luxury accessories. She finds that these products have the highest turnover and she needs additional inventory to effectively meet her customers' demand.
The strength of this business lies in its strategic location, which can potentially increase their sales since it lies in principal avenue of the San Juan Nepomuceno municipality in the department of Bolivar.

loan.use: to buy tires, inner tubes of tires, and luxury accessories which are the products with highest turnover.

loan.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
Arcelie has a shop where she sells charcoal made from coconut shells and wood by the sack. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed for charcoal-making.
Arcelie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy materials needed for charcoal-making

loan.name: Faaloiloia

texts.en:
Faaloiloia is 30 years old and has three children.
Faaloiloia owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. Faaloiloia needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase sacks of flour, sugar and baking powder. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 340 talas or US $142 per week) to improve and expand her business.
In 2012, Faaloiloia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Faaloiloia's first loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sugar, and baking powder.

loan.name: Fala

texts.en:
Fala is 46 years old and has two children.
Fala owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Fala needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand her business.
In 2012, Fala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Fala's first loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loan.name: Anara

texts.en: Anara is 59 years old and married. She raises livestock to provide a source of income for her family. Her farm, which she started during the Soviet period with 20,000 som, today earns around 20,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. In order to continue developing her business, Anara has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase two calves for fattening and subsequent resale. Anara plans to invest her profits into further livestock purchases.

loan.use: to purchase livestock

loan.name: La Imaculada (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Inmaculada est√° conformado por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes desempe√±an sus labores diarias en diferentes plazas de trabajo, las mismas que les permiten aportar a la econom√≠a de sus hogares y solventar sus gastos, se caracterizan por ser personas amables, gentiles y cordiales, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, en este lugar se goza de una excelente vista de la naturaleza, desde su centro parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cr√≠a de animales y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Se√±ora. Rosa Cristina, tiene 36 a√±os de edad, es madre soltera de 5 hijos que tienen 18, 16, 13, 11 y 9 a√±os de edad, sus tres primeros hijos est√°n estudiando en el colegio y sus dos √∫ltimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
Do√±a Rosa Cristina hace 8 a√±os labora como empleada domestica, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la ma√±ana hasta las 5 de la tarde. En su casa se dedica a la cr√≠a de animales como cerdos, borregos, gallinas y cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad, tambi√©n se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar.
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 7 a√±os y su nuevo cr√©dito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos.
Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Inmaculada comprises 1 male and 6 female members. They work daily at different jobs that allow them to economically support their households and pay their expenses. The members are friendly, kind, and cordial, in keeping with the culture and traditions of their towns. They live in Santa Ana parish in Cuenca. The area enjoys a beautiful view of nature. From the parish center, you can admire the view of a large part of the city of Cuenca. The people farm, raise animals, and do different activities in the city.
Rosa Cristina is one of the group's members.She is 36 years old and the single mother of 5 children, who are 18, 16, 13, 11 y 9 years old. Her three oldest children are attending high school, and the two youngest study at a small neighborhood school. She owns the house in which she lives.
Rosa Cristina has been a maid for 8 years. She works Monday to Friday from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. At home, she raises animals such as pigs, sheep, chicken, and guinea pigs, which she sells in her community. She also farms, and what she harvests is only for consumption at home.
She has been a member of the communal bank for 7 years, and this new loan is to buy pigs. Her goal is to finish her house.

loan.use: to buy pigs.

loan.name: Progresar Al Futuro (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Progresar al Futuro est√° formado por 4 socias y 3 socios, quienes diariamente laboran en diferentes actividades econ√≥micas las que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares. Viven en el cant√≥n de Paute ubicado al noreste de la provincia del Azuay, su clima es sub-tropical-templado y sus paisajes se ha constituido en un lugar tradicionalmente tur√≠stico. Se encuentra ba√±ada por los r√≠os Paute y Culticay, que hacen que sea un cant√≥n pr√≥spero productor de frutas, flores y ca√±a de az√∫car. Su gente tambi√©n mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Se√±ora. Rosa Mar√≠a, tiene 28 a√±os, vive en uni√≥n libre y ha concebido un beb√© de 10 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como alba√±il, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
La Se√±ora. Rosa Mar√≠a se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, a cuidar de su hijo y a criar cuyes a los mismos que los vende en su comunidad.
Se encuentra en su segundo cr√©dito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, su nuevo cr√©dito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con la cr√≠a de estos animales.
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The "Progresar al Futuro" ("Progress to the Future") community bank has four female and three male members, who work in different economic activities, which allow them to meet their living expenses. They live in Paute, which is in the northeast of the province of Azuay in Ecuador. The climate is sub-tropical-temperate, and the beautiful countryside is a traditional tourist destination. The area is bathed by the Paute and Culticay rivers, which make it a rich region for growing fruit, flowers, and sugar cane. The people also maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.
Rosa Mar√≠a, 28, is one of the group's members. She lives with her partner and has a 10-month-old baby. Her partner works as a builder. They do not have their own home but live in a rented premise.
Rosa Mar√≠a looks after the needs of their home, caring for their son and raising guinea pigs that she then sells within the community.
This is her second loan with the community bank, which a friend invited her to join. She will use the funding to buy chickens so she can start to raise these animals. Her dream is to have her own house.

loan.use: to buy chickens.

loan.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.
Luna has a shop where she sells charcoal made from coco shells and wood by the sack. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy coco shells and wood for making charcoal.
Luna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy coco shells and wood for making charcoal.

loan.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children.
Jocelyn has a shop where she sells charcoal made from coco shells and wood charcoal by the sack. She had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy coco shells and wood for making charcoal.
Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy coco shells and wood for making charcoal.

loan.name: Domingga's Group

texts.en:
Domingga is married with 5 adult children. She is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Domingga is a farmer and specializes in rice production to earn a living. She has been doing this work for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizer.
Domingga has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she wants to have her own rice mill.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizer

loan.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.
Mila has a shop where she sells gasoline and kerosene by the liter. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more gallons of gasoline for resale.
Mila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy gallons of gasoline for resale

loan.name: Antoney Maregwa Mucira

texts.en: Antoney is 42 years old, married and has four children. He runs a cereals store to earn a living, has been in the business for one year and now employs six people. He describes his customers as low income earners who live in slums. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan for 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy cereals to sell.

loan.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loan.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es: El comit√© San Ram√≥n se form√≥ con la uni√≥n de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santan√≠. Todas las integrantes del comit√© desarrollan actividades independientes, pero tambi√©n actividades en grupo, para que de esa forma puedan fomentar su compa√±erismo y trabajo en equipo. Fatima tiene una peluquer√≠a, y nos dice que gracias a la buena atenci√≥n que da a sus clientes, puede seguir creciendo, pues son los mismos clientes los que le hacen publicidad. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy emprendedora, que desea salir adelante por medio de su trabajo. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para abastecer su negocio con los insumos que mas vende d√≠a a d√≠a. Ella al igual que su grupo esta muy contentos por la oportunidad que la fundaci√≥n y kiva le han dado.
texts.en:
The San Ram√≥n committee is made up of a bunch of neighbors in the city of Santan√≠. All the committee members work separately, but they also have group activities, so that they can build their solidarity and work together as a team.
Fatima has a hair salon and tells us that, thanks to how well she treats her clients, her business should keep growing, since it is her own clients who advertise it for her. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who wants to get ahead through her work.
She is seeking a loan to stock her business with the goods that she sells the most of every day. She, like the other members of her group, is very pleased with the opportunity that microfinance partner the Fundac√≠on Paraguaya and Kiva have given her.

loan.use: to buy stock for her business.

loan.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mary Joy is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and three children. She earns a living by running a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years, and is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers. Mary Joy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is married and has one child. She is 23 years old and lives in Caputol, Aloran. She earns a living as a farmer who grows vegetables. She has been doing this for one year, and has has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional fertilizer to use on her crops. Irene has been a member of PMPC for nine months and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loan.use: to buy additional fertilizer to use on her crops.

loan.name: Maripeth

texts.en: Maripeth is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has four children. She earns a living by running a food shop (or carenderia) where she sells dishes such as pancit bihon and chicken pork adobo. Maripeth has been in this business for three years and is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients to make more dishes to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010 and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loan.use: to buy ingredients for making food to sell.

loan.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame MARIAMA est √¢g√©e de 45 ans, mari√©e et m√®re de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Darsalam de S√©gou. MARIAMA n‚Äôa pas fr√©quent√© l‚Äô√©cole pour des raisons sociales, issue d‚Äôune famille ancr√©e dans les valeurs ancestrales. MARIAMA commen√ßa tr√®s vite √† s‚Äôint√©resser aux activit√©s g√©n√©ratrices de revenus tels l‚Äôachat vente des produits de l‚Äôaviculture : oeufs, poulets. Elle m√®ne cette activit√© depuis 15 ans et jouit d‚Äôune grande exp√©rience et client√®le. Dans le souci d‚Äôaugmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de b√©n√©fice, elle sollicite ce pr√™t. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 12 mois, apr√®s 1 pr√™t individuel bien rembours√©, elle est √† son 2√®me pr√™t individuel qu‚Äôelle compte utiliser pour acheter, 286 alv√©oles d'oeufs. Elle s‚Äôapprovisionne dans les fermes de son mari et autres et effectue ses ventes toujours au comptant √† une client√®le mixte. Avec ce pr√™t elle envisage r√©aliser un b√©n√©fice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce b√©n√©fice lui permettra de rembourser son pr√™t et subvenir aux d√©penses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariama is 45 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She lives in a traditional family in the Darsalam district of S√©gou.
Mariama did not attend school because of social reasons; she comes from a family rooted in ancestor values. At a very young age, Mariama became interested in profitable work like buying and selling poultry products such as eggs and chickens.
She has been doing this type of work for 15 years, and she enjoys having a great deal of experience and a large clientele.
In the hopes of building up her business and to make more profit, she is requesting a loan. She has been involved with Soro Yiriwaso for 12 months. After having paid back one individual loan, she is on her second individual loan which she plans to use to buy 286 egg cartons. She gets her supplies from her husband's farm and makes her sales, always in cash, to a mixed clientele. With this loan she foresees making a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to meet family expenses.

loan.use: to buy eggs

loan.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es: El comit√© santa Isabel es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por 15 mujeres, todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas forman parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundaci√≥n paraguaya, y han visto en ella una gran oportunidad de progreso para ellas y sus familias. Unas de las miembros de este trabajador grupo es la se√±ora Felicita, quien trabaja en la venta de helados, desde hace ya un tiempo. Ella comenta que empez√≥ con un peque√±a venta, pero que luego, con el correr del tiempo y gracias a su trabajo ha podido crecer y mejorar su local. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo con su trabajo y en miras a ello es que solicita el cr√©dito, para la compra de helados, con lo que abastecer√° su stock, ya que es √©poca de calor y tiene muchos clientes.
texts.en:
The Santa Isabel committee comes from the city of San Lorenzo. Its membership consists of fifteen women, all of whom are friends and neighbors. They are part of a program for working women conducted by microfinance partner the Fundac√≠on Paraguaya and see this program as a great opportunity for them and their families to make progress in life.
Felicita is one of the members of the group. She has been selling ice cream for some time. She notes that she started with a small stand, but over time and thanks to her hard work, she has succeeded in increasing and improving her premises. Her dream is to keep her business growing, and for this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy ice cream so that she can increase her stock, since it is now the hot season, and she has lots of clients.

loan.use: to buy ice cream for resale.

loan.name: Rufina Butalid

texts.en: Rufina is married and has two adult-aged children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines, where she earns a living as a farmer. She supplements her income by processing charcoal. She has been in these lines of work for 20 years and has applied for a loan for PHP 35,000 to buy materials such as coconut shells, which she uses for charcoal processing. Rufina has been a member of PMPC for four years and wants to make her businesses more successful in the future.

loan.use: to buy coconut shells for charcoal processing.

loan.name: Utumalie

texts.en:
Utumalie is 35 years of age and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business.
Utumalie needs a loan of 2000 Samoan talas (WST) to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas, or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.
Utumalie joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Utumalie's third loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loan.name: San Damian Group

texts.es: El comit√© se Denomina San Damian est√°n en el Primer Ciclo con 12 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias y responsable las unas con las otras. Ellas realizan actividades para la recaudaci√≥n de fondos para el grupo, para que de esa forma tengan un fondo para afrontar cualquier inconveniente. Marta es la presidenta del grupo, y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo y que gracias a su arduo trabajo y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante e ir progresando. Comenta que su sue√±o es poder tener un local grande donde pueda tener m√°s variedad de ropas para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de prendas, con las cuales quiere surtirse y de esa forma poder seguir teniendo los ingresos para mantener a su familia. Ella, como el grupo agradecen a la fundaci√≥n por la oportunidad recibida.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Damian is in its first loan cycle and has 12 members. The group stands out in the neighborhood for being united, caring, and responsible for one another. They do activities to raise money for the group so that they have a fund to meet any problem.
Marta is the group's president. She told us that she sells all types of garments. With hard work and sacrifice, she has supported herself and continues to make progress. She says her dream is to have a larger space, where she can offer a wider variety of clothing to her clients.
She requests the loan to buy garments, with which she will restock and in this way be able to maintain her income and support her family. She, like the rest of the group, is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity.

loan.use: to buy garments to sell.

loan.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es: El Comit√© " Virgen de F√°tima " lo integran 11 mujeres, quienes se encuentran en el tercer ciclo. Todas son muy trabajadoras y de condici√≥n humilde, el comit√© est√° situado en el barrio Virgen de F√°tima de la ciudad de Curuguaty. Cecilia es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser de vestir, de sport y dem√°s. Comenta que empez√≥ con muy poco, pero que gracias a su sacrificio hoy en d√≠a ya es una buena microempresaria que sobresale. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de prendas de vestir√°, con lo cual podr√° abastecerse y de esa forma estar preparada para los pedidos de sus clientes. El comit√© est√° muy agradecido por la oportunidad que est√° recibiendo por parte de fundaci√≥n paraguaya y de Kiva.
texts.en:
The ‚ÄúVirgen de F√°tima‚Äù committee is composed of eleven women who are in the third cycle. They are all very hard working and of humble resources. The committee is located in the city of Curuguaty‚Äôs Virgen de F√°tima neighborhood.
Cecilia is one of the group members. She sells all sorts of clothes; dress, sport and others. She comments that she started out with very little but thanks to her sacrifice today she is a good micro businesswoman who stands out.
She requested the loan to buy clothes to stock up so that she can be prepared for customer orders. The committee is very grateful for this opportunity they are receiving from Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya and from Kiva.

loan.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Josephine has a food shop that sells viands like chicken and pork adobo, pancit guisado, and vegetable saute. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell. Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loan.name: Santos Danilo

texts.es: El se√±or Danilo tiene 40 a√±os de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijas, su esposa es ama de casa, es una familia muy unida y responsable, desde hace 18 a√±os don Danilo se dedica al cultivo de caf√©, comenz√≥ trabajando con su padre que le ense√±o desde muy peque√±o a cultivar caf√©. Las siembras las hacen por temporadas y cuando esta la cosecha el horario de trabajo es de todo el d√≠a y parte de la noche. El pr√©stamo lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes, seria una muy buena oportunidad ya que de lo contrario tendr√≠a que comprometer la cosecha con intermediarios que se aprovechan a comprar el producto a un bajo precio. Algunos de los problemas que enfrenta don Danilo son la escasa mano de obra y el dif√≠cil traslado del producto. Uno de sus sue√±os es mejorar la finca para tener una mejor producci√≥n de caf√©. Este es el primer financiamiento que obtiene don Danilo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Danilo is 40 years old, married, and has two daughters. His wife is a homemaker and they are a very close and responsible family. Danilo has been growing coffee for 18 years. He started working with his father who taught him from an early age how to cultivate coffee. The planting is done seasonally and when it's harvest time, their schedule is to work during the whole day and part of the night.
The loan will be used to buy fertilizers. It would be a great opportunity for him. Otherwise, he would have to compromise the harvest with intermediaries who take advantage by buying the product at a low price. Some challenges that Danilo faces are the scarce manual labor and product transportation difficulties.
One of his dreams is to improve the farm to get a better coffee production. This is Danilo's first credit with FAMA [MFI] and he hopes to promptly fulfill his payments.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers for coffee cultivation.

loan.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: Renacer se llama el grupo formado en la ciudad de Asunci√≥n. Actualmente este comit√© se encuentra en su 20 ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las que integrantes, adem√°s de la responsabilidad en los pagos. Alda trabaja de cocinera, y nos comenta que trabaja en esto hace ya un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada, pues su comida es siempre bien aceptada por sus clientes. Ella se esfuerza siempre al m√°ximo para poder progresar y salir adelante por medio del duro trabajo que hace. Alda acude a la fundaci√≥n y a kiva para solicitar un cr√©dito, el cual desea invertir en la compra de los insumos que necesita para hacer los alimentos que vende. Necesita comprar carne, hortalizas, aderezos, y dem√°s.
texts.en:
The name of the group formed in the city of Asunci√≥n is ‚ÄúRenacer‚Äù (To Be Reborn). The committee is currently in its 20th cycle and it stands out because of its sense of responsibility and the wish each member has to make progress and also because of the responsibility with payments.
Alda works as a cook and she comments that she‚Äôs done this work for a good time now so she has a well-established clientele because her food is always well received by her customers. She strives to the maximum to be able to make progress and get ahead thanks to the hard work she does.
Alda is calling on the Fundaci√≥n and on Kiva to request a loan that she wants to use to buy ingredients she needs to make the food she sells. She needs to buy meat, vegetables, condiment, etc.

loan.use: to buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loan.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Silongon, Tudela. Emma has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for nine years.
Emma is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Emma has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loan.name: Johndriel

texts.en:
Johndriel is 27 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in the Philippines. Johndriel has a barber shop that provides hair cutting and shaving. He has had this business for six years.
Johndriel is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which he will use to buy materials needed for his barber shop. Johndriel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy materials needed for his barber shop.

loan.name: Unidas Group

texts.es: El Comit√© de Mujeres ‚ÄúUnidas‚Äù Empez√≥ a trabajar con la Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya desde el a√±o 2010 mediante la promoci√≥n hecha a la se√±ora Idalina quien invit√≥ y organizo a sus amigas y vecinas del barrio. El grupo actualmente est√° integrado por 12 mujeres que trabajan en forma conjunta y coordinada. Ellas son se√±oras muy unidas, responsables y solidarias. Sara vende chipas (Alimento t√≠pico paraguayo), y comenta que se dedica a esto hace ya un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Su producto es muy solicitado por sus clientes y es por ello que le va muy bien en esto. D√≠a a d√≠a se esfuerza m√°s y m√°s para poder ir creciendo y ayudando a su familia. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de chipas, con lo cual podr√° abastecerse y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Ellas est√°n muy agradecidas por la ayuda que est√°n recibiendo de kiva y fundaci√≥n paraguaya.
texts.en:
The ‚ÄúUnidas‚Äù (United) women‚Äôs committee started working with Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya in 2010 thanks to a promotion conducted by Idalina who invited and organized her friends and neighbors in the neighborhood. The group currently has 12 women members who work in a united, coordinated way. The women are very united, responsible and mutually supportive.
Sara sells chipas (traditional Paraguayan food) and comments that she‚Äôs been doing this for some time now so she has a well-established clientele. Her product is very sought after by her customers and this is why she does so well in this. Day to day she strives more and more to grow and to help her family.
She is asking for the loan to buy chipas to stock up and meet customer demand. They are very grateful for the help they are getting from Kiva and from Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya.

loan.use: to buy chipas [type of cornbread] to sell.

loan.name: Koreti

texts.en:
Koreti, a 53-year-old married mother of six, has been selling dried goods in the local community for five years. Koreti, who joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services, is requesting a loan of WST $2450 to purchase more raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This will be Koreti's fifth loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loan.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Evelyn has a charcoal business, which she has had for 20 years.
Evelyn is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more materials, such as coconut shells, for her charcoal processing business. Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more materials, such as coconut shells, for her charcoal processing business.

loan.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. Betty has a food shop that sells local delicacies like chicken and pork adobo, pancit guisado, and vegetable saute. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making dishes to sell. Betty has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Betty hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients

loan.name: Martin

texts.es: El Se√±or Martin, es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 38 a√±os de edad, es Propietario de un Taller de Chaper√≠a y Pintura en esa ciudad. Heredo la Profesi√≥n de su pap√°. Con el transcurso del tiempo y con sacrificio pudo montar su propio Taller, hoy en d√≠a cuenta con clientela formada y presta servicios a varias Playas de veh√≠culos, ya que el Se√±or es puntual y responsable con su trabajo. El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante y progresar, para que de esa forma pueda ayudar a su familia. El solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de pinturas Sint√©ticos, barniz, tinner y aguarras, lo cual le ayudar√° a seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder tener un poco mas de ingresos.
texts.en:
Martin is from the city of Villarrica. He‚Äôs 38 years old and owns a car detailing and painting shop in that city. He inherited the business from his father.
In time and with great effort he was able to set up his own workshop and today has a well-established clientele. He provides services to several car dealerships since he‚Äôs punctual and responsible with his work. He defines himself as a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead and make progress in order to help his family this way.
The loan he‚Äôs requesting is to buy synthetic paint, varnish, thinner and turpentine which will help him continue working in order to earn a bit more income.

loan.use: to buy supplies for his shop.

loan.name: Paulo Fretes

texts.es: El Sr Paulo es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, es Soltero, tiene 20 a√±os, vive con padres. Hace dos a√±os Habilito un negocio de ventas de celulares y adem√°s tiene ventas de Joyas de Plata. Tiene su local muy bien ubicado en el centro mismo de la ciudad por eso seg√∫n Paulo tiene buena clientela. Su sue√±o es tener un local propio y agrandar su negocio. Manifiesta que es joven, que tiene mucho por delante y que va seguir trabajando para lograr su objetivo. El mismo agradece a la Fundaci√≥n paraguaya por la confianza puesto en su persona y esta vez solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de joyas, con las cuales podr√° abastecer su negocio y de esa forma tener m√°s variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Paulo is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. He‚Äôs single, 20 years old and living with his parents. Two years ago he opened a mobile phone business and also sells silver jewelry. His store is very well located in the very center of the city so Paulo has a good clientele because of this. His dream is to have a locale of his own and to enlarge his business. He states that he‚Äôs young and has a lot still before him and that he will continue working to reach his objective.
He thanks Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya for the trust it‚Äôs placed in him and on this occasion he‚Äôs asking for a loan to buy jewelry to stock his store thus having more variety to offer his customers.

loan.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loan.name: Atele

texts.en:
Atele is 47 years old, married, and has five children. Atele plants and harvests taro for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Atele needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve/expand her business.
In 2011, Atele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Atele's second loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loan.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Philip provides transportation services using a motorcycle with a sidecar. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy tools and gasoline for his motorcycle. Philip has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Philip hopes to improve his services.

loan.use: to buy tools and gasoline

loan.name: Bolsa Negra Group

texts.es:
La A.C. ‚ÄúBOLSA NEGRA‚Äù iniciar√° el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada. Est√° compuesta por ocho integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra la se√±ora Sabina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociaci√≥n comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, macram√©, venta de cuadros pintados, venta de arroz, venta de salte√±as, venta de v√≠veres a cr√©dito.
La se√±ora Sabina, indica que forma parte de una asociaci√≥n comunal desde hace cinco a√±os atr√°s y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta comida, que viene trabajando hace a√±os. El cr√©dito de este ciclo es para ampliaci√≥n de su negocio (compra de muebles, mismos que ser√°n instalados en el espacio de venta) mismos que adquirir√° de las ferias pace√±as. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.
Cuando se le consulta qu√© le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y aprender.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Bolsa Negra" will begin its first loan cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada Regional Office. It is made up of eight members with a board of directors headed by Sabina. The members of the communal bank are involved in a variety of businesses, including: food sales, macrame, the sale of paintings, sale of rice, sale of meat pies and sales of provisions on credit.
Sabina indicates that she has been part of a communal bank for five years and is currently involved in the business of food sales that has been ongoing for years. The loan from this cycle is to enlarge her business (the purchase of furniture that will be installed in the sales space). The furniture will be acquired from markets in La Paz. This form of work allows her to support her family as she is married and has six children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and to learn.

loan.use: to purchase furniture.

loan.name: Rosalba

texts.es: La se√±ora Rosalba tiene 21 a√±os de edad, est√° acompa√±ada con el se√±or Alvaro, la pareja tiene un hijo de 8 meses. La Sra. Rosalba se dedica al macate desde hace 2 a√±os, en los primeros tiempos vend√≠a ropas para j√≥venes como ser pantalones y remeras, pero ahora est√° comercializando m√°s perfumes por el gran margen que le deja esta mercader√≠a. Le ayuda su pareja que cuenta con un veh√≠culo y recorren ciudades aleda√±as y est√°n consiguiendo aumentar su clientela. Solicita este pr√©stamo para la compra de perfumes de diferentes marcas y tama√±os, con esto le permitir√° cubrir todos los pedidos que tiene y as√≠ aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosalba, 21, lives with Alvaro and they have an 8 month old son. Rosalba has been working in retail for two years. When she started out she sold clothes for young adults like pants and t-shirts but now she‚Äôs selling perfume because it produces a higher profit margin. Her spouse who owns a vehicle helps her and they travel to neighboring cities and are managing to increase their clientele.
She is asking for this loan to buy various brands and sizes of perfume so that she can fill all the orders she has and thus increase her income.

loan.use: to buy items to sell.

loan.name: Victor

texts.es: V√≠ctor tiene 21 a√±os de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres y nos comenta que desde muy joven empez√≥ a trabajar primeramente como ayudante su t√≠o en la venta. V√≠ctor al cumplir su mayor√≠a de edad se compro una moto para as√≠ realizar las ventas y √©l mismo luego cobrar las comisiones debido a que las mercader√≠as eran de su t√≠o. Realiza varios kil√≥metros en su recorrido pues la venta lo realiza en las despensas de la zona, y en distintas ciudades, y a la noche estudio en una facultad nacional en su ciudad. Hoy en d√≠a cuenta con clientela formada, necesita el cr√©dito para la compra de especias, remedios yuyos, para que sea m√°s lucrativo su negocio, pues conoce el rubro.
texts.en:
V√≠ctor is 21 years old, single and living in his parents‚Äô house. He comments that he started working very young helping his uncle sell at the beginning.
When V√≠ctor became an adult he bought a motorcycle to do sales with and to collect commissions since the merchandise belonged to his uncle.
He travels several kilometers in his route because he sells to stores in the zone and in different cities and at night studies in one of the state colleges in his city. Today, he has a well-established clientele and needs a loan to buy spices and herbal remedies so that his business will be more lucrative since he knows this line of work.

loan.use: to buy spices and natural remedies to sell.

loan.name: Maximo

texts.es: El Sr. M√°ximo tiene 29 a√±os de edad, casado con la Sra. Angelina de 28 a√±os de edad, tienen una hermosa hija de 4 a√±os. El Sr. M√°ximo, se dedica a la fabricaci√≥n de muebles y tambi√©n a la venta ambulante de carb√≥n. Empez√≥ como ayudante en la fabricaci√≥n de muebles, hace 8 a√±os aproximadamente, y con el transcurrir de los a√±os fue adquiriendo los conocimientos para la fabricaci√≥n de muebles. M√°ximo desea ver crecer a su hija y convertirse en alguien en la vida y ser √∫til para la sociedad y para consigo misma y tambi√©n anhela de ir creciendo su negocio ya que es el sustento de su familia. El solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de materiales para los muebles que hace, como ser maderas, clavos, pegamentos y dem√°s. El esta contento por la ayuda que esta recibiendo por parte de la fundaci√≥n y de kiva.
texts.en: M√°ximo is 29 years old and married to Angelina, who is 28 years old. They have a beautiful 4-year-old daughter. M√°ximo works making furniture and also goes around selling charcoal. He started as an assistant in furniture making, approximately 8 years ago, and as the years passed he kept on acquiring the know-how to make furniture. M√°ximo wishes to see his daughter grow up and become someone in life and be of use to society and to herself. He also longs to grow his business since it supports his family. He is asking for the loan to buy materials for the furniture he makes; being wood, nails, glue and such. He is happy for the help he is receiving from the foundation and from Kiva.

loan.use:
to buy materials to use in his workshop.
.

loan.name: Virginia Meza

texts.es: La Sra. Virginia tiene 52 a√±os y est√° casada con el sr. Rufino de 45 a√±os. Tienen 2 hijos, uno de 20 a√±os y otro de 16 a√±os que est√° cursando sus estudios secundarios. El Sr. Rufino trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transporte P√∫blico desde hace 20 a√±os por lo que aporta a la canasta familiar. La Sra. Virginia se dedica a la venta ambulante de prendas de vestir y calzados para damas, caballeros y ni√±os desde el a√±o 1983 por lo que cuenta con una clientela formada y fiel. Ella y su marido se ayudan mutuamente para mantener la casa, y fue gracias a estos trabajos que sus hijos tienen la educaci√≥n que poseen. La Sra., Virginia desea solicitar un pr√©stamo, el cual desea invertir en la compra de jeans, prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros y Uniformes para escuelas y colegios. Ella esta muy contenta por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, pues le ser√° de mucha ayuda el cr√©dito.
texts.en:
Virginia, 52, is married to Rufino, 45, and they have two children one who is 20 and another who is 16 and attending secondary school.
Rufino has been working as a driver for a public transportation firm for 20 years and contributes to household expenses. Virginia is an itinerant merchant; she‚Äôs been selling clothes and shoes for women, men and children since 1983 so she has a well-established, regular clientele. She and her husband help each other support the home and it was thanks to these jobs that their children have the education they do.
Virginia wants to ask for a loan to buy jeans and articles of clothing for women and men and uniforms for elementary and secondary schools. She is very happy for the opportunity she‚Äôs getting because the loan will be of much help to her.

loan.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loan.name: Miguela

texts.es: La Sra. Miguela enviudo hace dos a√±os y medio, tiene dos hijas que estudian en la facultad y la ayudan en su negocio donde vende de todo. La se√±ora siempre trabajo en el mercado en las ventas y su marido era empleado p√∫blico. Con mucho esfuerzo lograron montar un negocio propio en su casa. Actualmente cuentan con varios clientes, generalmente empleados de los comercios vecinos, y nos comenta que le gustar√≠a que sus hijas terminen la universidad y que administren su propio negocio, tambi√©n quiere tener salones comerciales en su domicilio ya que es muy rentable el alquiler en esa zona. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de art√≠culos de primera necesidad, como ser harina, arroz, fideos y dem√°s insumos, con lo que podr√° surtir su local.
texts.en:
Miguela was widowed two years and a half years ago. She has two daughters who study in university and they help her in her business where she sells everything. She has always worked selling in the marketplace and her husband was a civil servant.
With a lot of effort they were able to begin their own business from their home. Currently they have a number of customers, generally employees of neighboring businesses. She tells us that she would like to see her daughters finish university and run their own business. She also wants to have a salon business out of her home since renting is very profitable in this region.
She is asking for the loan to buy basic necessities such as flour, rice, noodles and other goods with which she will be able to supply her business.

loan.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loan.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es: La Esperanza se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de It√°. Est√° integrado por 16 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que siempre se esfuerzan al m√°ximo para poder dar a sus familias un mejor futuro. Jacinta es una de las miembros del grupo, ella vende comidas de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien, puesto que tiene muy buena saz√≥n para la comida. Sus clientes acuden a ella, y estos a la vez le promocionan con los dem√°s y es por ello que le van muy bien. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por su familia, pues quiere darles un estilo de vida mejor. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de carnes, hortalizas, condimentos y dem√°s insumos para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende. Agradecen por la oportunidad que est√°n recibiendo por parte de la fundaci√≥n y de kiva.
texts.en:
This excellent group of women from the city of It√° is called ‚ÄúLa Esperanza‚Äù (Hope). It‚Äôs composed of 16 very hard working, enterprising women who always strive to the maximum degree to provide their families with a better future.
Jacinta is one of the group members. She sells all types of meals. She does very well because her dishes are very tasty. Customers come to her and they also recommend her to others and this is why she does so well. She defines herself as a very hardworking, enterprising person who strives for her family because she wants to give them a better lifestyle.
She requests the loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other ingredients to continue making the meals she sells. They are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving from the Fundaci√≥n and from Kiva.

loan.use: to buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loan.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: Las mujeres del presente comit√© son de la cuidad de Caacup√©. Las se√±oras est√°n muy satisfechas con el apoyo que les est√° brindando la Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya y Kiva. Actualmente est√°n en el ciclo N¬∫ 2 con sus 12 integrantes. Lidia es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de leche. Trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del d√≠a, ya que siempre lleva su producto a la casa de sus clientes para el desayuno. Ella es muy sacrificada, y nos dice que todo es por su familia, ya que quiere darles una mejor vida. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de leche, con lo cual podr√° abastecerse y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women in this committee are from the city off Caacup√©. They are very satisfied with the support they‚Äôve gotten from Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya and from Kiva. They are currently in cycle #2 and have 12 members.
Lidia is a very hardworking, enterprising woman who tells us that she sells milk. She works starting very early in the day because she takes her product to her customers‚Äô houses in time for breakfast.
