She is very self-sacrificing and she tells us that everything is for her family because she wants to give them a better life.
She‚Äôs asking for the loan to buy milk to stock up with so that she can meet customer demand this way.

loan.use: to buy milk to resell.

loan.name: Djeneba

texts.fr: DJENEBA est √¢g√©e de 39 ans est mari√©e sans enfant. Elle vit dans une famille nucl√©aire au quartier Pelengana Sud de S√©gou N‚Äôayant pas fr√©quent√© l‚Äô√©cole pour des raisons sociales, elle commen√ßa tr√®s t√¥t √† s‚Äôint√©resser aux activit√©s g√©n√©ratrices de revenus aupr√®s de sa m√®re qui vendait des habits en cotonnade. Apr√®s plusieurs ann√©es d‚Äôapprentissage √† ses c√¥t√©s, elle commen√ßa √† √©voluer seule en menant la m√™me activit√© du commerce d‚Äôhabits en cotonnade et surtout de bazin. Elle m√®ne cette activit√© depuis 9 ans et jouit d‚Äôune grande exp√©rience et client√®le. Sa force de vente est due √† la ma√Ætrise du rouage de ce secteur d‚Äôactivit√© mais √©galement, √† son prix abordable et la qualit√© de sa marchandise. Dans le souci d‚Äôaugmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de b√©n√©fice, elle sollicite ce pr√™t. Elle est √† son 1er pr√™t individuel qu‚Äôelle compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 pi√®ces de bazins riches. Elle s‚Äôapprovisionne √† Bamako et effectue ses ventes au comptant √† une client√®le mixte tr√®s g√©n√©ralement elle fait de l‚Äôexportation surtout au S√©n√©gal. Avec ce pr√™t elle envisage r√©aliser un b√©n√©fice mensuel de 250 000FCFA. Ce b√©n√©fice lui permettra de rembourser son pr√™t et de mener autres activit√©s g√©n√©ratrices de revenus. Son ambition est d‚Äôouvrir une boutique de pr√™t √† porter.
texts.en:
DJENEBA is 29 years old, married, and without children. She lives in a nuclear family in the Pelengana Sud district of S√©gou. Not having attended school due to societal reasons, she soon started to become interested in revenue-generating work with her mother, who used to sell cotton clothing. After several years of apprenticeship at her side, she started to work by herself by running the same commercial business in cotton clothing, especially damask.
DJENEBA has been in this business for nine years and benefits from good experience and a large customer base. Her selling power is due to her mastery of the ins and outs of this business sector but also to her affordable prices and the quality of her merchandise.
Concerned with increasing her business capital and making more profit, DJENEBA is requesting a loan. She is on her first individual loan that she intends to use to buy two lengths of <i>riche<i/> damask cloth. She gets her supplies from Bamako and accepts cash from a mixed customer base in general. She exports to Senegal in particular.
With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 250,000 francs CFA. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to run other revenue-generating businesses. Her ambition is to open a store for ready-to-wear clothing.

loan.use: to buy damask cloth

loan.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge Madrigal, tiene la edad de 52 a√±os, est√° casado y vive con el nieto y la esposa. El pretende con el cr√©dito realizar la compra de unos cerdos de cr√≠a y adem√°s ayudarse con el concentrado para el mantenimiento de los mismos cerdos. El cuenta con las instalaciones y las parideras de los cerdos de cr√≠a y cuenta ya con dos chanchas de cr√≠a ya aumentadas. El quiere comprar dos m√°s para as√≠ producir m√°s cerdos para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aleda√±os. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar y el de la familia y crecer con el proyecto de cr√≠a de cerdos. Es el primer pr√©stamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no hab√≠a tenido antes otros pr√©stamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el pr√©stamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho m√°s baja.
texts.en: Jorge Madrigal is 52 years old, married, and lives with his grandson and his wife. With the loan he intends to purchase some pigs to raise and furthermore make use of it to buy feed for the sustenance of these same pigs. He counts on the housing and the birth of more pigs to raise, and he already has two sows who are already fattened up. He wants to buy two more in order to produce more pigs to later sell them in the local market or in the surrounding area. He wants to generate the greatest amount of earnings for his well-being and that of his family, and to grow with his project of raising pigs. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loan.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loan.name: Sumber Tanjung Group

texts.en:
To continue and to expand the business, the Sumber Tanjung group decided to take out a new loan. They asked for the same size loan. This loan will be used to purchase piglets and feed.
Ni Ketut, 41, head of the group, has two adult children. She lives with her husband and one grandchild. Ni Ketut plans to use her new loan to purchase three piglets and feed. The price for local piglets is down now, so she decided to take out the same size loan. She hopes in the next six months, the price will go up again and she can earn a satisfactory price. Ni Ketut is wearing a pink shirt and holding her grandson.

loan.use: To purchase three piglets and feed

loan.name: Zuurabubu

texts.en: Zuurabubu is 54 years old. To provide a source of income for her family, Zuurabubu raises livestock. Today her farm, started in 2006 with a sum of 5,000 som, earns around 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. In order to continue developing her business, Zuurabubu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 32,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and animal feed. Zuurabubu plans to invest her profits into further livestock purchases.

loan.use: to buy sheep and animal feed

loan.name: Sumber Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Because they succeeded with the first loan, the Sumber Rahayu group has requested a bigger loan. Now per member they receive 1,5M IDR. The loan will be used to purchase piglets, feed and renovate the barn.
Ni Luh is using her loan to purchase superior piglets. The profit from last loan was used to buy local pigs and renovate the barn. Now she can increase the population of her pigs and she hopes she can be a success. Her husband supports her business because it‚Äôs increasing their family income.

loan.use: To purchase superior piglets

loan.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married with one child. She is 38 years old and lives in Comunal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Jocelyn has a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 2000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP for additional capital to buy groceries to sell.
Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy groceries to sell retail

loan.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children.
Edgar is providing motorcycle with sidecar transport services. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.
Edgar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edgar hopes to improve his services.

loan.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services

loan.name: Silvera

texts.en:
Silvera is 34 years old and is a married woman who lives in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells items like coffee, soap, soy sauce and canned goods. Silvera earns 2000 PHP per month with her business.
Silvera has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, snacks and soft drinks. Silvera plans to use her extra profit to pay for her children's school fees.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, snacks and soft drinks

loan.name: Gulzima

texts.en: Gulzima is 22 years old, she is raising two sons. To provide for her family, Gulzima sells fruits and vegetables. She started her business in 2010 with a sum of 3,000 som, and today earns roughly 6,000 som (KGS) per month. Currently, Gulzima does not have a wide variety of items for sale, and so she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) in order to expand her product range. Gulzima plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loan.use: to broaden the assortment of her products

loan.name: Selepa

texts.en:
Selepa, a 38-year-old married mother of four, owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. With two years of experience in this business, she earns 350 talas or U.S. $146 per week.

In 2012, Selepa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services and is now requesting a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business to improve/expand her enterprise.

Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Selepa's first loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loan.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.
Roland is providing motorcycle with sidecar transport services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.
Roland has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roland hopes to improve his services.

loan.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services

loan.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is married with five children. Porferia is 56 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Porferia has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.
Porferia has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Porferia hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loan.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya where he lives with his family of six children, aged between 27 and 12 years. He has been in active farming for 12 years besides running a retail business within the local market.
Samuel has requested a first loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he wants to increase the number of his dairy cows in the years to come as well as expanding his entire farm.He is focusing on getting bigger subsequent loans to do better farming.
He says lack of capital and high cost of production are a real challenge to farmers.

loan.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Mario Damian Cortez Huaman

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre de 33 a√±os de edad, √©l tiene 2 peque√±os uno de 6 y el otro de 2 a√±os, el constantemente lucha para poder sacar adelante a su p√©quela familia y est√° dispuesto a muchas cosas por mejor su calidad de vida.
Actualmente el y su esposa tienen una poller√≠a donde trabajan aproximadamente 6 horas diarias, el negocio b√°sicamente consiste en la venta de pollo a la brasa, un plato muy conocido en el pa√≠s, acompa√±ado con papas fritas, ensalada y algunas cremas. Este plato es usualmente consumido los fines de semana por las familias. Mario considera que tiene afluencia de clientes debido a que tiene una buena saz√≥n, fue su esposa la que lo entusiasmo en abrir este tipo de negocio y es desde entonces que laboran juntos.
Actualmente necesitan que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarlos y as√≠ ambientar algunas partes de su local, para que los clientes se sientan atra√≠dos y est√©n decididos a continuar comprando en el mismo lugar. Con gran esfuerzo mejorar sus ingresos y desean que en algunos a√±os su negocio pueda ser ampliado y desde luego ampliar su local.
texts.en:
Mario, age 33, has two little ones, ages six and two. He constantly struggles to be able to get his small family ahead. He is willing to do many things in order to improve his quality of life.
He and his wife currently have a business selling chicken, and they work approximately six hours a day at the business. Basically, the business consists of selling rotisserie chicken, a well-known dish in the country. It is accompanied by french fries, salad, and some sauces. This dish is usually eaten by families on the week-ends.
Mario believes that he has a lot of customers because of his good seasoning. It was his wife who encouraged him to open this type of business. Ever since then they have worked together.
He now needs the Kiva lenders' help. They want to liven up some parts of their place to attract and keep customers. With great effort to improve their income, they want to expand their business in a few years. Then, they want to expand their location.

loan.use: to improve the ambiance of his chicken business.

loan.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is married with four children. She is 41 years old and lives in Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Elsa has a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP for additional capital to buy groceries for resale.
Elsa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Elsa hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy groceries to sell retail

loan.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children.
Domingo is providing motorcycle with sidecar transport services. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.
Domingo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Domingo hopes to improve his services.

loan.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services

loan.name: Julio Moises

texts.es:
Julio Moises tiene 22 a√±os de edad es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Guaranda provincia de Bol√≠var. La VRC Emmanuel est√° conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda. Julio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, ma√≠z, habas, adem√°s cr√≠a pollos, ganado. Solicita el cr√©dito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, abono org√°nico, ranger para la maleza. Con la ayuda del cr√©dito podr√° salvar los cultivos. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda semanalmente y en tiempo de cosecha. El sue√±o es poder tener un negocio propio venta de abono org√°nico. Los desaf√≠os a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol y disfrutar de las fechas del carnaval.
"Agradece por el cr√®dito anterior porque ha sido de mucha ayuda para salir adelante por beneficio de la familia"
texts.en:
Julio Moises is 22, married, and lives with his wife and children in Guaranda, in Bol√≠var province.
The Emmanuel communal bank is made up of 12 members, who live in the settlement of San Juan de Llullundongo, which is part of Guaranda canton. San Juan de Llullundongo is located 40 minutes from the branch office.
Julio is a farmer, and grows potatoes, corn, lima beans, and also raises chickens and cattle.
He is applying for the loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizers, and herbicide for weed control. He does his purchasing, and makes his sales in Guaranda weekly, and at harvest time.
His dream is to be able to have his own business selling organic fertilizer. The challenge he faces is competition. In his free time he likes to play soccer and enjoy the days of carnival.
He is thankful for the previous loan, because it has really helped him to succeed for the family's benefit.

loan.use: To buy organic and chemical fertilizers, and herbicide for weed control.

loan.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha, 50, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. Her husband is Ben, a tailor, and she is a mother to her three children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Editha operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Editha hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 67 years old. She is widowed with three children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 30 years.
This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She repaid her previous loan well and in good time.She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and pay for labour.
She hopes to be a leading farmer in her area.

loan.use: to purchase farm inputs and pay for labour.

loan.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is 42 years of age and married with seven children.
Penina owns & operates a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish. She has many years of experience in this business. Penina needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.
In 2008, Penina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Penina's 4th loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loan.name: Francis Maina Mwangi

texts.en:
Francis is 49 years old. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. He also describes his customers as low income earners because they live in slums.
Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorcycle.

loan.use: To buy a motorcycle

loan.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Jovelyn's husband provides trisikad, a bicycle with a rider seat attached, and mechanical services.
Jovelyn has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to buy fish to stock and sell. Jovelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fish to stock and sell.

loan.name: Paulia

texts.en:
Paulia is 57 years of age and married with seven children.
Paulia owns & operates a business venture selling pancakes. She has three years of experience in this business. Paulia needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.
In 2008, Paulia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Paulia's 4th loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loan.name: Rosadelia

texts.en:
Rosadelia is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Rosadelia has a shop that sells fish like sardines, mackerel & trout. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 11,000 to buy stocks of fish to sell.
Rosadelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosadelia hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of fish for sale

loan.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana tiene 34 a√±os de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de mercader√≠a en general, este negocio lo realiza de forma informal ya tiene sus clientes fijos a quienes les ofrece sus productos. Roxana tiene dos hijos que todav√≠a est√°n a su cargo y est√°n estudiando que el sue√±o de la emprendedora es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios. Esta emprendedora est√° solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio lo cual comprara camisas, sandalias, blusas, zapatos, pantalones, faldas, variedad de cosm√©ticos entre otros productos que demandan sus clientes.
texts.en: Roxana is 34 and sells general merchandise, offering her products to fixed clients informally. Roxana takes care of two children who are studying, and her dream is to help her children finish their studies. This entrepreneur seeks credit to invest in her business to buy shirts, sandals, blouses, shoes, pants, skirts, varied cosmetics and other products to satisfy client requests.

loan.use: to buy shirts, sandals, blouses, shoes, pants, skirts, varied cosmetics and other products to satisfy client requests

loan.name: Suanepa

texts.en:
Suanepa is 33 years old. She is married and has five children.
Suanepa owns and operates a business venture, selling pancakes. She has three years of experience in this business. Suanepa is requesting a loan of 2,000 WST in order to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST or $167 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.
In 2010, Suanepa joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Suanepa's third loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make pancakes to sell.

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 24-year-old lady from Homabay town. She is married to Wilson and they have one child who is five years old.
Elizabeth operates a tailoring business. She has been in business for the last three years and earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy textiles and material for sewing.
She will use the profit to expand her business. Her dream is to improve her standard of living.

loan.use: to buy textiles and material for sewing.

loan.name: Rusia

texts.en:
Rusia is 46 years old, married to Aggrey, a driver, and blessed with five children aged 16 (twins), 15, 14 and nine years old. She owns a cafeteria, a business she started five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.
She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase three sacks of beans, three sacks of maize, three bundles of wheat flour and 60kgs of rice.
She will use the anticipated profit to buy a cow for milk production. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and build rental houses as well as educate her children. This is her first loan.

loan.use: To purchase three sacks of beans, three sacks of maize, three bundles of wheat flour and 60kgs of rice.

loan.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is 53 years of age and single with four children.
Veronika owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Veronika needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.
In 2012, Veronika joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Veronika's 1st loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loan.name: Arline

texts.en:
Arline is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Arline has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Arline has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arline hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loan.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat has been running an agricultural business for more than 14 years. On his farm Marat is raising three cows, four calves, five sheep, a pig and 20 chickens as well. Also he grows potatoes for sale. He sells dairy products to re-sellers and meat to butchers' shops. Marat‚Äôs wife helps him in farming a lot and thus they are able to support their family.
Marat is 40 years old; he is married and has a small son. Marat is a cook and simultaneously with farming he works at a school as a logistics manager. This is Marat‚Äôs second loan from Nor Horizon and now he needs a $ 2,000 loan to buy fodder for his farm animals and also potato seedlings ahead of sowing season.

loan.use: to buy fodder for his farm animals and also potato seedlings ahead of sowing season

loan.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is married with three children. She is 58 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Bernadeth has a tailoring business. She had this business for 40 years.She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase materials for tailoring .Each month, she earns approximately 8000 PHP. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.
In the future, Bernadeth hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase materials for tailoring

loan.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana, de 47 a√±os se caracteriza por ser una mujer alegre. Vive en compa√±√≠a de Antonio, su esposo desde hace 30 a√±os. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero viven con 2 de ellos: Katy y Rosa en su casa propia, ubicada en el Barrio Esperanza. Es la primera vez que trabaja con su asociaci√≥n de la que fue invitada para progresar como los dem√°s integrantes, se siente muy bien pues est√° convencida de poder triunfar con la ayuda de todos. Su principal ingreso econ√≥mico se centra en la siembra de papa, ma√≠z y todo tipo de hortalizas, en terrenos agr√≠colas propios y alquilados. Aprovecha las largas jornadas en el campo para cuidar de sus animales entre vacas, toros, cerdos, ‚Äúquien sabe trabajar, dedica todo el d√≠a al cuidado de sus sembr√≠os‚Äù, comenta. Al mismo tiempo que menciona que aprovecha a los toros para hacer el arado de la tierra, el cual le ayuda su esposo. Asimismo cuenta que los fines de semana, aprovecha para vender comida, tiene muchos a√±os cocinando y los comensales que visitan su puesto, consumen con frecuencia, de esa manera obtiene un dinero extra. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario ‚ÄúHuaribamba‚Äù y este es el primer cr√©dito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el pr√©stamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Adem√°s promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. Juliana de recibir su apoyo; invertir√° el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para distribuir entre sus sembr√≠os de papa y ma√≠z.
texts.en:
Juliana, 47, characterizes herself as a happy woman. She lives with Antonio, her husband of 30 years. They have 5 children but only two of them, Katy and Rosa, live with them. They live in their own home located in Barrio Esperanza. This is her first time working with this group, which she was invited to join so that she could get ahead like the other members. She feels very good because she is convinced she will be able to succeed with the help of all.
Juliana‚Äôs principal income derives from cultivating potatoes, corn and all kinds of vegetables on both rented and owned agricultural land. She takes advantage of long workdays in the country to tend to her animals, which include cows, bulls and pigs. She notes that ‚ÄúShe who knows how to work, spends the whole day caring for her fields.‚Äù At the same time she mentions that she makes good use of the bulls in ploughing the ground, which helps her husband. Similarly, she says that on weekends she profits by selling food and has been cooking for many years. Diners frequently visit her stand to eat and in this way she earns extra money.
Juliana belongs to the Huaribamba Communal Bank and this is her first loan with MFP, where she feels fulfilled and happy since she hopes to receive a loan in order to continue with her objectives. As well, she promises to be punctual in her payments. She is a responsible and caring person. Upon receiving your support, she will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizers to apply to her fields of potatoes and corn.

loan.use: to buy natural fertilizers

loan.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 36 a√±os es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compa√±√≠a de Juvenal, su esposo. Ambos tienen 7 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el barrio La Esperanza. La siembra de diversos productos agr√≠colas es su especialidad, cuenta que durante todo este tiempo dedic√°ndose a la agricultura, sembr√≥ toda variedad de papa, de diversos colores y tama√±os, adem√°s de hortalizas, verdura y cereales. Cuenta con sus propios terrenos agr√≠colas las cuales le brindan muchas ganancias, pues cuida con demasiado cuidado del proceso de crecimiento. Pero como buena proveedora, tambi√©n cr√≠a animales entre cerdos y ovejas, las cuales alimenta para venderlos, solo si tiene alguna necesidad, pero si no, los utiliza para el consumo de su esposo e hijos. Ahora desea mejorar sus cultivos e incrementar los ingresos ya que sus hijos son peque√±os y necesitaran educaci√≥n, ‚Äúah√≠ gastar√© mucho dinero‚Äù, afirma. Pero eso no es un inconveniente, ya que ella luchar√° por brindarle lo mejor que pueda. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario ‚ÄúHuaribamba‚Äù y este es el s√©ptimo cr√©dito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el pr√©stamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Adem√°s promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. Marina de recibir su apoyo, invertir√° el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus pr√≥ximos sembr√≠os de papa.
texts.en:
Marina, 36 years old, is a hard-working woman. She lives with Juvenal, her husband. Together they have 7 children whom they care for in their own house located in the barrio of La Esperanza (Hope). To plant diverse agricultural products is her specialty. Marina tells us that since she has been a farmer, she has sown every type of potato, of diverse colors and sizes, in addition to vegetables, greens, and cereals. She has her own agricultural lands which have given her a lot of earnings, since she takes good care of her crops as they grow. But like a good provider, she also raises animals, especially pigs and sheep, which she fattens in order to sell, but only when she has the need. If not, she uses them to feed her husband and children.
Now Marina wants to improve her crops and increase income, since her children are still little and need an education. ‚ÄúOn that I'll spend a lot of money,‚Äù Marina says. And this is no inconvenience, because she is willing to struggle to offer them the best she can.
Marina belongs to the ‚ÄúHuaribamba‚Äù solidarity group and this is their 7th loan cycle through MFP, where she feels fulfilled and happy. She hopes to obtain this loan to continue on towards her objectives. As always, she promises to make her payments punctually. Marina is a responsible and dependable person. Upon receiving her loan, she will use the requested money to purchase natural fertilizers to spread on her next plantings of potatoes.

loan.use: buy natural fertilizers for her next potato crop.

loan.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina, de 52 a√±os es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compa√±√≠a de Agripino, su esposo desde hace 29 a√±os. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, los cuales ya se casaron. Ahora ellos viven juntos en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en la localidad de Sicaya. Desde hace 7 a√±os consecutivos, viene vendiendo miel de abeja, yogurt y queso a la capital del pa√≠s, donde no existen estos productos o cuestan mucho dinero. Durante todo este tiempo obtuvo buenos compradores quienes, ya la conocen y son sus clientes asiduos. Asimismo se dedica a la siembra de papa, zanahoria, alverja y alfalfa, en sus grandes terrenos de cultivo, siembra en cantidad, pues es su principal ingreso econ√≥mico. Adem√°s tiene 29 a√±os de experiencia en la agricultura. Su √©xito para durar todo este tiempo se centra en la distribuci√≥n, pues sus hijos le apoyan en eso, comercializando sus alimentos en la capital del pa√≠s, donde cuentan m√°s dinero estos productos, por ser costa. Ahora desea mejorar sus cultivos y poder ahorrar todo lo que pueda, con la ayuda de su esposo. Ya que muy pronto cosechar√° zanahoria y ma√≠z. Ella pertenece al banco comunal ‚Äúsicaya‚Äù y este es el d√©cimo s√©ptimo cr√©dito con MFP, donde se siente muy feliz, pues en todo este tiempo logr√≥ obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo econ√≥mico que le brindan. Por ello promete una vez m√°s, cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. Adem√°s le gusta trabajar en su asociaci√≥n, pues todos los integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Catalina, de recibir su apoyo; invertir√° el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para mejorar sus cultivos de papa y zanahoria que tiene sembrado.
texts.en: Catalina, age 52, is a hard-working woman. She lives with Agripino, her husband of 29 years. They have four children, all of whom are already married. Catalina and Agripino now live together in the home of Agripino's parents, located in the town of Sicaya. Catalina has been selling honey, yoghourt, and cheese for seven years in the capital city; these products are either unavailable there or cost a lot of money. Over time, Catalina has obtained good, loyal customers who know her well. Catalina also sows potato, carrots, peas, and alfalfa on her extensive lands. She plants a lot, as this is her main source of income. She has 29 years of experience in agriculture. The secret to her success over all this time is based in distribution: her children help her by selling her produce in the capital city, where they sell for a higher price. Catalina now wants to improve her crops and to be able to save as much money as possible with her husband's help. She will be harvesting carrots and corn very soon. She belongs to the "Sicaya" communal bank, and this is her 17th loan with MFP. She is very happy, because during all this time she has been able to make a lot of money--all thanks to our economic support. She promises once more to repay her quotas. She enjoys being part of the association; all of the members are united and hard-working. Upon receiving your support, Catalina will invest in the purchase of natural fertilizers in order to improve her carrot and potato crops which she has already planted.

loan.use: to buy natural fertilizers.

loan.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia de 31 a√±os convive con Santos, el padre de su hijo Samir de 8 a√±os y del peque√±o que viene en camino. Esta familia vive unida en una casa alquilada ubicada en el anexo de Yanama, distrito de Palca ‚Äì Tarma. Olivia cuenta que, desde que ten√≠a 15 a√±os ya apoyaba a sus padres en el trabajo del campo. De esta manera aprendi√≥ sobre lo cansado y gratificante que son las cosechas. Al lado de Santos empezaron a producir papas en distintas variedades, habas y arvejas. ‚ÄúSiembro papa Yungay, Andina, Perricholi y √önica (variedades), porque as√≠ vendo mejor‚Äù, dice. Confiesa que el cultivo de este tub√©rculo es muy cansado por eso contrata jornaleros a quienes paga al d√≠a por sus servicios. A la vez, se dedica a la atenci√≥n de su peque√±a tienda de abarrotes que instal√≥ en la casa donde vive. Por ahora prefiere cuidar su negocio por el su estado ya que lleva 8 meses de embarazo. Posteriormente se reincorporar√° al trabajo de campo porque extra√±a llevar sus pocas ovejas a pastar mientras realiza la limpieza de sus cultivos. Sus objetivos son claros. Aumentar su producci√≥n para ahorrar m√°s e implementar su bodega con mayor mercader√≠a. √âste ser√≠a su primer cr√©dito con MFP. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Por recomendaci√≥n de vecinos se anim√≥ en ser parte de un grupo s√≥lido y responsable: ‚ÄúLos Manantiales de Yanama‚Äù. De obtener el cr√©dito podr√° comprar bolsas de abonos org√°nicos para fertilizar los cultivos de papas, que cosechar√° en mayo.
texts.en:
Olivia, 31, lives with Santos, the father of her 8 year old son, Samir, and the little one that‚Äôs on the way. This united family lives in a rented house located in Yanama Annex, Palca-Tarma District. Olivia relates that since the age of 15 she started helping her parents with the field work. This is how she learned both how exhausting and gratifying harvests can be. Alongside Santos she began to produce various varieties of potatoes, broad beans and peas.
‚ÄúI always plant Yungay, Andina, Perricholi and √önica (varieties) potatoes because they sell best,‚Äù she says. She confesses that farming this tuber is very tiring which is why she hires day laborers that she pays a daily wage for their services.
At the same time she also tends to the small grocery store she set up in the house she lives in. For now, she prefers to tend to the store because she‚Äôs in her 8th month of pregnancy. Later on she will retake field work because she misses taking her few sheep out to pasture while weeding her crops. Her objectives are clear: to increase production to save more and to stock her store with more merchandise.
This will be her first loan with MFP. She gives her word that she will be punctual with her monthly installment payments. It was thanks to recommendations from her neighbors that she ventured to become part of this solid, responsible group, ‚ÄúLos Manantiales de Yanama.‚Äù If she were to obtain the loan, she will buy sacks of organic manure to fertilize her potato crops that she‚Äôll harvest in May.

loan.use: to buy sacks or organic manure.

loan.name: Aldo Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Aldo tiene 34 a√±os y es viudo tiene dos hijos que son peque√±o, el se dedica a fabricaci√≥n y venta de calzados hace ya bastante tiempo su taller se encuentra en la zona de Cristo Rey, Este pr√©stamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la instituci√≥n, el Sr. Aldo utilizara este pr√©stamo para la compra de materia prima, materiales y herramientas para la fabricaci√≥n de calzados, la raz√≥n para solicitar este pr√©stamo es compra de material para pedido de botas. Aldo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son expandir su mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para incrementar capital. Se siente feliz y agradecido con la instituci√≥n por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Aldo is 34, a widower, and has two small children. For some time he has been making and selling shoes, and maintains a workshop in the area of Cristo Rey, This is Aldo's second loan, which he plans to use to buy basic materials, supplies and tools to make shoes. He seeks this loan to buy material to make boots. Aldo faces challenges such as expanding his business and increase his working capital. He is happy and grateful for the support given to him.

loan.use: to buy basic materials, supplies and tools to make shoes

loan.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha se dedica a la venta de ropa en una de las calles mas concurridas de la ciudad de Cochabamba, sale a su puesto muy temprano ya que el flujo de clientes es mayor durante las ma√±anas en especial los d√≠as de feria (mi√©rcoles y s√°bado), tiene esposo el no vive con ella, cabe recalcar que es rentista y no tiene hijos por los que tenga que velar directamente, el motivo principal es tener mayor mercader√≠a para estas fiestas de fin de a√±o, por este motivo solicito el cr√©dito para la compra de ropa de temporada, es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en: Martha sells clothing in one of the busiest streets in the city of Cochabamba. She starts work very early as customer traffic is heaviest in the morning hours, especially on market days (Wednesdays and Saturdays). She is married but lives apart from her husband, and she does not have children who she supports directly. She seeks this loan to have more merchandise to sell at the holidays, and will use the credit buy seasonal clothing for re-sale. She is very hardworking and very pleased with the opportunity given to her.

loan.use: To buy seasonal clothing merchandise for sale.

loan.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.
Emelda has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP in order to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to stock and sell.
Emelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emelda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been working in mixed farming for 14 years in addition to working as a civil servant. Though currently retired, he earns a pension that supplements his farming income. He is married and has five adult children.
Joseph has made a second loan request of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to buy water pipes. He says he will use the pipes to irrigate his farm and to improve his animal feed, which he grows and sells to other farmers. He says that insufficient rain remains a challenge to farming.
He will use the income to improve his family‚Äôs standard of living.

loan.use: to buy water pipes for irrigation.

loan.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is aged 46 and married with five children all being of primary school-going ages. His farm produces coffee, milk, eggs and maize.
He has requested a third loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff cutter (to cut fodder) for his dairy farm. He hopes better feeding enabled by the availability of a chuff cutter will help him double his production. He is focusing on owning five dairy cows in the next five years.
He states that poor climatic conditions and poorly organized markets for farming produce are still limitations to farmers.

loan.use: To buy a chuff cutter to cut fodder

loan.name: Nuualuga

texts.en:
Nuualuga is 74 years old, a widow with seven children.
Nuualuga owns & operates a business venture selling pancakes. She has one year of experience in this business. Nuualuga needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.
In 2012, Nuualuga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Nuualuga's 1st loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loan.name: Priscah

texts.en: Priscah is 36 years old and married to Peter. Together, they have four children between the ages of one and four years old. She has been in the tailoring business for five years and generates a monthly income of KES 5,000. She will be using this loan to buy a solar kit that provides light for her home. Her dream is to live a comfortable life.

loan.use: To provide light in the house.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 22 years old and lives in Kapiri, Central Zambia. She operates a mobile money transfer business, which helps people make money transactions faster and allows easier access at cheaper rates. Mary became a money transfer agent after passing training intended to equip young entrepreneurs like her who want to start up their own businesses. While she has been in business for only nine months, she is a success, as she already employs one person.

Mary believes in hard work. Every morning she wakes up motivated by the fact that soon her business will grow bigger and better. However, Mary faces a few challenges, one of which is a lack of business space. She is currently working from a booth, which makes some clients feel uncomfortable because they assume she is not legitimate.

Mary plans to use her loan to grow her business so that it will bring in enough revenue to allow her to move to a permanent building. Presently, her working capital is too small to do so. Accomplishing this will allow her to employ more people and help her customers feel more comfortable when moving their monies.

loan.use: grow her mobile money transfer business.

loan.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 22 years old, a single man who lives in Aden, Yemen. His educational background is a Bachelor's degree. He has been operating an electrical materials store for two years. He started his business by renting a small shop. But thanks to the good way he‚Äôs managed his income from the business, he was able to obtain financing and expanded his business. He has employed two persons who help him to work well and get more clients. The advantage of his business is that it earns good profits but he also has a lot of competition and his sales have decreased recently.
So, Omar is asking for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. This loan will be used to buy lamps, wires and fans to stock his store. His goal is to make his business grow, turning it into a big store which will increase his income, as well as buying a car and getting married.

loan.use: to buy lamps, wires and fans for his business

loan.name: Blsm Group

texts.en:
This group called BLSM consists of four members who are all females: Saba, Fathia, Jihan and Fatima. All of them are friends from Taiz, Yemen. They primarily work together in small businesses like selling clothes. The group took a loan of 150,000 YER.
Saba is a 23-year-old married woman (she is the woman who is standing up in the center of the photo). She has been running her business for three years. To meet the needs of her family, she started selling clothes in a market. She has already benefited from the first loan that she requested from AMB. She has successfully repaid her loan and has saved a considerable amount.
Now she requested a second youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. She is going to reinforce her supply by buying more clothing products such as shirts, pants and scarves to increase the profit from her business.
In the future, Saba plans to develop her business into a clothing shop.

loan.use: to buy more clothes such as shirts, pants and scarves for her business .

loan.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
This is Emiliana, 66, a resident of Bacoor Cavite, Philippines. She is a single parent and mother to her two children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Emiliana oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which are paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1000 every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Emiliana dreams that her business will grow in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance for their jeepney unit

loan.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is thirty-one years of age and married with five children.
Salome owns and operates a business venture, driving a taxi. She has a year of experience in this business. Salome needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase new tires and pay the vehicle registration fee. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.
In 2012, Salome joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Salome's first loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase new tires and pay the vehicle registration fee.

loan.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is thirty-seven years old and lives in Punta, Liloy. She is married with three children.
Riza works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase more fish to sell.
Riza has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Riza hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loan.name: Fogalele

texts.en:
Fogalele is forty-eight years old and married with five children.
Fogalele owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Fogalele needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.
In 2012, Fogalele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Fogalele's first loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loan.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, fifty-seven, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Manuel and a mother to one child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Milagros operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Milagros hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Dominic Muinde Mwilu

texts.en: Domonic is thirty-six years old, married, with one child. He runs a bookshop to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and employs two people. To earn extra income he does farming. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy pens, photocopy papers and exercise books to sell.

loan.use: To buy pens, photocopy papers and exercise books to sell.

loan.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario tiene 47 a√±os y es Soltera se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona de Warnes. Este pr√©stamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la instituci√≥n, Rosario utilizara este pr√©stamo de para Capital de Trabajo (compra de mesas, sillas, garrafas y capital de inversi√≥n) para su negocio la raz√≥n para solicitar este pr√©stamo es hacer crecer su negocio. Rosario o enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y utilizara los beneficios en incrementar su capital de trabajo. Con el tiempo la Sra. Rosario desea tener su propio restaurante, se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rosario is 47 years old and single. She sells meals at her sales stall located in the Warnes zone. This loan is her first through this institution.
Rosario will use this loan to purchase tables, chairs, large glasses, and other investments in her business. She is soliciting the loan to make her business grow. Rosario confronts challenges to her business in the form of competition and will utilize the loan amount to increase her working capital.
In time, Rosario hopes to have her own restaurant. She feels very grateful for this offer of help.

loan.use: buy tables, chairs, and large glasses for the stall where she sell meals.

loan.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a builder and he repairs offices and houses by private order. He has been engaged in this business for more than eight years. Armen‚Äôs occupation is the only source of his family‚Äôs income as his wife is housewife, his son is a pupil and his daughter is a third-year student at the Armenian State Linguistic University of the English language department.
Armen is asking for a 200,000 AMD loan to pay for his daughter‚Äôs education for her second semester. Armen is 42 years old and he lives in Yerevan. He is a second-cycle client of Nor Horizon.

loan.use: To pay for his daughter's education

loan.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 29-year-old man from Homabay and is married to Mary. They have three children between the ages of one and three years old.
John operates a carpentry business and has been doing this for the last 10 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy timber, nails, and glue. His profits will be used to educate his children.
His dream is to be financially stable.

loan.use: To buy timber, nails, and glue.

loan.name: Faaiuga

texts.en:
Faaiuga is 38 years old, married, and has five children.
Faaiuga owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Faaiuga needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.
In 2011, Faaiuga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Faaiuga's second loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loan.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 30 years old. He is married to Milkah and together they have one child. Timothy is a farmer and has been in the business for the past three years.
This is Timothy's first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and herbicides and also to pay for labor.
Timothy hopes to expand his business and purchase another piece of land.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and herbicides and to pay for labor.

loan.name: Jessica

texts.en:
This is Jessica, thirty-five, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Ricky, thirty-nine, who is a helper. She is a mother of two children, both of whom are studying as high school students. She keeps herself busy attending to the needs of her family and her business.
Jessica maintains a piggery business. She buys piglets and raises them for four months before selling them in the market. The cost of live pork per kilo is PHP 130. Each pig, if raised and fed well, will weigh about 90-94 kilos. She can have PHP 5,000 as net income from every pig that she sells. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.
To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan as an additional capital for the purchase of more piglets. More hogs to raise means more income and profit. She saves her earnings for the educational needs of her children.
Jessica dreams that all her children will be able to finish studies and have a good life. She hopes to renovate her house and that her pigs won‚Äôt get sick so that her business will maintain a good income. She wants stability in her business. She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to have time for God after a long week of work.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for additional pigs and feed needed in her business.

loan.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is thirty-eight years old. She is married, and a mother of two school-going children. She has been selling assorted fruits in Kilifi for the last five years and she is doing great.
This is her third business loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to purchase more bananas, mangoes, apples and pineapples to resell to her customers.
She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and add more stock to her business. She hopes to excel in the business and live a prosperous life through loans from KADET.

loan.use: to purchase more bananas, mangoes, apples and pineapples.

loan.name: La Seriedad Group

texts.es:
Do√±a Elvia, es miembro del Banco Comunal La Seriedad, tiene 50 a√±os de edad, esta casada y tiene 7 hijos (3 mujeres y 4 varones), su Esposo se dedica a la ganader√≠a y trabaja en conjunto con sus hijos varones, su meta es ver a sus hijos profesionales y trabajando.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada desde hace 15 a√±os. El pr√©stamo que solicita lo invertir√° en la compra de dos fardos de ropa, sobretodo estilos que est√©n de moda, de manera que pueda aumentar sus ventas llamando la atenci√≥n de m√°s personas. Con el apoyo del pr√©stamo tendr√° m√°s mercader√≠a y as√≠ podr√° aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la econom√≠a de su hogar. Una de sus dificultades es que en algunas ocasiones sus clientes le quedan debiendo. Su mayor sue√±o es ahorrar para tener su propio local, ya que actualmente realiza sus ventas de forma ambulante y tiene que lidiar con los cambios del clima. Tiene 15 ciclos de recibir el apoyo FAMA a trav√©s de los prestamos que ha obtenido y es una clienta que ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Elvia is a member of 'La Seriedad' community bank. She is 50 years old, married, and has seven children (three daughters and four sons). Her husband raises livestock and works together with their sons. Elvia's goal is to see her children become professionals and see them working.
Elvia has been selling new and used clothing for 15 years. She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying two bundles of clothing, especially fashionable styles. This will enable her to increase her sales, attracting more people's attention. With the support of the loan, she will have more merchandise and will therefore be able to increase her profits and improve her household finances. One of the difficulties she faces is that sometimes her customers don't pay. Her biggest dream is to save up so that she can buy her own sales premises because she currently makes her sales on foot and she has to deal with changes in the weather. Elvia has been receiving support from FAMA for 15 loan cycles. She is a client who has always made her loan repayments on time.

loan.use: to buy bundles of used clothing

loan.name: Jesus Group

texts.es:
La se√±ora Lucia es miembro del Grupo Jesus, se dedica a la elaboraci√≥n y venta de tortillas, tiene 49 a√±os de edad, es casada, tiene 7 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a la alba√±iler√≠a, ellos residen en la Colonia Bella Oriente, en el municipio de Juticalpa. Do√±a Lucia anteriormente viv√≠a en el Barrio de Jes√∫s donde inicio haciendo tortillas desde ni√±a cuando viv√≠a con su madre, actualmente se dedica al mismo negocio de elaboraci√≥n y venta de tortillas, donde comienza a las 5 a.m hasta las 5 p.m, siendo que do√±a Lucia tiene que trasladarse desde la Colonia Bella Oriente hasta su lugar de trabajo que es en el Barrio de Jes√∫s,en la misma ciudad, tambi√©n se dedica a la venta de productos Avon.
Su ventaja es que tiene una muy buena clientela y su desventaja es que el fog√≥n donde hace las tortillas esta expuesto al sol y al agua por no tener una caceta para cubrirlo y que tiene que viajar todos los d√≠as en la madrugada desde su casa hasta su lugar de trabajo. El pr√©stamo que do√±a Lucia esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de maseca y le√±a. Con el apoyo de este pr√©stamo cambiaria su nivel de vida porque con las ganancias que reciba podr√° comprar una estufa industrial y hacer una caceta para mejorar su lugar de trabajo. Una de sus metas es tener un local bien establecido para su tortillera para atender mejor sus clientes. Ha tenido 14 ciclos con FAMA y los ha cancelado puntualmente ya que con las ganancias de los pr√©stamos obtenidos pudo construir su peque√±a casa.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Jesus Solidarity Group. She works making and selling tortillas. She is 49 years old and married, and has seven children. Her husband works in agriculture and in building. They live in Colonia Bella Oriente in the town of Juticalpa. Previously she lived in Barrio de Jes√∫s, where she began making tortillas when she was a little girl when she lived with her mother.
Currently she works in the same business of making and selling tortillas, beginning at 5 a.m. until 5 p.m. She has to travel from Colonia Bella Oriente to Barrio de Jes√∫s, in the same city. She also works selling Avon products.
Her advantage is that she has very good customers. Her disadvantage is that the stove where she makes tortillas is exposed to the sun and the water because she does not have a stand to cover it. Also, she has to travel every day at dawn from her house to her workplace.
Lucia needs the loan she is requesting to invest in buying Maseca [a brand of instant corn masa flour] and firewood. With the help of this loan she would change her standard of living because with the profits she makes she will be able to buy an industrial stove and make a stand to improve her workplace.
One of her goals is to have a well-established place for her tortilla business to better serve her customers. She has had 14 loan cycles with FAMA and she has paid them back punctually. With the profits from the loans given, she was able to build her little house.

loan.use: to buy Maseca [a brand of corn flour] and firewood.

loan.name: Ruben Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Rub√©n tiene 39 a√±os y es soltero no tiene hijos, el tiene la actividad de Coordinador - capacitador su oficina se encuentra en la zona central, este pr√©stamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la instituci√≥n, Rub√©n utilizara este pr√©stamo para la compra de mamparas para divisi√≥n de ambientes para aulas por actividad, la raz√≥n para solicitar este pr√©stamo es para infraestructura de ambientes de capacitaci√≥n, Rub√©n enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar sus instalaciones. y utilizara los beneficios para incrementar capital de trabajo. Su deseo es con el tiempo aumentar cursos de capacitaci√≥n.
texts.en: Ruben is 39; he is single and does not have children. His occupation is training coordinator, and his office can be found in central La Paz. This is his first loan cycle with the institution. Ruben will use this loan to buy partitions to divide rooms into classrooms for different activities. His reason for requesting this loan is for the infrastructure of the training rooms. The challenge Ruben faces in his business is improving his facilities, and he will use the profits to increase his working capital. His wish is to increase over time the number of training courses offered.

loan.use: to buy partitions for the division of classrooms.

loan.name: David

texts.en:
David is a resident and a farmer in Murang‚Äôa, Central Kenya. He is 65 years old and has been in farming for over 30 years. His farm currently produces pigs, maize, bananas, and milk, which are all sold to the locals and help him meet his family's needs. David has two children, ages 11 and 15.
David has requested his first loan of 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says his goal is to own at least ten dairy cows in five years. He adds that the loan will improve his family's living standards and his farming practice. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's financial services.

loan.use: To buy a cow.

loan.name: Paepaeloa

texts.en:
Paepaeloa is forty-seven years of age and married with six children.
Paepaeloa owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Paepaeloa needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.
In 2012, Paepaeloa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Paepaeloa's first loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loan.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is single. Dioscora is fifty-nine years old and lives in Causwagan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Dioscora sells sacks of rice to earn a living and had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase more sacks of rice for her retail business.
Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Dioscora hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for her retail business.

loan.name: Carla

texts.en:
This is Carla, thirty-six, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Fred, a driver, and is a mother of three children, one in high school and two in elementary. While attending to her family needs, she also kept herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband in sustaining daily expenses.
Carla owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk and sugar: primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She is also into a piggery business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 Philippine Peso in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loans. She will be using the loan to buy more grocery items. The more items displayed at the store the better. It will help her to save more money for any possible expenditure ahead.
Carla hopes that her variety store will turn into a grocery someday. She hopes that it will continue to grow and sustain the needs of her family. She wishes that her children will be able to finish their studies and have a good life. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. Sharing the word of God completes her.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.
Susan requested an PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.
She has been in this business for ten years.
In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loan.name: Faauu

texts.en:
Faau is a mother of two and she's single.
Faauu is starting a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. Faauu needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.
In 2012, Faauu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faauu's first loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loan.name: Aloaalii

texts.en:
Aloaalii is 19 years of age, married, and has one child.
Aloaalii owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Aloaalii needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.
In 2012, Aloaalii joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Aloaalii's first loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loan.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is married and has one child. She is 30 years old and lives in Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Cherryl sells cosmetic products to earn a living and has had this business for twelve years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,800 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more cosmetic products to sell.
Cherryl is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more cosmetic products to sell.

loan.name: Felila

texts.en:
Felila is 45 years of age and married with six children.
Felila owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Felila needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.
In 2012, Felila joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Felila's first loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loan.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem is engaged in animal breeding. On his farm he rears cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Artem uses part of the agricultural products that he produces, such as milk, meat and eggs, for his family‚Äôs needs and the other part he sells to a butcher‚Äôs shop and milk Collection Company.
Artem is twenty-eight years old and he lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area. He lives with his brother‚Äôs family and his sister-in-law helps him in farming. After serving in army Artem has started to run his animal-breeding business.
Artem is asking for a $ 1,800 loan to buy a lot of fodder for his farm animals.

loan.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his farm animals.

loan.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace, forty-six, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Emmanuel, a government employee, and is the mother of two children. The eldest is in college and youngest in high school. While attending to her family needs, she also keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping his husband in sustaining daily expenses.
Mary Grace owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk and sugar: primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She is also into selling hollow blocks (the ones that are used in building houses) as an additional source of income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more grocery items and stock. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her earnings would be a big help for the education of her children and expenditures ahead.
Mary Grace dreams that her children will be able to finish their studies and have a good life. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and help them pay daily expenses. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it makes her a better person and strengthens her faith in Christ.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is forty-seven years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are in school.
Raquel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.
She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Raquel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loan.name: Danson Kimachu Mwangi

texts.en:
Danson is thirty-eight years old, married, with three children. He sells household goods to earn a living. He has been in the business for fourteen years and employs one person. To earn extra income he transports goods with his hand cart. He describes his customers as low income earners because they live in slums.
Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 90,000 Kenya Shillings to buy plastic basins, padlocks, cups and plates to sell.

loan.use: To buy plastic basins, padlocks, cups and plates to sell.

loan.name: Lisset Emperatriz Carrasco Lopez

texts.es:
La se√±ora Lisset es una mujer que tiene un peque√±o de 2 a√±os, su principal motivo de vida. Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, lo que le permite generar los ingresos que necesita junto a su esposo que brinda el servicio de transporte p√∫blico. Esta peque√±a familia vive en la ciudad de Ica, Per√∫, lugar que con el transcurso de los a√±os ha logrado un gran progreso y se ha desarrolla econ√≥micamente.
Lisset vende aproximadamente 5 horas al d√≠a, tiempo en el que visita a sus amistades y vecinos. Ella sabe que con esfuerzo se puede concretar las ventas y esto le permite mejorar constantemente su calidad de vida, como ingreso adicional se dedica a la venta de ropa y con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva ella podr√° comprar ropa para el colegio, tales como uniformes, blusas, medias, entre otros.
Lisset se ha trazado como meta en algunos meses tener una tienda establecida y con la mejora de sus ingresos podr√° cumplir su gran sue√±o ‚ÄúTener una casa propia‚Äù.
texts.en:
Lisset is a woman with a small child aged 2, her principal motive for living. At present, she sells beauty products, which allows her to generate the income she needs, together with her husband's earnings in public transportation. This small family lives in the city of Ica, Peru, a location that over the years, has made great progress and developed economically.
Lisset spends approximately 5 hours a day soliciting sales, visiting her friends and neighbors. She understands that with effort, she can make sales and this will permit her to improve her quality of life constantly. With the help of Kiva lenders, she will be able to purchase school clothes, such as uniforms, blouses, and socks, among other items, to sell.
Lisset has laid out plans for the next few months, hoping to have an established store. And with her improved income, she hopes to fulfill her grand dream: ‚ÄúTo have her own house.‚Äù

loan.use: buy school clothes to sell.

loan.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 47 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has seven children.
Perla works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for fifteen years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more fish to sell.
