Perla has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loan.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is fifty years old. She is married to Evans and together they have three school-going children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past fifteen years old.
This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She was brought to KADET Ltd. by a staff member. She will use the loan amount to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings and pay for manual labour on her farm.
She hopes to diversify and open a zero grazing.

loan.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings and pay for manual labour on her farm.

loan.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Editha works hard to support her family.
She has a purified drinking water retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hog raising and firewood sales. Editha is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more purified drinking water to sell to customers.
Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loan.use: to buy more purified drinking water to sell to customers.

loan.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married with one child. Cecilia is lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Cecilia owns a general store to earn a living and had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more stock for her grocery store.
Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Cecilia hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loan.name: Elominada

texts.en:
Elominada is from the village of Lintugop, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 34 years old. Elominada is married and has six children.
To make a living, Elominada owns and operates a business venture, manufacturing and selling nipa huts to local businesses and community members. (Nipa huts are houses constructed of bamboo with a thatched roof made from the leaves of the nipa palm.) She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.
In 2011, Elominada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
Elominada is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture nipa huts for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loan.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture nipa huts for sale.

loan.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is a thirty-eight-year-old lady from Homabay. She is married to Lucas and they have eight children aged between five and nineteen.
Peres operates a hotel business and has been doing this for the last two years. She makes a monthly income of KES 6,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy more foodstuffs like cooking oil and maize flour.
She will use her profits to repay her loan. Her dream is to own a big hotel

loan.use: To buy foodstuffs like cooking oil and maize flour.

loan.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is married with twelve children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Clarita is fifty-three years old and two of her children are in school.
Clarita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.
Clarita has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loan.name: Tausala

texts.en:
Tausala is forty-seven years of age and married with seven children
Tgausala owns and operates a business venture, selling pork buns. She has seven years of experience in this business. Tausala needs a loan of WST $3050 to purchase meat such as chicken, soy sauce, a deep frying pan, flour and cooking oil. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.
In 2009, Tausala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tausala's fifth loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase meat such as chicken, soy sauce, a deep frying pan, flour and cooking oil.

loan.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is fifty-one years old, married, and has two children.
She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Isabel requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.
She has been raising pigs for fifteen years now, and has borrowed twenty-two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Isabel would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loan.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is married with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gaudiosa is fifty-two years old and has one child who is in school.
Gaudiosa has a making and selling lumber business in the Philippines. Gaudiosa requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her lumber business.
She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Gaudiosa would like to save money to expand the business.

loan.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her lumber business.

loan.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio works hard to support he family. He is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.
Eusebio requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment to make repairs.
Eusebio has been in this business for three years.
He would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loan.use: to buy new tools and equipment to make repairs.

loan.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is twenty-two years old. She is married to Daniel. She sells second hand clothes and has been in the business for the past two years.
This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She was brought to KADET by a staff member. She will use the loan amount to purchase clothes to sell in her business.
She hopes to to purchase a plot and build residential houses in future.

loan.use: to purchase clothes to sell in her business.

loan.name: Flordelicita

texts.en:
Flordelicita works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a shoe-making business in the Philippines.
Flordelicita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shoe making business.
She has been in this business for eighteen years.
Flordelicita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loan.use: to buy materials needed for her shoe-making business.

loan.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josefina is fifty years old and one of her children is in school.
Josefina has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.
She has been in this business for thirty years. Josefina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loan.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loan.name: Sefiliga

texts.en:
Sefiliga is twenty-eight years of age and single with four children.
Sefiliga owns and operates a business venture, driving a taxi. She has two years of experience in this business. Sefiliga needs a loan of WST $1,500 to service her taxi. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.
In 2010, Sefiliga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sefiliga's second loan loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to service her taxi.

loan.name: Ludelita

texts.en:
Ludelita is thirty-eight years old and married with four children.
Ludelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.
Ludelita has borrowed and paid for six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from e-loading.
Ludelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loan.name: Mylene

texts.en:
This is Mylene, forty, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is a married to Rogel, a salesman, and is the mother of one child. Together with her husband she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
Mylene operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Mylene dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is fifty-six years old. He is married to Roxana. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past five years.
This is his fourth loan from KADET Ltd. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a staff member. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase a dairy cow.
He hopes to diversify his farming to dairy farming.

loan.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loan.name: Gigina

texts.en: This time, for her fifth loan cycle, Gigina is borrowing PHP 18,000 to fund her fishing and fish vending business. This business was previously funded through NWTF and Kiva and continues to provide Gigina and her family with income which increases and improves their living condition.

loan.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph looks young but he has three children aged between 1 and 5 years. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 14 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and build a house. In the future he wishes to have an irrigating machine.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and support labor costs.

loan.name: Maky

texts.fr: Monsieur MAKY est √¢g√© de 21 ans, c√©libataire et sans enfant. Il vit dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Hamdallaye de S√©gou N‚Äôayant pas fr√©quent√© l‚Äô√©cole pour des raisons sociales, il commen√ßa tr√®s t√¥t √† faire les activit√©s g√©n√©ratrices de revenus aupr√®s de son p√®re qui menait plusieurs activit√©s (courtier, vente d‚Äôarticles divers, etc.). Apr√®s plusieurs ann√©es d‚Äôapprentissage, MAKY, lui opta pour l‚Äôachat vente d‚Äôessence et huile pour moteur. Il m√®ne cette activit√© depuis 8 ans et jouit d‚Äôune grande exp√©rience et client√®le. Dans le souci d‚Äôaugmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de b√©n√©fice, il sollicite ce pr√™t. Il est √† son 1er pr√™t individuel et compte l‚Äôutiliser pour acheter, 220 litres d‚Äôessence. Il s‚Äôapprovisionne sur place et revend au comptant √† une client√®le mixte. Avec ce pr√™t il envisage r√©aliser un b√©n√©fice mensuel de 45.000FCFA. Ce b√©n√©fice lui permettra de rembourser son pr√™t et de mener d‚Äôautres activit√©s g√©n√©ratrices de revenus tels les activit√©s de vente d‚Äôarticles de quincailleries, activit√© dans laquelle il ambitionne s‚Äôinstaller en ouvrant une boutique de quincaillerie.
texts.en:
Mr. MAKY is a 21-year-old single man without children. He lives in a traditional family in the district of Hamdallaye, in S√©gou.
Because social reasons kept him from attending school, he started early on to earn a living alongside his father who was practicing several activities (broker, retailer of miscellaneous merchandise, etc.). After many years of training, MAKY decided to sell gas and motor oil. Eight years later, he has acquired valuable experience and a large customer base.
He is now seeking a loan to increase his working capital and bolster his revenue. This is his first individual loan, and he will use it to purchase 220 litres of gas. He buys his stock locally and sells for cash to a mixt clientele.
With the help of this loan, he expects to earn a monthly profit of 45,000CFAF, which will allow him to repay the loan and run other income-generating activities such as selling hardware items. His goal for the future is to open a hardware store.

loan.use: to buy gas for resale.

loan.name: Santos Chacon Villegas

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre de 53 a√±os de edad que tiene a un peque√±o de 6 a√±os por el que da todo de s√≠ diariamente. Actualmente vive en la ciudad de Nazca, Per√∫, atrayente de gran cantidad de turistas por las reconocidas ‚ÄúLineas de Nazca‚Äù, de las cuales se desconoce el origen de su procedencia.
√âl se dedica a la venta de hora aproximadamente 10 horas diarias, tiempo en el que atiende a una considerable cantidad de clientes, sabe que su negocio est√° teniendo √©xito por el esfuerzo y la dedicaci√≥n que le pone diariamente.
Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, desea poder realizar la compra de ropa para ni√±os que se encuentran en etapa escolar, tales como blusas, camisas, pantalones, medias, entre otros. Santos sabe que con este apoyo podr√° captar a un mayor n√∫mero de clientes debido a que es en estos meses en donde los padres de familia tienen mucho inter√©s en la compra de este tipo de prendas debido a que sus peque√±os ingresan a una nueva etapa escolar. √âl desea incrementar sus ingresos para as√≠ ampliar su negocio y as√≠ juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa.
texts.en: Santos is a 53-year-old man who has a small child, age 6. He gives his all every day for the sake of his child. He currently lives in Nazca, Peru. This region draws a large number of tourists because of the famous Nazca Lines, whose origin is unknown. Santos works as a salesman approximately ten hours per day. During this time, he serves a considerable number of clients. He knows that his business is successful because of his daily hard work and dedication. With the help of the Kiva lenders, he wants to purchase clothing for school-aged children such as: blouses, shirts, pants, socks, and other items. Santos knows that this support will allow him to capture a larger amount of customers. This is the season in which fathers are greatly interested in buying all sorts of garments because their children are starting school. Santos wants to increase his income in order to expand his business and then put together enough money to buy a plot of land and build his own house.

loan.use: to buy school clothing.

loan.name: Erly Maritza

texts.es:
Erly es una mujer de 31 a√±os de edad quien tiene 2 peque√±os hijos, uno de 5 y el menor de 4, a los cuales ama y cuida mucho. Ella y su esposo se esfuerzan diariamente por brindarles lo mejor y demostrarles que con persistencia todo puede ser posible. Actualmente su esposo trabaja como vigilante y ella se dedica al lavado de autos y venta de bebidas; ellos realizan estas labores en la ciudad de Nazca, Per√∫, lugar reconocido por las inmensas l√≠neas grabadas en sus tierras y como mayor atractivo se desconoce el origen de las mismas.
Erly es una mujer que disfruta mucho de ver televisi√≥n con sus peque√±os mientras est√° desocupada, ella trabaja aproximadamente 10 horas diarias, lo que le permite generar algunos ingresos para su familia.
Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva ella podr√° realizar una ampliaci√≥n al √°rea en donde lava los autos, as√≠ ella podr√° brindarles mejor comodidad a sus clientes y estos se sentir√°n tranquilos, c√≥modos y seguros al asistir a su local. Con los nuevos ingresos que genere desea poder continuar ampliando su negocio y con los nuevos y mejores ingresos que genere, podr√° realizar el sue√±o de la ‚ÄúCasa Propia‚Äù.
texts.en:
Erly is a 31-year-old woman who has two small children; one is 5 and the other is younger than 4. She loves her children very much and spends a great deal of time taking care of them. She and her husband work hard every day to offer them the best and to show them that everything is possible with persistence. Her husband currently works as a security guard and Erly runs a car wash and sells drinks. They both work in the city of Nazca, Peru. This area is known for the immense lines etched in the land; the most interesting thing about these lines is that their origin is unknown.
Erly is a woman who greatly enjoys watching television with her little ones when she is not busy. She works approximately ten hours per day. This allows her to generate an income for her family.
With the help of the Kiva lenders, she will be able to expand the area where she washes cars. This way, she will be able to offer her clients greater comfort and they will feel calm, comfortable and secure in going to her business. With the new income that she will generate, she wants to be able to continue expanding her business. With the income from doing so, she will be able to achieve the dream of home ownership.

loan.use: to expand the area where she washes cars.

loan.name: Loteuaina

texts.en:
Loteuaina is thirty-two years of age and married with four children.
Loteuaina works in her business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Loteuaina needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business.
In 2010, Loteuaina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Loteuaina's third loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loan.name: Truphosa

texts.en:
Truphosa is a thirty-five-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She is married to Bonaface and they have four children aged between eight and sixteen.
Truphosa is a fruit juice vendor and has been doing this for the last three years, making a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy a variety of fruits like mangoes, passion fruit and watermelons for fruit juice production.
Her anticipated profits will be used to expand her business and educate the children. Her dream is to own a fruit juice parlor.

loan.use: To buy a variety of fruits like mangoes, passion fruit and watermelons.

loan.name: Mativa

texts.en:
Mativa is fifty-six years of age and married with four children.
Mativa works in her business, planting and harvesting cocoa for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Mativa needs a loan of WST $2,700 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.
In 2009, Mativa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Mativa's fourth loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loan.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is widow with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Michelle is twenty-seven years old and her three children are in school.
Michelle has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new tools and repair her tricycle.
Michelle has been in this business for five years. In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: to buy new tools and repair her tricycle.

loan.name: Tita

texts.en:
Fifty-six-year-old Tita is a married woman with three children. Her youngest child is twenty-one years old and still goes to school. Her husband works as a farmer.
Tita is in the business of raising pigs. She has a small backyard piggery where she raises her pigs. Tita also supports her husband in selling his harvest at the market. Tita works hard to sustain her family and send her child to college. She plans to use her loan to purchase pigs, feeds and fertilizers. Tita hopes for her business to be stable.

loan.use: to purchase pigs, feeds and fertilizers.

loan.name: Rokayatou Fall

texts.fr: ROKAYATOU est √¢g√©e de 35 ans, mari√©e et m√®re de 4 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucl√©aire au quartier Pelengana Sud de S√©gou N‚Äôayant pas fr√©quent√© l‚Äô√©cole pour des raisons sociales car issue d‚Äôune famille conservatrices des valeurs ancestrales. Elle commen√ßa √† s‚Äôint√©resser aux activit√©s g√©n√©ratrices de revenus notamment la vente d‚Äôhabits appris aupr√®s de sa m√®re qui vendait des habits en cotonnade. Nantie de plusieurs ann√©es d‚Äôapprentissage, elle commen√ßa √† √©voluer seule en menant les activit√©s de commerce de Bazin car ce dernier est tr√®s pris√© sur le march√©. Elle m√®ne cette activit√© depuis 2 ans et jouit d‚Äôune grande exp√©rience et client√®le. Dans le souci d‚Äôaugmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de b√©n√©fice, elle sollicite ce pr√™t. Elle est √† son 1er pr√™t individuel qu‚Äôelle compte utiliser pour acheter 2 pi√®ces de bazins riches. Elle s‚Äôapprovisionne √† Bamako. ROKAYATOU vend au comptant √† une client√®le mixte tr√®s g√©n√©ralement elle fait de l‚Äôexportation surtout au S√©n√©gal. Avec ce pr√™t elle envisage r√©aliser un b√©n√©fice mensuel de 400 000FCFA. Ce b√©n√©fice lui permettra de rembourser son pr√™t et de mener autres activit√©s g√©n√©ratrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Rokayatou is 35 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She lives in a close family in the Pelengana neighborhood of S√©gou. She did not go to school for social reasons: she comes from a family that upholds ancestral values.
Rokayatou became interested in income-producing activities, especially selling clothes, as she learnt from her mother, who sold cotton clothes. After several years of apprenticeship, she began to work on her own by selling damask fabric, which is highly sought after. She has been doing this for two years and so she has experience, and she has many customers.
With the goal of increasing her business capital and making more profit, she is asking for a loan. This is her first individual loan which she plans to use to buy to pieces of rich damask cloth. Rokayatou obtains her supplies in Bamako. She sells on a cash basis to a variety of different customers, she also exports to Senegal. With the loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 400,000 CFA francs. This will allow her to repay the loan and take up other income-producing activities.

loan.use: to buy pieces of damask fabric.

loan.name: Maripa

texts.en:
Maripa is 55 years old. She has worked as a Kyrgyz language and literature teacher for 32 years and is now retired. As a source of income for the family Maripa does animal husbandry. The business she started during the Soviet Union times with 30,000 som (KGS) now brings her around 10,000 KGS a day. At this time Maripa's business has three milk cows, twenty sheep, nine goats and three horses.
Maripa has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 40,000 KGS to buy calves for fattening and resale with the purpose to grow her business. She plans to invest the income from the loan to increase the headcount of cattle.

loan.use: to purchase cattle.

loan.name: Elvis Alberto Meneses Antonio

texts.es:
Elvis es un hombre de 40 a√±os de edad que junto a su esposa cr√≠an a su peque√±o de 14 a√±os. Actualmente ellos tienen una bodega, en donde su esposa se dedica a esta todo el d√≠a, Elvis trabaja como chofer y tambi√©n apoya a su esposa en la bodega ya que les est√° resultando muy rentable.
Su bodega atiende un promedio 10 horas, en donde atienden aproximadamente a 36 clientes que viven por la zona. Elvis es consciente de que las personas prefieren asistir a su peque√±a tienda porque siempre le brinda un tanto amable a cada uno de sus clientes y esto ha fortalecido el v√≠nculo comercial.
Elvis desea poder realizar algunas reparaciones a su auto y desde luego comprar algunos productos para la bodega, tales como abarrotes, leche, bebidas, entre otros. Su sue√±o es poder generar mejores ingresos con su veh√≠culo y empezar a ahorra para poder hacer que su bodega se vuelva m√°s conocida, lo que le permitir√° generar mejores ingresos y as√≠ poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Elvis is a 40-year-old man who is raising a fourteen-year-old child with his wife. They run a grocery store, and his wife works there all day. Elvis works as a driver and also helps his wife in the grocery store, which is proving quite profitable. The store is open an average of ten hours per day, and they will generally see about 36 local customers. Elvis knows that people prefer to go to his little store because they always offer very good service to each and every customer. This has strengthened their business. Elvis wants to be able to make some repairs to his car and buy some products for their grocery store, such as groceries, milk, drinks, and other items. His dream is to be able to generate a better income with his vehicle and to start to save up. He hopes to make his store more well-known, which will allow him to make a better income and thus be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

loan.use: to fix his car and to buy groceries such as milk.

loan.name: Herlan Lucio

texts.es: El Sr. Herlan tiene 30 a√±os y es Soltero con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 7 A√±os, el tiene un bar y donde se encuentra instalada una rokola, donde le va muy bien, su negocio s encuentra en la zona de Warnes. Este pr√©stamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la instituci√≥n, Herlan utilizara este pr√©stamo para la Compra de 1 equipo de gas para transformar su veh√≠culo de gasolina a gas natural y as√≠ reducir sus gastos en combustible, ya que este veh√≠culo es de gran ayuda ya que le permite transportar sus productos a su negocio, Lucio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y utilizara los beneficios en Mejorar la calidad de vida, su deseo es el de que su negocio sea el mas conocido en la zona, se siente feliz y agradecido con la instituci√≥n por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Herlan is 30, single, and has a seven-year-old son. He has a bar where he has installed a jukebox, and the business is going very well. It is located in the Warnes area.
This is his third loan with the institution. Herlan will use this loan to purchase a natural gas conversion kit, in order to convert his vehicle from gasoline to natural gas, and this way reduce his fuel expenses. This is because his vehicle is a great help, as it allows him to transport products to his business.
Lucio is facing challenges in his business, such as competition. He will use his profits to improve his quality of life. His wish is that his business be the best known in the area. He is happy about the loan, and thankful to the institution for the support he has been provided.

loan.use: To purchase a natural gas conversion kit for his vehicle.

loan.name: Ignace

texts.en:
Ignace is the father of an 18-month-old child. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for four years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay for extra labor to get the best harvest. With the profit he makes, he plans to expand the area he has been farming in order to increase output and rear cows, from which he expects to get milk to better feed his family.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: to buy more fertilisers and seeds and pay for extra labor.

loan.name: Nueva Vision Group

texts.es:
La A.C. ‚ÄúNUEVA VISI√ìN‚Äù iniciar√° el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II. Est√° compuesta por trece integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra la se√±ora Teodora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociaci√≥n comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de medias y ropa de ni√±os, confecci√≥n de calzados, venta de refrescos, venta de ropa interior, tejido y venta de mantas.
La se√±ora Teodora, indica que forma parte de una asociaci√≥n comunal por primera vez y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de tejido y venta mantas que viene trabajando hace a√±os, aprendiendo el mismo de su vecina. El cr√©dito de este ciclo es para ampliaci√≥n de su negocio (compra de lana por mayor) este producto los comprar√° de las ferias del El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboraci√≥n lo comercializar√° en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella no es viuda y tiene cinco hijos.
Cuando se le consulta qu√© le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del √°rea de salud y de cr√©dito.
En la fotograf√≠a se puede observar la ausencia de la se√±ora Emilia, misma que fue a consultorio y estuvo aucente.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Nueva Visi√≥n' [New Vision] will start it's first cycle in 'Pro Mujer' as part of the 'Centro Focal de Santiago II'. The group is made up of thirteen members and has a governing board which is led by Teodora. The members of the group have a variety of businesses, including: selling panty hose, shoe making, selling drinks, selling underwear, weaving and selling blankets.
Teodora told us that she just recently became a member of the communal bank. She has a business weaving and selling blankets which she has been doing for many years. She learned the business from her neighbor. The loan from this cycle is to expand her business, which she will do by buying wool at wholesale. She buys her wool from the market in El Alto and later uses it to weave products which she sells from her store front. This allows her to support her family; she is married with five children.
When asked what she likes about 'Pro Mujer' she says she likes the trainings that focus on health and loans.
Not pictured is Emilia, she had an appointment when the picture was taken.

loan.use: to buy wool in large quantity.

loan.name: Juan Santiago

texts.es: El se√±or Juan, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante de frutas y verduras para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen dos hijas a su cargo todav√≠a , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones del hogar , ya que con mucho esfuerzos le dan estudios a sus dos hijas para que salgan adelante y logren realizar una carrera a pesar de sus limitaciones econ√≥micas ; ya que ellos son humildes agricultores que sobreviven de siembras de pi√±a , Don Juan desde hace varios a√±os se dedica al cultivo de pi√±a la mayor afectaci√≥n que se le presenta es el robo del producto lo cual se est√° viendo obligado a permanecer d√≠a y noche en las tierras donde est√°n las plantas de pi√±a. El pr√©stamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para aplicar a la producci√≥n .
texts.en: Juan lives in the town of Ticuantepe; he lives there with his wife, a retailer who sells fruits and vegetables to help him paying for their family‚Äôs expenses. They have two daughters who are still economically depending on them. In the future he wants to improve the living condition of his house. With much effort they pay for the education of their daughters so that they can get ahead in life and succeed in becoming professionals despite of their economic difficulties, as they are humble farmers surviving thanks to pineapple growing. Juan has been engaged in growing pineapple for various years, and the biggest problem he has to face is the theft of his products: for this reason he has to keep watch day and night in the lands where he plants pineapple. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers and supplies he needs for his production.

loan.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies.

loan.name: Nemesia Del Socorro

texts.es: La emprendedora Nemesia Del Socorro, ya ha venido trabajando con Fundaci√≥n Le√≥n 2000 en el cual en el cr√©dito anterior que solicito fue para invertir en el negocio y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de producto, durante el credito ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con ganas de superaci√≥n cada d√≠a en lo personal y en su negocio, la emprendedora nos expresa que su negocio est√° creciendo y que tiene nuevos clientes que la visitan. Actualmente la emprendedora est√° solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como salchicha, pan, variedad de salsas, gaseosas, jugos, bolsas entre otros productos.
texts.en: The enterprising Nemesia Del Socorro has already been working with Kiva partner Fundaci√≥n Le√≥n 2000. With her previous loan she asked to invest in her business in order to offer her clients a greater variety of products. During the life of the loan she has demonstrated herself to be a responsible person with drive to get ahead each day in her personal life and in her business. This enterprising woman expresses that her business is growing and that she has new clients that visit. Currently she is asking for a loan in order to purchase products like sausages, bread, a variety of salsas, soft-drinks, juices and bags, among other products.

loan.use: to purchase products like sausages, bread, a variety of salsas, soft-drinks, juices, and bags, among other products.

loan.name: Julieta

texts.en: This time, Julieta is applying for a loan of PHP 29,000 to fund her general store. This business was previously funded through NWTF, and Kiva partners continue to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loan.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

loan.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is from Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 49 years old, married, and has 2 children. Betty owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice to sell. Betty has been in her business for 6 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Betty joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Betty is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loan.name: Tutoatasi

texts.en:
Tutoatasi is 50 years of age and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a taro plantation, and she has many years of experience in this business.
Tutoatasi needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase equipment such as a wheelbarrow, bush knives, and containers for water. She plans to use her profits (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business.
In 2010, Tutoatasi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tutoatasi's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase equipment such as a wheelbarrow, bush knives, and containers for water

loan.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has five children between the ages of 6 and 14. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 11 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to increase his output.
The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor costs.

loan.name: Felicinda Teodora

texts.es:
Felicinda tiene 51 a√±os de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, la generosidad de sus pobladores y por la rica saz√≥n que tienen para la preparaci√≥n de los platillos caracter√≠sticos de la zona. Ella es muy entusiasta y trabajadora, con mucho esfuerzo inicio su negocio de venta de comida, raspadilla, refrescos, entre otros; ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el d√≠a, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene una muy buena saz√≥n para la preparaci√≥n de los platillos y por ello siempre regresan los clientes.
Felicinda est√° muy agradecida a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado ella podr√° terminar de construir un ambiente para poder cocinar de manera mas c√≥moda y poder tener una mejor ambiente para tener sus utensilios de cocina; lo que le permitir√° tener un ambiente seguro y adecuado para la preparaci√≥n de alimentos; asi seguir√° trabajando para cumplir su gran sue√±o:‚Äù Tener un local para tener un restaurante‚Äù.
texts.en:
Felicinda is 51 years old and she lives in the town of Chincha, famous for its beautiful beaches, the generosity of its inhabitants and for the rich flavors use to prepare the traditional dishes of the area. She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person; with much efforts she started her retailing activity, selling meals, snow cones and soft drinks among other products. She works approximately 8 hours a day and she can tend to up to 20 customers per day. She believes her activity is going well because she uses very good flavors to prepare the dishes, and for this reason her customers always come back.
Felicinda is deeply grateful to Kiva‚Äôs Lenders, as thanks to the support she has been given she will be able to finish building a room where to cook in a more comfortable way and where to have wider space to store her cooking tools. This will help her preparing her meals in a safe and proper environment, and she will thus keep on working to achieve her goal: ‚ÄúTo own a place where to open a restaurant‚Äù.

loan.use: To add working space to her cooking area.

loan.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is single and has a general store in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and has been in this business for five years.
Nancy has requested a 17,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store.
In the future, Nancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loan.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 24-year-old lady from Homabay. She is married to Raymond, and they have a four-year-old child.
Tabitha has operated a second-hand clothing business for the last two years. She makes a monthly income of KES 9,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stock of clothing to sell.
She plans to use her profits to educate her child. Her dream is to improve her living standards.

loan.use: to buy a stock of clothing to sell.

loan.name: Matalena

texts.en:
Matalena is 34 years of age and married with 6 children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro to sell. She has many years of experience in this business. Matalena needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use her profits (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business.
In 2010, Matalena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Matalena's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loan.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 47-year-old married woman with 5 children aged between 11 and 22 years old. Veronica's husband works as a fisherman and farm laborer.
Veronica has had a sari-sari store for 8 years. She sells items like shampoo, soap, canned goods, coffee, and sugar. Veronica also prepares food items like pancakes and banana cue (fried bananas), which she sells to people in her neighborhood. Veronica works hard to send her children to school. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as snacks, canned goods, and toiletries. Veronica hopes this loan will help her to improve her sari-sari store business.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell such as snacks, canned goods, and toiletries.

loan.name: Pamata

texts.en:
Pamata is 29 years of age and married with 2 children.
Pamata owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell. She has two years of experience in this business. Pamata needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use her profits (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business.
In 2010, Pamata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Pamata's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loan.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is 32 years old and single. She has been a cereals trader in Nakuru town for the last two years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends. She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of cereals so she will be able to sustain her business and satisfy her clients‚Äô needs and demands.
In the future,Teresiah hopes to expand her business by buying and selling cereals wholesale.

loan.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy a hair dryer and hair chemicals.

loan.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is from Cabgan, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old, married, and has five children
Crisanta has had her own retail business for six years and she earns 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Crisanta joined Kiva field partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services in the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities
Crisanta is requesting this loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more products to sell at her shop, such as shampoo and soap. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loan.use: to buy more products to sell such as shampoo and soap

loan.name: Freddis Antonio

texts.es: El se√±or Freddis, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su familia , ellos tienen hijos a sus cargo , su esposa labora como comerciante de frutas y verduras para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , don Freddis desde hace cuatro a√±os , se dedica a servicios de moto Taxi , en la zona de Ticuantepe, para poder llevar el alimento a su familia , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondo Kiva ya que a pesar que no tiene un ingreso fijo , le apoyan para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida ; ya que con el pr√©stamo va a comprar bloques , cemento , hierro , tablas , arenas , etc. . Para realizar una pared de su humilde vivienda ya que la actual es de de zinc y en tiempos de lluvia se le inunda su casita que con mucho esfuerzo a construido .
texts.en:
Freddis lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his family. His children still depend economically on him and his wife, who sells fruits and vegetables to help him paying for their family‚Äôs expense. Freddis has been engaged in offering moto taxi* services in the Ticuantepe area for four years, in order to provide for his family. He is thankful for the support provided by Afodenic through Kiva‚Äôs loans because these help him improving his living conditions despite him not having a stable income. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy blocks, cement, iron, planks and sand in order to have some walls built to his house. He will replace the zinc ones he currently has, as in the raining season water passes through them, flooding the house he has built with much effort.
<cite>*A ‚Äúmoto taxi‚Äù is a motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment.</cite>

loan.use: To buy blocks, cement, iron, planks and sand.

loan.name: Los Men-Dez Group

texts.es:
H√©ctor, tiene 31 a√±os de edad, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, vive en Intibuc√° junto a su esposa e hijos.
H√©ctor, desde muy peque√±o ha trabajado en la agricultura con su familia, donde ha adquirido gran experiencia, hace 13 a√±os se ha independizado con sus cultivos, est√° produciendo papa, ma√≠z, frijoles, lechuga, zanahoria y fresas. Donde vive es una zona apta para todos estos cultivos. Para √©l es la √∫nica fuente de ingresos familiar, esta producci√≥n la vende en el mercado local. Esta solicitando el cuarto pr√©stamo el cual lo va invertir en la compra de semillas de papas, abonos para darle mantenimiento y pago de mano de obra. Con los pr√©stamos anteriores ha podido mejorar el nivel productivo. Su meta es seguir aumentando los ingresos para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. H√©ctor es miembro y coordinador de un grupo solidario, el grupo est√° integrado por 7 miembros: Misael de camiseta blanca (izquierda), seguido Paula de vestido morado, Mar√≠a Telma de blusa blanca, H√©ctor se identifica con camisa color azul, Leonardo de Camisa Blanca y Mar√≠a Elizabeth de blusa Verde (derecha), todos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura.
texts.en:
H√©ctor, 31, has two school age children; he lives in Intibuc√° with his wife and children. Since he was very little, H√©ctor worked in farming with his family acquiring much experience. Thirteen years ago he became independent with his own crops; he grows potatoes, corn, beans, lettuce, carrots and strawberries. He lives in a zone that‚Äôs apt for all these crops. This is his only source of family income and he sells his products in the local market.
He is asking for his 4th loan to buy potato seeds and manure for crop maintenance and to pay labor costs. With previous loans he‚Äôs managed to improve the level of productivity. His goal is to continue increasing income in order to give his family a better standard of living.
H√©ctor is both member and coordinator of a communal bank which has 7 members: Misael in the white shirt (left), followed by Paula in the purple dress, Mar√≠a Telma in the white blouse, H√©ctor who can be identified by his blue shirt, Leonardo in the white shirt and Mar√≠a Elizabeth in the green blouse (right). They all live in the same community and work in agriculture.

loan.use: to buy potato seeds, manure and to pay labor costs.

loan.name: Olinda Marina

texts.es: Olinda tiene 34 a√±os de edad y su familia est√° conformada por ella su conyugue y 02 hijos dependientes. Olinda lleva m√°s de 05 a√±os dedic√°ndose a la crianza de gallinas y patos, Con el esfuerzo de ella y de su conyugue han salido adelante y han podido darles una educaci√≥n a sus hijos el cual siguen en el colegio tambi√©n ha podido mejorar su vivienda. Olinda es una mujer trabajadora que se siente con todas las fuerzas de seguir trabajando y de esta manera brindarle una mejor calidad a su familia. El sue√±o de Olinda es de instalar una tienda de abarrotes pues as√≠ asegura ella tendr√° mayores ganancias. Es esta oportunidad solicito el cr√©dito para comprar √∫tiles escolares para sus hijos como cuadernos, lapiceros, f√≥lderes, etc. ya que comienzan las clases del colegio y tambi√©n para comprar comida balanceada para sus animales. Olinda agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Olinda, 34, has a family composed of her spouse and two dependent children. She‚Äôs been raising chickens and ducks for more than five years. With her and her spouse‚Äôs efforts they have gotten ahead and been able to provide their children with an education; they are still attending school; she‚Äôs also been able to do some home improvements.
Olinda is a hardworking woman who feels fully strong to continue working to provide her family with a better quality of life. Her dream is to open a grocery store because she is sure she‚Äôll earn higher profits that way.
On this occasion she‚Äôs asking for a loan to buy school supplies for her children like notebooks, pencils, folders, etc. since classes in school are about to start and also to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals. Olinda thanks Kiva lenders for the support provided.

loan.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, folders and nutritionally balanced feed.

loan.name: Todo Lo Puede En Cristo - Huancayo Group

texts.es: La Se√±ora JESUS ISABEL, de 46 a√±os de edad casada, con una hija de 14 a√±os, se caracteriza por ser muy alegre y ocurrente, ella es presidenta de la Alcanc√≠a comunal ‚ÄúTODO LO PUEDE EN CRISTO - HUANCAYO‚Äù. Ella tiene su bodeguita en su casa se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como verduras, condimentos, bebidas, etc. el pr√©stamo lo invertir√° en la compra de mercader√≠as para su bodega y as√≠ satisfacer mejorar los pedidos de sus clientes, desea comprarse en el futuro su camioneta para el traslado de mercader√≠as. La se√±ora se encuentra ubicada primera persona lado derecha viste con chompa color guindo.
texts.en: Jes√∫s Isabel is a 46 year old married woman with a 14 year old daughter. She is characterized by being very cheerful and witty. She is the president of the ‚ÄúTodo Lo Puede En Cristo-Huancayo‚Äù (Everything is Possible in Christ-Huancayo) communal bank. She has a small grocery store at home where she sells foodstuffs like vegetables, condiments, beverages, etc. She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her store to better meet customer demand. She wants to buy herself a pick-up truck in the future to transport her merchandise. She is the first person on the right wearing a maroon sweater.

loan.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loan.name: Filipenses Group

texts.es: El grupo Filipense lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Sonia quien vende cosm√©ticos y perfumes desde hace 11 a√±os inicio con la venta v√≠a catalogo y poco a poco fue aumentando su negocio. Ella tiene tres hijos de 19, 14 y 7 a√±os todos estudian la mayor est√° en la universidad. Las otras integrantes son Karla Patricia quien vende tortillas y nacatamales desde hace 14 a√±os y Ang√©lica vende arroz de leche, bu√±uelos, atolillo y cajeta desde hace 1 a√±o.
texts.en:
The 'Filipense' group is made up of three hard working entrepreneurs. One of the members is Sonia, she sells cosmetics and perfumes. She has been selling these items for the last 11 years. She started selling from catalogs and little by little expanded her business. She has three children who are 19, 14 and 7 years old. All of her children are studying; the oldest is studying in the university.
The other members are Karla Patricia who sells tortillas and 'nacatamales' (traditional Nicaraguan tamales), which she has been doing for 14 years and Angelica who sells 'arroz de leche' (a traditional drink made with sweetened milk and rice, similar to rice pudding), 'bu√±uelos' (a snack made with deep fried yuca and served with honey), 'atolillo' (sweetened squash) and 'cajeta' (similar to caramel) which she has been doing for one year now.

loan.use: to buy merchandise, cosmetics and perfumes.

loan.name: Ildeblande

texts.en:
Ildeblande is married with four children aged between 9 and 17. All of his children are enrolled in school. He has been a rice farmer since 2004. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay for extra labor in order to get the best harvest. With the profit he makes, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to increase output.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: to pay for fertilisers, seeds and extra labor.

loan.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is 40 years of age and married with one child. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. She has two years of experience in this business. Mele needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use her profits (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.
In 2011, Mele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Mele's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 32 years old. She is a single mother of four. She is a tailor and has been in the business for the past 13 years.
This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She will use the loan to purchase sewing materials like thread and needles and to purchase a modern sewing machine.
She hopes to expand her business in order to improve her living standards.

loan.use: to purchase sewing materials and a modern sewing machine.

loan.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is 42 years of age and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. She has 2 years of experience in this business. Lisa needs a loan of WST $1450 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use her profits (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business.
In 2011, Lisa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Lisa's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loan.name: Metala

texts.en:
Metala is 20 years of age and married. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro to sell. She has 2 years of experience in this business. Metala needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use her profits (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.
In 2011, Metala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Metala's 2nd loan with SPBD.*

loan.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loan.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. ‚ÄúMARIPOSAS‚Äù iniciar√° el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo. Est√° compuesta por ocho integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva en la que la se√±ora Ana es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociaci√≥n comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de carnicer√≠a, venta de chompas, venta de calzados, artesana en pollerer√≠a, venta de CD‚Äôs, venta de verduras, venta de productos Hervalife.
La se√±ora Ana, indica que forma parte de una asociaci√≥n comunal desde hace un a√±o atr√°s y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa, que viene trabajando hace a√±os, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre. El cr√©dito de este ciclo es para ampliaci√≥n de su mercader√≠a (compra de ropa) estos productos los adquirir√° de las ferias de la ciudad de Cochabamba y posteriormente lo comercializar√° en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.
Cuando se le consulta qu√© le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el √°rea de credito.
texts.en:
The ‚ÄúMariposas‚Äù (Butterflies) communal bank will start its second cycle within Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Focal Center. It has 8 members led by a governing board; Ana is the secretary. The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses. Among them we have a butcher shop, sweater sales, footwear sales, traditional skirt crafts, CD sales, vegetable sales and Herbalife product sales.
Ana indicates that she‚Äôs been part of a communal bank for a year and that she currently has a business selling clothes that she‚Äôs had for years having learned it from her mother. The loan this cycle is to expand her stock of merchandise. She will buy clothes in the city of Cochabamba‚Äôs street markets to then resell in her stand. This way of working allows her to support her family since she‚Äôs single and has three children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit department.

loan.use: to buy clothes.

loan.name: Jonathan Leonardo Janampa Bravo

texts.es:
Jhonatan tiene 31 a√±os de edad, el cual vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por un clima caluroso en cualquier √©poca del a√±o, asimismo tiene como una de sus actividades principales la agricultura, en especial la cosecha de uva, esp√°rragos, pallares. Como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida t√≠pica e nuestro pa√≠s, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el ‚ÄúCau, Cau‚Äù, con mucho esfuerzo actualmente est√° estudiando la carrera de psicolog√≠a, ya que le gusta mucho.
Jhonatan trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, √©l le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 9 horas al d√≠a y puede atender hasta 40 clientes, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque brinda una buena atenci√≥n a sus clientes.
Jhonatan est√° muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada el podr√° realizar mejoras en su local (pintado del local, mejoramiento de fachada) y comprar un toldo para poner en el techo, as√≠ tendr√° un local m√°s vistoso y los clientes se sentir√°n mas c√≥modos, lo que le permitir√° mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sue√±o:‚Äù Tener su casa Propia‚Äù.
texts.en:
Jhonatan is 31 years old and he lives in the town of Ica, famous for its hot climate all over the years; agriculture is one of its main activities, notably grapes, asparagus and lima beans plantations. Being a true Peruvian, he enjoys the typical dishes of our country, one of his favorite being ‚ÄúCau Cau‚Äù*. With much efforts he also succeeds in attending university, where he studies psychology, something her likes very much.
Jhonatan runs a grocery store, working there almost 9 hours per day, and he can tend to up to 40 customers. He believes his activity his going well because he tends to his customers with good care.
Jhonatan is deeply grateful to Kiva‚Äôs Lenders because thanks to the help her has been given he will be able to improve his shop (painting of the room, improving of the fa√ßade) and to buy an awning to attach it to his roof. He will this have a more colorful place and his customers will feel more comfortable, thus granting him the improvement of his earnings and allowing him to keep on fighting to achieve his goal: ‚ÄúTo own a house‚Äù.
*Cau Cau is a typical Peruvian dish of Creole origins, made of tripe or chicken, potatoes, onion, garlic, lime and spices such as cumin, mint and pepper.

loan.use: To improve his shop and to buy an awning.

loan.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. ‚ÄúMUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS‚Äù iniciar√° el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes. Est√° compuesta por ocho integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra la se√±ora Olga. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociaci√≥n comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pl√°sticos, taller de costura, tejido de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de perfumes, venta de jugos, venta de ropa.
La se√±ora Olga, indica que forma parte de una asociaci√≥n comunal desde el anterior ciclo. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta jugos de quinua y manzana, que viene trabajando hace a√±os, aprendiendo el mismo al ayudar a su mam√°. El cr√©dito de este ciclo es para aumentar su capital (compra de v√≠veres) que adquirir√° de las ferias pace√±as y posteriormente lo comercializar√° todas las ma√±anas de forma ambulante. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.
Cuando se le consulta qu√© le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gust√≥ el √°rea de cr√©dito.
texts.en:
The ‚ÄúMujeres Emprendedoras‚Äù (Enterprising Women) communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center. It has 8 members and they have a governing board headed by Olga. The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses. Among them we have plastics sales, sewing workshop, clothes weaving, neighborhood store, perfume sales, juice sales and clothes sales.
Olga indicates that she‚Äôs been part of a communal bank since the previous cycle. She currently has a business selling quinoa and apple juice that she‚Äôs had for years having learned it from her mother. The loan this cycle is to increase capital. She will buy foodstuffs in street markets in La Paz and later on will sell them every morning in an itinerant manner. This way of working allows her to support her family since she has a spouse and three children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit department.

loan.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loan.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina is a married woman with seven children. Dina is 44-years-old and resides at Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Dina used her last loan to purchase raw materials for the business. Her business has grown and become successful. Now she's taking a new loan to purchase additional fish to raise. Positively, she hopes to be able to increase her business.

loan.use: to purchase additional fish to raise.

loan.name: Benedett

texts.en:
Benedett is a 37-years-old lady from Homabay and is single but takes care of two dependents aged seven and 18 years old.
Benedett operates a beauty salon, a business she has been running for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 5,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy hair shampoo and blow dryers.
Her profits will be used to educate the children. Her dream is to build her own house.

loan.use: to buy shampoo and blowdryers.

loan.name: Paola Alejandra

texts.es: La Sra. Paola tiene 21 a√±os, es soltera no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa su tienda se encuentra en la zona norte de la ciudad de La Paz, este pr√©stamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la instituci√≥n, La Sra. Paola utilizara este pr√©stamo para la compra de ropa por mayor seg√∫n la temporada para de esta manera surtir su tienda ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus prendas de vestir, la raz√≥n para solicitar este pr√©stamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo, Paola enfrenta retos en su negocio que son ampliar la gama de productos con pantalones, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la atenci√≥n y ampliando la variedad de sus prendas, con la variedad de sacos y chamarras, Paola se siente feliz ya agradecida con la instituci√≥n por al oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Paola is 21 years old, she is single and has no children. She sells different kind of clothes, and he shop is located in the north of La Paz. This is her second cycle in the institution. Paola will use the loans to buy clothes at wholesale price and according o the season, in order to supply her store as she has many requests for her clothes. The reason she has asked for a loan is to increase her working capita. Paola faces challenges in her activity, such as increasing the variety of products she sells by adding trousers. She will use the benefits to improve her customer care and to increase the variety of her clothes adding jumpers and leather jackets. Paola feels happy and thankful to the institution fort the support she is being given.

loan.use: To buy clothes at wholesale price such as trousers, jumpers and leather jackets.

loan.name: Ku√±a Guapa Group

texts.es: Este Comit√© se formo gracias a las Se√±ora Olga, quien se inspiro en la idea de ayudar a cada una de sus compa√±eras ya que todas tienen ganas de salir adelante por todo el esfuerzo que est√°n haciendo en este peque√±o lapso de tiempo que llevan dentro del comit√©, as√≠ tambi√©n tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Carmen es una persona muy luchadora, trabajadora, y por sobre todo muy sacrificada, y comenta que vende todo tipo de prendas que trae de todas partes. Gracias a que tiene mucha variedad atrae a muchos clientes y eso la ayuda air creciendo y mejorando cada d√≠a m√°s. Su meta es tener un local amplio donde pueda tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella solicita le cr√©dito para la compra de prendas, con las cuales podr√° abastecer su negocio y de esa forma tener m√°s variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee formed thanks to Olga who was inspired by the idea of helping each of her fellow members since they all want to get ahead through the effort they‚Äôve been putting into it in the short period of time they‚Äôve been in the committee; she also very much wants to get ahead.
Carmen is a very tenacious, hardworking and above all very self-sacrificing person who comments that she sells all types of clothes that she brings from everywhere. Thanks to having quite a variety she attracts many customers and this helps her to grow and improve a bit more each day. Her goal is to have a spacious locale where she can have greater variety to offer her customers.
She is asking for the loan to buy clothes to stock her business in order to have more variety available to offer her customers.

loan.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loan.name: Evans Atuti Nyakeri

texts.en:
Evans is 43-years-old, married and has 5 children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition.
Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand his shop to a wholesale in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, maize, flour and cooking oil for selling.

loan.use: to buy sugar, maize, flour and cooking oil for selling.

loan.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.
Estrella requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.
She has been in this business for 6 years.
In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loan.name: Maria Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
Mar√° Zoila tiene 50 a√±os de edad es viuda tiene una hija, vive con la hija de 25 a√±os de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bol√≠var.
La VRC Emmanuel est√° conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda. Mar√≠a se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, legumbres, cebollas, col, adem√°s cr√≠a pollos, cerdos y ganado. Solicita el cr√©dito para comprar fertilizantes, abono org√°nico, urea, plantas de cebollas, br√≥coli. Con la ayuda del cr√©dito podr√° salvar los cultivos de la maleza.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda cada 15 d√≠as. El sue√±o es poder tener un veh√≠culo que sea propio. Los desaf√≠os a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y el mal clima.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y disfrutar de las fechas del carnaval
texts.en:
Mar√≠a Zoila, 50, is a widow and has a daughter; she lives with her 25 year old daughter in Guaranda Province in Bol√≠var.
The ‚ÄúEmmanuel‚Äù communal bank has 12 members and is located 40 minutes from the office located in Recinto San Juan de Llullundongo belonging to Guaranda.
Mar√≠a farms potatoes, vegetables, onions and cabbage and she also raises chickens, pigs and cattle.
She requests the loan to buy fertilizer, organic manure, urea, onion plants and broccoli. With help from the loan she will be able to rescue the crops from weeds.
Her purchases and sales take place in Guaranda every 15 days. Her dream is to be able to have a vehicle of her own. The challenges she faces are competition and bad weather. In her free time she likes to rest and to enjoy Carnival time.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer, organic manure, urea, onion plants and broccoli.

loan.name: Luis Geronimo

texts.es: Luis de 60 a√±os es un padre de familia que tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 13 a 36 a√±os. Su negocio es vender galletas, dulces y mecatos, actividad en la que tiene 30 a√±os de experiencia, aprendidos en la ciudad de Medell√≠n, o ciudad de la eterna primavera y por consiguiente de hermosas flores. En esta ciudad trabajaba con su esposa vendiendo bolas de coco en el espacio p√∫blico, pero no le permitieron seguir y por eso vendi√≥ y se traslad√≥ a la ciudad de Barranquilla a casa de una amiga que lo acogi√≥. Su actual negocio est√° ubicado en un punto comercial p√∫blico, donde vende adem√°s de dulces, caf√© en termo y con ello ha ganado una buena clientela, que trabaja en empresas, almacenes y establecimientos comerciales, ubicados alrededor de su negocio. Ellos en la actualidad est√°n solicit√°ndole que agregue a su negocio meriendas. Pero su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para responder a este plan, esta a es la raz√≥n por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaci√≥n Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprar√° alimentos para vender a la hora del desayuno, en las medias ma√±anas y medias tardes. Su credikiva se postula como exitoso porque lo hace basado en la demanda del mercado y √©l tiene muy buena experiencia en las relaciones comerciales con el perfil de los clientes objeto de su atenci√≥n.
texts.en:
Luis, 60, is a father of five children whose ages range from 13 to 36 years. His business is selling cookies, candy and packaged snacks, a business he has 30 years‚Äô experience in having learned it in the city of Medell√≠n, or the City of Eternal Springtime and of beautiful flowers.
He worked with his wife in this city selling coconut balls in the public space but he wasn‚Äôt allowed to continue so he sold out and moved to the city of Barranquilla to the house of a friend who took him in. His current business is located in a public commercial spot where besides candy he also sells coffee in a thermos. He has acquired a good clientele of employees in firms, stores and commercial establishments located around his business. They are asking him to add prepared meals to his business but his working capital is insufficient to do so which is why he‚Äôs calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundaci√≥n Mario Santo Domingo, to buy food to sell during breakfast time, at midmorning and at midafternoon.
His Kiva loan promises to be successful because he‚Äôs doing it based on market demand and he has good experience in commercial relations; his customers‚Äô profiles are of particular focus for him.

loan.use: to buy food.

loan.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Mar√≠a Natividad tiene 53 a√±os de edad es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos, vive con los hijos en Guaranda provincia de bol√≠var.
La VRC Emmanuel est√° conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.
Mar√≠a se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, ma√≠z, adem√°s cr√≠a cerdos.Solicita el cr√©dito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, abono org√°nico, urea, l√≠quidos mata plagas. Con la ayuda del cr√©dito podr√° comprar los insumos y comprar animales.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guanujo semanalmente. El sue√±o es poder tener un veh√≠culo que sea propio. Los desaf√≠os a los que se enfrenta son la competencia y el transporte.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y escuchar m√∫sica.
texts.en:
Mar√≠a Natividad, 53, is a single mother of three children; she lives with her children in Guaranda Province, Bol√≠var.
The ‚ÄúEmmanuel‚Äù communal bank has 12 members and is located 40 minutes from the office located in Recinto San Juan de Llullundongo belonging to Guaranda.
Mar√≠a farms potatoes and corn and also raises pigs. She‚Äôs asking for the loan to buy manure, fertilizer, organic manure, urea and bug killing liquids. With help from the loan she will be able to buy supplies and to buy animals.
Her purchases and sales take place in Guanjo weekly. Her dream is to be able to have a vehicle of her own. The challenges she faces are competition and transportation. In her free time she enjoys resting and listening to music.

loan.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, organic manure, urea and bug killing liquids.

loan.name: Jose Francisco Ramirez Rumiguano

texts.es:
Jos√© Francisco tiene 22 a√±os de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en guaranda provincia de bol√≠var.
La VRC Emmanuel est√° conformada por 12 socios esta ventanilla queda a 40 minutos de la oficina ubicada en el recinto San Juan de Llullundongo perteneciente a Guaranda.
Jos√© se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, ma√≠z, adem√°s se dedica a la cr√≠a de ganado, cerdos. Solicita el cr√©dito para comprar ganado y comprar fertilizantes, abono org√°nico, l√≠quidos mata plagas. Con la ayuda del cr√©dito podr√° incrementar el negocio.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda semanalmente. El sue√±o es poder comprar un veh√≠culo y una casa. Los desaf√≠os a los que se enfrenta es la competencia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol, jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Jos√© Francisco is 22 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his parents in Guaranda Province, Bol√≠var.
The ‚ÄúEmmanuel‚Äù communal bank has 12 members and is located 40 minutes from the office located in Recinto San Juan de Llullundongo belonging to Guaranda.
Jos√© farms potatoes and corn and also raises cattle and pigs. He asks for the loan to buy cattle, fertilizer, organic manure and bug killing liquids. With help from the loan he will be able to increase business.
His sales and purchases take place weekly in Guaranda. His dream is to be able to buy a car and a house. The challenge he faces is competition. In his free time he likes to play soccer and play ball.

loan.use: to buy cattle, fertilizer, organic manure and bug killing liquids.

loan.name: Esperanza De Alto Lima Group

texts.es:
La A.C. ‚ÄúESPERANZA DE ALTO LIMA‚Äù iniciar√° el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima. Est√° compuesta por ocho integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra la se√±ora Olga. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociaci√≥n comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, artesano en yeso, venta de zapatos, comercio de ropa d bebe, reciclaje de fierros y cables, venta de ropa, venta de tucumanas.
La se√±ora Olga, indica que forma parte de una asociaci√≥n comunal por primera vez y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio venta de comida que viene trabajando hace a√±os, ya que anteriormente contaba con un negocio similar. El cr√©dito de este ciclo es para ampliaci√≥n de su negocio (compra de garrafa y v√≠veres) mismos que adquiere de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboraci√≥n lo comercializar√° en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella no es casada y tiene cinco hijos.
En la fotograf√≠a podemos ver a la se√±ora Adela que se esconde de las c√°maras, pues se encontraba nerviosa ante las c√°maras
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Esperanza de Alto Lima' [The Hope of Alto Lima] will start it's first cycle with 'Pro Mujer' as a part of the 'Centro Focal de Alto Lima'. The group is made up of eight members, with a governing board that is led by Olga.
