The group members are involved with a variety of businesses, including: selling food, making and selling plaster art, selling shoes, selling baby clothes, recycling iron and cables, selling clothing and selling 'tucumanas' (a meat filled pastry).
Olga told us that she just recently joined the association. She has a business selling food which she has been doing for many years. Before she had this specific business, she had a similar one. This cycle's loan will be used to expand her business, which she will do by purchasing a tank of gas and food. She will buy the supplies in the city of El Alto and later will make her food to sell in the market. This work allows her to support her family; she is unmarried and has five children.
In the photo we are not able to see Adela's face, because she hid while the picture was being taken. She is camera shy.

loan.use: to buy a tank of gas and food.

loan.name: Onaira

texts.es: Onaira vive con su c√≥nyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 1 y 9 a√±os de edad. Ella tiene una farmacia en la que vende medicinas sin restricci√≥n m√©dica, desde hace 6 a√±os. Ella empez√≥ con pocos productos, pero gradualmente fue creciendo con los financiamientos recibidos y reinvirtiendo en √©l, las utilidades que este le produc√≠a, porque es una mujer muy disciplinada. Ella vende diversas medicinas y tiene su local bien surtido, pues sus compras son 45% de contado y 55% a cr√©dito. Sus clientes son vecinos del mismo barrio donde est√° ubicada y de los alrededores de √©l. Onaira ha recibido 5 financiamientos de la Fundaci√≥n Mario Santo Domingo, organizaci√≥n a la que est√° vinculada desde hace 5 a√±os, y con la que logr√≥ ampliar su negocio en infraestructura locativa y ha vinculado varias vitrinas y estanter√≠as. En la actualidad est√° aplicando a un sexto financiamiento y es justamente un credikiva, con el cual comprar√° medicamentos y una vitrina m√°s. El √©xito de esta inversi√≥n radica en que tendr√° la oportunidad de incrementar sus compras de contado y esto la ayudar√° con la aplicaci√≥n de precios m√°s competitivos. Su meta mas adelante es adquirir su vivienda y por eso trabaja continuamente para poder lograrlo.
texts.en: Onaira lives with her husband and their 2 children aged 1 and 9. She has been running a pharmacy for six years, and she sells medicines without prescription. She started with a few products, but she has gradually grown thanks to the loans she has received and by investing in her activity the profits she has made, being the very disciplined woman she is. She sells different medicines and she keeps her pharmacy well supplied; 45% of her sales are paid cash, the remaining 55% on credit. Her customers are inhabitants of the same neighborhood where the pharmacy is located and of the areas around it. Onaira has received 5 loans from Fundaci√≥n Mario Santo Domingo, an institution she has been bound to for 5 years, and thanks to which she has succeeded in expanding her pharmacy by renting a place and she has placed there various cabinets and shelves. She is currently requesting a sixth loan, through Kiva, that she will use to buy medicaments and another cabinet. The success of this investment will mean she will have the change to increase her cash sales, and this in turn will help her offering more competitive prices. Her future goal is to buy her house, and she continues working in order to achieve her goal.

loan.use: To buy medicines and a cabinet.

loan.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Bilene, Prov√≠ncia de Gaza, Sul de Mo√ßambique, casada e m√£e de 8 filhos dos quais apenas 1 ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 1¬™ classe e parou por falta de condi√ß√µes financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa pr√≥pria com a sua fam√≠lia e n√£o sustenta mais ningu√©m.
Saiu de Bilene para Maputo no distrito de Boane quando se juntou com o pai dos seus filhos, trabalha como oper√°ria agr√≠cola h√° mais de 12 anos na Bananal√¢ndia e tem um sal√°rio de 2.230.00.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta banc√°ria com ajuda do seu marido.
Nunca teve empr√©stimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atrav√©s de uma amiga que tamb√©m √© cliente desta institui√ß√£o. Este √© o seu segundo empr√©stimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de constru√ß√£o para a obra da sua casa (ferro, cimento, pedra, areia, e outros). O empr√©stimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt, para habita√ß√£o.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empr√©stimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en: She was born in the district of Bilene, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. She's married and has 8 children, only one of which still attends school. She completed 1st grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else. She left Bilene for Maputo, in the district of Boane, when she moved in with the father of her children. She has been an agricultural worker for the Bananal√¢ndia company for over 12 years. She earns a salary of 2.230mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account with help from her husband. She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to build her home (iron, cement, rocks, sand, etc). The previous loan was for 10.000mt, for housing expenses. She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to finish building her house, and for that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loan.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to build her house (iron, cement, rocks, sand, etc.).

loan.name: Aida

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze, Prov√≠ncia de Gaza, Sul de Mo√ßambique, vi√∫va e m√£e de 4 filhos todos j√° pararam de estudar e formaram suas fam√≠lias. Fez a 3¬™ classe e parou por falta de condi√ß√µes financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa pr√≥pria com a sua fam√≠lia e sustenta mais 3 netos que vivem com ela.
Saiu de Manjacaze para Maputo no distrito de Boane a procura de emprego, trabalha como oper√°ria agr√≠cola h√° mais de 12 anos na Bananal√¢ndia e tem um sal√°rio de 2.230.00.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta banc√°ria.
Nunca teve empr√©stimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atrav√©s de uma amiga que tamb√©m √© cliente desta institui√ß√£o. Este √© o seu segundo empr√©stimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de constru√ß√£o para a obra da sua casa (barrotes, cimento, pedra, areia, e outros). O empr√©stimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt, para habita√ß√£o.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empr√©stimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en: She was born in the district of Manjacaze, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. She's a widow and has four children - all of them are out of school and have started their own families. She completed 3rd grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports three grandchildren who live with her. She left Manjacaze for Maputo, in the district of Boane, in search of a job. She has been an agricultural worker for the Bananal√¢ndia company for over 12 years. She earns a salary of 2.230mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account. She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to build her house (beams, cement, rocks, sand, etc). The previous loan was for 10.000mt, for housing expenses. She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to finish building and furnishing her home, and for that purpose she plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loan.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to build her house (beams, cement, rocks, sand, etc.).

loan.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Zavala, Prov√≠ncia de Gaza, Sul de Mo√ßambique, solteira e m√£e de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a Escola. Nunca teve oportunidade de frequentar a Escola por falta de condi√ß√µes financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa pr√≥pria com a sua fam√≠lia e n√£o sustenta mais ningu√©m.
Saiu de Zavala para Maputo no distrito Boane a procura de emprego, trabalha como oper√°ria agr√≠cola h√° mais de 12 anos na Bananal√¢ndia e tem um sal√°rio de 2.230.00.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta banc√°ria.
J√° teve empr√©stimo no BIM e pagou sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atrav√©s de uma amiga que tamb√©m √© cliente desta institui√ß√£o. Este √© o seu primeiro empr√©stimo na Hluvuku no valor de 8.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de constru√ß√£o para a obra da sua casa (chapas, barrotes, cimento, pedra, areia, e outros). Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empr√©stimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en: She was born in the district of Zavala, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. She's single and has three children, two of which attend school. She never had the opportunity to go to school because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else. She left Zavala for Maputo, in the district of Boane, in search of a job. She has been an agricultural worker for the Bananal√¢ndia company for over 12 years. She earns a salary of 2.230mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account. She has had a loan with BIM and has managed to repay it without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 8.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to build her house (metal sheets, beams, cement, rocks, sand, etc). She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to finish building her home, and for that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loan.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to build her home (metal sheets, beams, cement, rocks, sand, etc.).

loan.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa, 46 years old, is married and has two children. Hoa and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City.
Hoa has run a food stall for two years, selling beef and noodles. She intends to use her loan to buy better quality beef and other ingredients to make better food for selling. Hoa hopes her business runs smoothly and that it will help her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for her children's education.

loan.use: To buy better quality beef and other ingredients

loan.name: Renacer 2 Group

texts.es: Renacer 2 se denomina el buen grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de It√°, gracias a que la presidenta, la Sra. Lida contact√≥ con la asesora para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comit√© de Mujeres, una vez asesorada invito a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4¬∞ ciclo, en forma conjunta y dentro de un ambiente de cooperaci√≥n. Lida nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, ya que tiene una farmacia bien surtida con todo tipo de buenos productos. Comenta que se inicio con una peque√±a farmacia, pero que con el correr del tiempo y gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio ha podido salir adelante y agrandar su local, el cual es el sustento de toda su familia. Cuenta que le gustar√≠a poder seguir creciendo y alg√∫n d√≠a tener sucursales en todas partes. Ella se ha acercado a la fundaci√≥n y a kiva para solicitar un pr√©stamo, el cual desea invertir para la compra de medicamentos, con los cuales podr√° abastecer su farmacia y tener bien surtido, con lo cual podr√° estar preparada para el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Renacer 2 is the name of a good group of women in the city of It√°. The president, Lida, contacted the counselor to find out about how the Comit√© de Mujeres works. Once she found out, she invited the 16 women who are working very happily in their fourth cycle, united in an ambience of cooperation.
Lida tells us that she works selling medications. She has a well stocked pharmacy with all kinds of good products. She says that she started with a small pharmacy, but over time and thanks to her hard work and sacrifice, she has been able to get ahead and enlarge her locale, which is her family's support. She says that she would like to be able to keep growing and someday have branches everywhere.
She has approached the foundation and Kiva to ask for a loan. She wants to invest it in buying medications to stock her pharmacy with and have a good selection to be prepared for her customer's orders.

loan.use: to buy medication for a pharmacy.

loan.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is married and has seven children aged between 11 and 30. He has been a rice farmer for the past 12 years. Pascal would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to support his labor costs in order to get the best harvest. He plans to use the profits to expand his farming area to get more output and to pay the children's school fees.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor costs.

loan.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is married and the father of a child. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Elmer has been a service driver for 3 years, and earns PHP 4,500.

In 2011, Elmer became an official member of GDMPC. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. Elmer expects to have enough supply for the business and to allocate an adequate sum of money to sustain his livelihood and expand his business.

loan.use: to repair a transport vehicle

loan.name: Joao

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Prov√≠ncia de Zamb√©zia, Norte de Mo√ßambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez o Ensino superior e parou por falta de tempo de continuar os Estudos. Vive na casa pr√≥pria com a sua fam√≠lia e n√£o sustenta mais ningu√©m.
Saiu de Zamb√©zia para Maputo no distrito Boane em miss√£o de servi√ßo, √© chefe de reparti√ß√£o de administra√ß√£o na UEM (Universidade Eduardo Mondlane) h√° mais de 23 anos e tem um sal√°rio de 13.000.00.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta banc√°ria (BIM).
J√° teve empr√©stimo no BCI e pagou sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atrav√©s de um amigo que tamb√©m √© cliente desta institui√ß√£o. Este √© o seu Segundo empr√©stimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de constru√ß√£o para a obra da sua casa (cimento, pedra, areia, janelas, portas e outros). Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua fam√≠lia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empr√©stimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en: He was born in the province of Zamb√©zia, northern Mozambique. He's married and has five children, all of which attend school. He went to college and stopped due to lack of time for continuing his studies. He lives with his family in a house he owns and does not support anyone else. He left Zamb√©zia for Maputo, in the district of Boane, on a work assignment. He has been head of an administrative department at UEM (Eduardo Mondlane University) for over 23 years and earns a salary of 13.000mt. He uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in his bank account. He has had a loan with BCI and has managed to repay it without difficulties. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to build his house (cement, rocks, sand, window frames, doors, etc.). He pledges to make his repayments as scheduled. In the future he intends to finish building his home so that he can provide more comfort for his family. For that purpose he plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loan.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to build his house (cement, rocks, sand, window frames, doors, etc.).

loan.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne, 24 years old, is married to Alphas and the mother of a 2-year-old child. Carolyne has been operating a fruit and vegetable stall business for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,900. She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of foodstuffs such as tomatoes, onions and kale to sell. Carolyne's profits will be used to provide for her family. Her dream is to grow her business through KADET funding.

loan.use: To buy more stock of tomatoes, onions and kale

loan.name: Ulima

texts.en:
Ulima, 35 years of age, is married and has 3 children. For the past 2 years, Ulima has owned and operated a business selling dairy products in the local community. She needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.
In 2011, Ulima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Ulima's 2nd loan with SPBD.
*

loan.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loan.name: Telematina

texts.en:
Telematina, 33 years of age, is married and has 2 children. For the past 2 years, Telematina has owned and operated a business, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women). She needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Telematina plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to make improvements to her house.
In 2011, Telematina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Telematina's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loan.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Prov√≠ncia de Maputo, Sul de Mo√ßambique, casada e m√£e de 7 filhos todos maiores de idade. Nunca teve a oportunidade de frequentar a Escola por falta de condi√ß√µes financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa pr√≥pria com a sua fam√≠lia e sustenta mais 4 netos que vivem com ela.
√â negociante h√° mais de 7 anos e o marido √© pensionista ela dedica-se a compra e revenda de produtos diversos, e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.500.00.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta banc√°ria (BIM).
J√° teve empr√©stimo no TCHUMA e pagou sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atrav√©s de uma amiga que tamb√©m √© cliente desta institui√ß√£o. Este √© o seu s√©timo empr√©stimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, peixe, arroz, √≥leo, farinha, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empr√©stimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt, 6.600.00mt, 10.000.00mt,13.000.00mt,21.000.00mt,e 22.000.00mt,aplicados no neg√≥cio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende fazer crescer o neg√≥cio para satisfazer as necessidades dos clientes, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empr√©stimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en: She was born in the town of Matola, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She's married and has seven adult children. She never had the opportunity to go to school because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports four grandchildren who live with her. She has been a businesswoman for over seven years and her husband is a pensioner. She buys and sells various products and earns an income of about 6.500mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account. She has had a loan with TCHUMA and has repaid it without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her 7th loan with Hluvuku. It is for 25.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (peanuts, fish, rice, oil, flour, etc.) in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise. The previous loans were for 6.000mt, 6.600mt, 10.000mt, 13.000mt, 21.000mt and 22.000mt, for her business. She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to expand her business in order to meet her customers' needs. For that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loan.use: to purchase goods for selling (peanuts, fish, rice, oil, flour, etc.).

loan.name: Los Luceros Group

texts.es: El grupo los luceros lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Martha quien vende ropa, zapatos, cosm√©ticos etc. Desde hace 6 a√±os. Ella tiene tres hijos ya mayores delos cuales su hija y una nieta le ayudan a vender. El cr√©dito lo invertir√° en zapatos y ropa. Ella con los cr√©ditos aumentado su negocio y con las ganancias ha logrado comprar dos motos y actualmente su meta es comprar un carro para traer mayor cantidad de mercader√≠a. Las otras integrantes son Rosadalia de 62 a√±os tiene una venta negocio que conoce desde hace 50 a√±os y Ana Mar√≠a de 64 a√±os venta de productos bogue desde hace 5 a√±os.
texts.en:
The ‚ÄúLos Luceros‚Äù group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Martha, who has been selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, etc. for 6 years. She has three grown children. Her daughter and a granddaughter help her to sell. She will use the loan to buy shoes and clothing.
With the loans she has grown her business and with the earnings she has been able to buy two motorcycles. Her current goal is to buy a car so she can bring a larger amount of merchandise.
The other members are Rosa Idalia, 62 years old, who has a sales business that she has been working in for 50 years, and Ana Mar√≠a, 64 years old, who has been selling Vogue products for 5 years.

loan.use: to buy shoes and clothing

loan.name: Simoa

texts.en:
Simoa is 37 years of age and married with 5 children.
For the past 2 years, Simoa has owned and operated a business, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Simoa plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.
In 2011, Simoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Simoa's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loan.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, 40 years old, lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area. She farms and breeds animals on her own plot of land. Anna grows potatoes for sale and breeds cows, sheep and chickens. She sells her milk to a company and her meat to butcher shops.
Anna does the agricultural work alone since her husband is now in Russia, her son is a student and her daughter is married and lives separately. Anna also works as a nurse at an outpatient clinic.
Anna has received 3 loans from Nor Horizon and now seeks a loan of $2,000 to buy a large lot of fodder for her farm animals and potato seedlings for sowing.

loan.use: to buy a large lot of fodder for her animals and potato seedlings for sowing

loan.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 24 years of age and married with 4 children.
For the past 2 years, Amelia has owned and operated a business, selling baked goods in the local community. She needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Amelia plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.
In 2011, Amelia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Amelia's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loan.name: Suleiman

texts.en: Suleiman is 76 years old. He is married to Esther and together they have five children. Suleiman has been in the farming business for the past 10 years. This is his fourth loan with KADET LTD. Suleiman repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use this loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seedlings. Suleiman hopes to be a leading farmer in his area.

loan.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seedlings

loan.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen, 44 years old, is from Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married and has three children. Carmen owns and operates a flower business. She has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase flower pots, seedlings and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loan.use: to purchase flower pots, seedlings and fertilizer

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loan.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 34 years of age and married with 4 children.
For the past 2 years, Julie has owned and operated a business selling soft drinks in the local community. She needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase sugar, plastic foam cups and cordial. Julie plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.
In 2011, Julie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Julie's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase sugar, plastic foam cups and cordial

loan.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es: El comit√© San Lorenzo est√° integrado por 14 mujeres de la ciudad de Carapegu√°, quienes pretenden mejorar su calidad de trabajo ya que est√°n motivadas en sus actividades con el deseo y logro de mejorar sus ingresos y estilo de vida. Una de las ocupaciones que hace diariamente la Sra.Brigida de 43a√±os de edad es la venta de remedios yuyos (Hierbas medicinales) las cuales vende todos los d√≠as desde muy tempranas horas del dia. Sin duda es una se√±ora con aspiraciones y deseo de salir adelante por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de remedios naturales, con los cuales podr√° abastecerse y tener mayor variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Brigida dice estar agradecida por formar parte del programa de la fundaci√≥n, pues le ha sido de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The San Lorenzo committee is made up of 14 women from the city of Carapegu√° who wish to improve their quality of work. They are motivated in their businesses and have the desire and achievement to improve their incomes and lifestyle.
One of the occupations that Brigida, 43 years old, does every day is to sell medicinal herbs, which she sells every day from very early in the morning. Without a doubt, she is a woman with aspirations and the desire to get ahead through hard work and effort.
She is requesting a loan to buy natural remedies so that she can stock up and have a greater variety to offer to her customers. Brigida says she is grateful to be part of the Foundation‚Äôs program because it has been of much help to her.

loan.use: to buy natural herbs for sale

loan.name: Anzor

texts.en:
Anzor is 25 years old. He lives in Dmanisi District, West Georgia with his family: his wife, Tsisnami, his 1-year-old son and his parents. The family's agricultural business is their only source of income. They have 20 milk cows and sell milk to local dairy product producers. The family owns 10 hectares of land, where they grow hay. Part of the harvested hay is used to feed domestic cows and the surplus is sold on the local market. All adult family members are involved in the family business and work hard during the day. The family's total average monthly income is 1,500 GEL.
Anzor requested a loan to purchase construction materials to build a grocery store near his house. There is a lack of grocery stores in the area and Anzor‚Äôs store will have many clients. He will purchase grocery products in the nearby town at wholesale prices and sell them in his store. The family's income will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loan.use: to purchase construction materials to build a grocery store

loan.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub, 50 years old, is married to Paustine and the father of four children. They are from Western Kenya.
Ayub has been selling newspapers for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,400. He is taking his fourth loan from KADET LTD to expand his newspaper sales stock. Ayub will then use his profits to educate his children. His dream is to grow the business through KADET funding.

loan.use: To expand his newspaper sales stock

loan.name: Cinder Del Socorro

texts.es: Cinder de 33 a√±os, es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 12 a 15 a√±os. Ella tiene un negocio donde vende mercanc√≠a variada que distribuye entre sus clientes, mediante el sistema de cr√©dito; ellos est√°n ubicados alrededor de su vivienda en barrios cercanos y en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde tiene familiares que le remiten nuevos clientes. Su experiencia data desde hace 6 a√±os cuando inici√≥ su vida como comerciante con pocos productos, pero poco a poco logr√≥ nuevos proveedores y as√≠ mismo opciones de vender mediante gu√≠as especializadas de productos de empresas multinacionales, en las que se ha vinculado. √öltimamente una microempresaria, vinculada a la Fundaci√≥n Mario Santo Domingo, le est√° vendiendo cubre lechos que elabora, para que Cinder los venda y gane dinero tambi√©n; ahora tiene muchos pedidos pero debe contar un capital de trabajo disponible, para lograr responder a su clientela tal como estos lo requieren. Por eso est√° aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaci√≥n Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprar√° mercanc√≠a variada como perfume, ropa interior, fantas√≠a, y cubrelechos. Su meta mas adelante es terminar de adecuar su vivienda, la cual reci√©n la adquiri√≥ y continuar creciendo en su negocio, para alcanzar sus sue√±os de potencializar un futro exitoso a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cinder, 33, is a married woman with three children, who are 12 to 15 years old. She has a business selling a variety of merchandise to customers on credit. Her clients are located close to home in nearby neighborhoods and in the city of Barranquilla, where she has relatives who refer new customers to her.
Cinder began her life as a merchant six years ago with a small inventory, but gradually acquired new products and thereby options of selling through the specialized catalogs of multinational businesses to which she has established ties. Lately, an entrepreneur associated with the Fundaci√≥n Mario Santo Domingo has been selling her the bedcovers she makes so that Cinder can re-sell them and earn money as well. Now she has many orders for her products but must have available working capital in order to fill her customer‚Äôs orders in a timely fashion. Consequently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundaci√≥n Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy a variety of merchandise, such as perfume, underwear, costume jewelry and bed covers.
Cinder‚Äôs later goal is to finish upgrading her dwelling, which she recently acquired, and to continue expanding her business in order to fulfill her dreams of helping her children attain a successful future.

loan.use: to buy a variety of merchandise such as perfume, underwear, costume jewlry and bedcovers.

loan.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es: 15 se√±oras trabajadoras de la ciudad de Caaguaz√∫ se unieron para formar un grupo; un comit√© solidario, en donde el compromiso es conjunto y tienen un esp√≠ritu emprendedor. Actualmente est√°n en el 9no. Ciclo y est√°n muy entusiasmadas de seguir progresando. Marta es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y nos comenta que por medio de su trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y darles lo que ellos necesitan para tener un mejor estilo de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien, debido a que tiene muy buena variedad que ofrece a sus clientes. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para poder comprar prendas, las cuales desea para poder surtir con m√°s variedad su negocio. Ella se define como una persona que se esfuerza siempre por lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Fifteen hardworking women from the city of Caaguaz√∫ came together to form a group. This is a supportive community bank where the commitment is shared and they have an entrepreneurial spirit. Currently they're in their ninth cycle and they're very excited to continue making progress.
Marta is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She tells us that due to her work, she has been able to support her family and give them what they need to have a better way of life.
Marta sells all types of garments, which is going very well for her thanks to the wide variety she offers her customers. She is asking for a loan in order to buy clothing, which she wants in order to stock her business with more variety. She describes herself as a person who always works hard to reach her goals.

loan.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loan.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 35 years old and married with two children. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for 11 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. To earn extra income, she runs a cafeteria. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a blow dryer, a hair dryer and hair chemicals.

loan.use: To buy a blow dryer, a hair dryer and hair chemicals.

loan.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es: Santa librada es el grupo formado por 21 mujeres, todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas son reconocidas en el barrio por la uni√≥n con la que trabajan, y es por ello justamente que han podido salir adelante y crecer. Actualmente est√°n en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundaci√≥n, y est√°n muy contentas por ello. Viviana es modista, y comenta que trabaja todos los d√≠as en su taller montado en su casa, y cuenta que la mayor√≠a de sus vecinos siempre le dan mucho trabajo, lo que la ayuda a poder mantener su casa. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que desea seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y dem√°s, con lo cual podr√° abastecerse y tener m√°s insumos para hacer sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Santa Librada [Saint Wilgefortis] is a group composed of 21 women, all of whom are friends and neighbors from this city. They are known in the neighborhood through the community bank they work with, and it's precisely because of this that they have been able to get ahead and grow. Currently they're in their third cycle of the women's entrepreneur program at Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya, and they're very happy with it.
Viviana is a dressmaker. She says that she works every day in her shop, which is set up in her home. She tells us that the majority of her neighbors always give her a lot of work, which helps her to be able to maintain her home. She is a very hardworking and determined person who wants to keep working to help her family.
Viviana is asking for a loan to buy fabric, thread, and elastic, among other things, with which she will be able to stock up and have more materials to do her work.

loan.use: to buy materials for a sewing shop.

loan.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 34 years old and married to Ann. They live in Nakuru and they have been blessed with two children. He operates a bread supply business in Nakuru. He plans to use this loan to buy more bread to sell to meet the high demand for bread from his clients.
In the future, Daniel hopes to expand his business and distribute bread to all parts of Nakuru .

loan.use: To buy more bread to sell.

loan.name: Lolita

texts.en: Now, Lolita is borrowing PHP 20,000 to fund her dried fish business. This business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA. It continues to provide Lolita and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loan.use: to purchase more stock of dried fish to sell.

loan.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 30 years old, married and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
Thelma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and equipment.
Thelma has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Thelma would like to save enough to expand her business and send her children to school.

loan.use: to buy fishing nets and equipment.

loan.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 42 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.
Marissa runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her store.
Marissa has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries.
In the future, Marissa would like to save enough to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy groceries to sell in her store.

loan.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana es socia del Banco Comunal ‚Äúlas Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II‚Äù ubicado en el distrito de Arapa, provincia Az√°ngaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 53 a√±os de edad, de estado civil casada, con dos hijos (1 independientes), la se√±ora estudio educaci√≥n secundaria.
La se√±ora se dedica a la venta de comidas como truchadas, hace dos ciclos trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramas, su primer pr√©stamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, la que invirti√≥ en su negocio.
En la actualidad solicitara un nuevo pr√©stamo por la suma de S/ 1,700.00 nuevo soles dinero que comprar√° insumos para la preparaci√≥n de alimentos y mercader√≠as para su tienda de abarrotes, trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja en el magisterio.
Su sue√±o para el futuro es tener su tienda de abarrotes bien surtido y tener un carro para transportar su mercader√≠a.
Lo que m√°s le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad
texts.en:
Valeriana is a member of Las Mujeres de Santa Rosa de Arapa II communal bank, located in the district of Arapa, province of Az√°ngaro and department of Puno. She is 53 years old and married, with two children (one independent). She studied at the secondary level.
She works selling food such as "truchadas" [a social activity where people come together to raise funds and have a meal; in this case, mainly trout]. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two loan cycles. Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles (PEN), which she invested in her business.
Currently she will request a new loan for the sum of 1,700 PEN, money with which she will buy supplies to make food and merchandise for her grocery store. She works alone in the business. Her husband is a teacher.
Her dream for the future is to have her grocery store well stocked and have a car to transport her merchandise.
What she likes most about her communal bank is the punctuality and the responsibility.

loan.use: to buy supplies to make food and merchandise for her grocery store.

loan.name: Nicat

texts.ru: Nicatu 29 let, on jenat u nego dvoe malenkix detey 2 i 4 let. Sfera ego deyatelnosti yavlayetsa torgovley. On prodayet posudu I raznie tovari. Nicat nachal svoy biznes 5 let nazad. Ego semya jivet v dome iz sirogo kirpicha I on planiruet perestroit noviy dom iz kamna dla togo chtobi ego semya jila v bolee zdorovix usloviyax, poetomu ego cel eto rasshirit sferu torgovli i v budushem postroit svoy sobstvenniy magazin. Nicatu nujni dengi v summe 1000 AZN dla togo chtobi kupit noviy tovar dla prodaji. Nicat ochen trudolubiviy, iskrenniy I zabotliviy semyanin.
texts.en: Nicat is 29 years old, he is married and has two small children who are two and four years old. He is in the retail business. He sells dishware and other products. Nicat started his business five years ago. His family lives in a house made of crude brick and he plans to rebuild the home from stone so that his family could live in more healthy conditions. This is why his goal is to expand his retail business and to build his own store in the future. Nicat needs a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN to buy new products for sale. Nicat is very hardworking, sincere and caring family man.

loan.use: to buy new products for sale in order to expand the business and rebuild the house.

loan.name: Ramil

texts.ru: Sfera deyatelnosti Ramila yavlayetsa selskoxozaystvom. Emu 35 let, on jenat I u nego 2 detey. On derjit korov I baran. Vesti delo emu pomogayut ego mat‚Äô I jena. On prodaet moloko, sherst I masyo mestnim jitelam sela gde on jivet. Ramil obratilsa za dengami v 1000 AZN dla togo chtobi kupit baraninu dla otkorma i prodaji. On xochet uvelichit svoi doxodi dla togo chtobi nachat delat remont doma.
texts.en: Ramil's business is agriculture. He is 35 years old, he is married and has two children. He keeps cows and sheep. His wife and mother help him run the business. He sells milk, wool and meat to the local residents in the village where he lives. Ramil has asked for a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN to buy sheep for fattening and resale. He wants to increase his income so that he can start to repair his home.

loan.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale.

loan.name: 15 De Mayo Group

texts.es: El comit√© 15 de Mayo est√° integrado por 11 mujeres, quienes encuentran en el 1 ciclo, trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Adem√°s del trabajo independiente de cada una, tambi√©n desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar a sus familias. Una historia es la de la Sra. Luisa quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, nos comenta que tiene una clientela bien definida, que siempre compra de ella las prendas que vende. Nos comenta que mediante este negocio la econom√≠a de la familia mejor√≥. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser camisas, pantalones, y dem√°s tipos, con lo cual podr√° trabajar y tener m√°s variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 15 de Mayo communal bank is made up of 11 women who are in their first loan cycle, working together and supportively in the program. In addition to the independent work of each one, they also have group activities. At the same time, they help each other mutually to realize their objective, which is to work to support their families.
One story is that of Luisa, who works selling clothing. She tells us she has a well-defined clientele that always buys the clothes she sells. She tells us that with this business her family finances improved.
She is requesting the loan to buy all types of garments, such as shirts, pants, and other types, with which she will be able to work and have more variety to offer her customers.

loan.use: to buy garments to sell.

loan.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida is married. She has four children aged between 7 and 16. She has been a rice farmer since 2004. She would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using to get more output.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor.

loan.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es: El comit√© 8 de diciembre se encuentra, en su 4¬∫.ciclo. Podemos decir que el grupo es muy responsable, donde todas las integrantes tienen actividades, y tambi√©n realizan actividades en conjunto, con lo cual desean fomentar su trabajo en grupo. La Sra. Lucia, es una de las miembros, ella se dedica al reciclado y tambi√©n a la venta de asaditos los fines de semana. Tiene 2 hijos y nos comenta que ellos son su raz√≥n de lucha constante. Ella recorre las calles buscando los art√≠culos reciclables para despu√©s venderlos. Est√° muy orgullosa de su trabajo, pues es digno y honesto. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de materiales reciclados en cantidad para despu√©s revenderlos, ya que con eso tendr√° m√°s ganancia. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y su grupo est√°n recibiendo.
texts.en:
The 8 de Diciembre communal bank is in its fourth loan cycle. We can say that the group is very responsible. All the members have jobs and they also have group activities to promote working in groups.
Lucia is one of the members. She works in recycling and also selling grilled meat on the weekend. She has two children and she tells us that they are the reason for her constant struggle. She scours the streets looking for recyclable materials to later sell. She is very proud of her job because it is honorable and honest.
She is requesting the loan to buy recycled materials in bulk to later resell, because she will have more profits.
She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her group are receiving.

loan.use: to buy recycled materials to sell.

loan.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is 46 years old. He lives in a village of Dmanisi District with his family, wife Chavair and their 18 years old daughter. Mubariz works as a bus driver, connecting Dmanisi to a nearby country‚Äôs capital city. He gets a monthly salary for his job. Along with his main job, Mubariz in involved in the family agricultural business, which is led by Chavair. They have 2 milk cows, 2 calves, and 6 sheep in the family farm. Chavair produces cheese and sells it on the local market. She also sells lambs. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.
Mubariz requested credit for purchasing an additional milk cow. With three cows, Chavair will be able to produce and sell 50% more cheese. The income of the family will increase by 150 Laris. They will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve the family's living conditions.

loan.use: to purchase a milk cow

loan.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 49, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a driver, and a mother to their five children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
Susan operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Susan's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Susan dreams to be able to give all her children a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to grow her store. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 42 years old and married with four children.
She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs.
Roselyn has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loan.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs.

loan.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 26-year-old man from Vihiga town. He is married to Irene and they have a five-year-old child.
Peter operates a retail shop, a business he has been doing for the last two years. The shop earns him a monthly income of KES. 8,000. He is now taking a second loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy retail stock of sugar, maize flour, and bread. His profits will be used to repay the loan.
His dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loan.use: To buy retail stock of sugar, maize flour, and bread.

loan.name: Prudencia

texts.es: La Sra. Prudencia tiene 49 a√±os y es soltera, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la fabricaci√≥n y venta de canastillas hecha a mano con una planta llamada tokoro, esta producci√≥n de canastillas son para floreros tu casa se encuentran en la zona Venancio este pr√©stamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la instituci√≥n y la Sra., Prudencia va a usar este pr√©stamo para la compra de materia prima (tokoro) para la fabricaci√≥n de canastillas, la raz√≥n para solicitar este pr√©stamo es ampliaci√≥n del negocio. Prudencia enfrenta retos en su negocio el trabajo manual tedioso que le toma hacer las canastillas, La Sra. prudencia se siente muy feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgaci√≥n de cr√©dito ya que esta es su √∫nica actividad para mantenerse.
texts.en:
Prudencia is 49 years old and single, with no children. She works making and selling little baskets made by hand with a plant called "tokoro." These baskets are for vases in your house. They are in the Venancio area.
This loan is her first cycle with the institution and Prudencia is going to use it to buy raw materials (tokoro) to make baskets. The reason for requesting the loan is to expand her business.
Prudencia faces challenges in her business. The manual work is tedious and takes her time to make the baskets. Prudencia is very happy about and grateful for the opportunity they are giving her in the offer of a loan because this is her only activity to support herself.

loan.use: to buy raw materials (tokoro plant).

loan.name: Jessica Jessenia

texts.es: Jessica de 30 a√±os vive ( suburbio Guayaquil ) . ella empeso su negocio po el motivo de que el sueldo de su esposo no le alcansava para sustentar a su familia. Empeso vendiendo almuerzo en su casa y con esfuerzo saco adelante el negocio. Trabaja todo los d√≠as con muchas ganas. A futuro ella desea darle un mejoramiento a su casa y a sus hijos. Con el pr√©stamo comprara ( materiales de vivienda) y asi comprar Cemento, arena, bloques para construir mejor su vivienda y mejorar el restaurante.
texts.en: Jessica, 30, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. She started her business because her husband's salary was not enough to sustain their family. She started selling lunch from her house and through her efforts, she has developed her business. She works every day and looks forward to it. In the future she hopes to make improvements to her house, for her children's sake. She will use this loan to buy housing materials -- cement, sand, and concrete blocks -- to better construct her home and to improve her restaurant.

loan.use: to buy cement, sand, and concrete blocks

loan.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is single. He has been a rice farmer for 7 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to pay for support labor, in order to get the best harvest he can. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output. He also wants to create a savings plan.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to pay for support labor.

loan.name: Domitille

texts.en:
Domitille is married with one 3-year-old child. She has been a rice farmer for the past seven years. She would like to get this Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to pay for support labor, in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, Domitille plans to expand the area she has been using to get more crop output. She also wants to make a savings plan.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to pay for support labor costs.

loan.name: Darlen Emilson

texts.es: Emilson tiene 22 a√±os de edad, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa y en algunas ocasiones le ayuda a su esposo a cumplir con algunos trabajos en la finca. Emilson se dedica al cultivo de caf√© y aprendi√≥ del oficio gracias a su padre. El negocio del cultivo de caf√© en ciertas temporadas resulta ser muy rentable para Emilson ya que cuenta con buenos clientes y le dan un buen precio por el caf√©. El solicita este pr√©stamo para la compra de fertilizantes, ya que lo necesita para el mejoramiento de la finca para poder obtener una buena cosecha. El pr√©stamo le ayudar√≠a en gran manera ya que anteriormente ten√≠a que comprometer la cosecha con intermediarios los cuales se aprovechan a pagar el caf√© a un bajo precio. Algunos de los problemas que enfrenta Emilson es la escasa mano de obra para cosechar el caf√© y las dificultades que tiene para trasladar el producto ya que la cosecha es para temporada de invierno las calles se ponen en muy mal estado. El mayor deseo de Emilson es mejorar la instalaci√≥n f√≠sica de su finca para aumentar sus ganancias y as√≠ mejorar la econom√≠a de su hogar. Este es su primer pr√©stamo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el compromiso de sus pagos.
texts.en: Emilson is 22, married, his wife is a homemaker and sometimes helps him with work at the ranch. Emilson works growing coffee, he learned this business from his father. The business of coffee growing in certain seasons is very profitable for Emilson because he has good clients that offer good prices for the coffee. He requests a loan to buy fertilizer because he needs it to improve the plantation so he can have a good harvest. The loan would help him in a big way because previously he had to commit the harvest through intermediaries who take advantage of paying the coffee at a lower price. Some of the problems that Emilson faces are the shortage of labour to harvest coffee and the difficulties that he has to transport the product because harvest season happens in winter and the streets are in bad shape. Emilson's biggest dream is to improve hi ranch infrastructure so he can increase his earnings and improve the economy of his home. This is his first loan with FAMA and he hopes to be punctual with the repayments.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer for coffee plantation.

loan.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 52-year-old married man with 3 children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
For 10 years, Mohamed has operated a fish selling business, selling his goods at the market. His primary customers are neighbours. Mohamed has another source of income which is a grocery business. He describes his greatest business challenge to be a lack of storage. His highest monthly expense is food. Mohamed will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a freezer to store fish.
Mohamed aspires to establish a fish selling stall in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds to boost his business.

loan.use: To purchase a freezer to store fish for sale.

loan.name: Eseri

texts.en:
Eseri lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with 4 children, 3 of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sisters and a brother). Eseri has a retail food stall selling bunches of bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes at the market. She has been in this business for the last 7 years, working seven days a week. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. Eseri has requested a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, bags of cassava, and sweet potatoes.
Eseri's major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to help with transportation and to buy a plot of land to build rental rooms. She lives in her own house. The family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and medication.

loan.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, bags of cassava, and sweet potatoes to sell.

loan.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married; she is a mother of six children aged between 5 and 14. She has been a rice farmer for seven years. She would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to support labor costs in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using in order to get more output and to rear cattle in the future.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds and to support labor costs.

loan.name: Halfan

texts.en:
Halfan is a 44-year-old married man with 3 children, all of whom are enrolled in school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
For the past 6 years, Halfan has operated a grocery and a fish selling business, selling his goods from home. He also sells fried fish. His primary customers are neighbours. He describes his greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation, and his highest monthly expense is food.
Halfan will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase sacks of onions, tomatoes, and fruit to sell. Halfan aspires to establish a selling stall in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds.

loan.use: to purchase sacks of onions, tomatoes, and fruit for sale.

loan.name: Jenita

texts.en:
This is Jenita, 33. She is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, a foam maker, and is a mother to her two children; both children are in elementary school. While attending to her family needs, she also keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband in sustaining their daily expenses.
Jenita owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar and primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also helps her husband in selling foams as an additional daily income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more grocery items and stock. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her earnings will be a big help for the education of her children.
Jenita dreams that her children will be able to finish their studies and have a good life. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and help them maintain daily expenses. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it makes her a better person and strengthens her faith in Christ.
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 3 years to 9 years. She describes herself to be social and friendly.
She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, cabbages, onions and kale. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located at a busy market, and her primary customers are both men and women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the grocery store.
She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more potatoes and cabbages. Her business goal is to be selling tomatoes and potatoes on a wholesale basis within five years. Gladys hopes that in the future, she will educate her children up to university level.

loan.use: to buy more potatoes and cabbages.

loan.name: Margelis

texts.es: Margelis de 27 a√±os, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su c√≥nyuge y su hijo de 6 a√±os de edad. En su barrio todos conocen que ella tiene un negocio de venta de mercanc√≠as variadas, otro de preparaci√≥n y venta de productos derivados de la harina de trigo, o congelados, como deditos, empanaditas y otro de venta de leche. Su clientela no se preocupa de los detalles que regalar√°, en fechas especiales a amigos y familiares, porque sabe que Margelis siempre consigue lo que ellos necesitan, a un buen precio y que f√°cilmente pueden pagarlo en cuotas. Ella es una mujer muy servicial y por eso es muy conocida. Por eso cuando inici√≥ su negocio lo hizo con mercanc√≠a que le suministraba una amiga, en la medida en que fue conociendo nuevos proveedores, empez√≥ a tener independencia en la compra y aumento su oferta, volvi√©ndola mas diversificada, logrando as√≠ ampliar el n√∫mero de compradores que poco a poco fue fidelizando y hoy forman parte de su base de clientes, que le refieren nuevos. Su prop√≥sito de tener un almac√©n de variedades en su propia casa, la lleva a buscar estrategias para aumentar su capital de trabajo y este es su mayor desaf√≠o, por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaci√≥n Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprar√° lociones, mercanc√≠as, cosm√©ticos y tambi√©n alimentos congelados, pues tiene un gran mercado al que responderle con este tipo de productos y esto hace que su inversi√≥n tenga potencial de √©xito, tambi√©n apunt√°ndole a que su rentabilidad sobre las ventas, es no menor a un 43%, indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su crecimiento futuro.
texts.en:
Margelis, 27, lives in Cartagena with her spouse and her son, who is 6 years old. In her neighborhood, everyone knows that she has a business selling varied merchandise and another where she prepares and sells bread products, frozen snacks, cookies, empanadas and milk. Her customers don't worry about what they will give as presents for special occasions to friends and family, because they know that Margelis is always able to get what they need, at a good price and they can pay in installments, which is easier for them.
She is well known for being a helpful woman. Because of this, she was able to start her business with merchandise supplied by a friend. As she got to know new suppliers, she started to become more independent in her purchases and increased her merchandise, making it more diversified. She was able to increase the number of customers and earn their loyalty, little by little. Today, they form her client base and refer new customers to her. Her goal of having a corner market in her own home, makes her look for strategies to increase her capital. This is her greatest challenge and why she has requested a Kiva credit, which is her first loan through Fundaci√≥n Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, she will buy lotions, cosmetics, frozen snacks and other merchandise. She has a great market to sell these products to and makes the success of her investment more likely. Also noting that her profitability over sales is no less than 43%, a financial indicator that she uses to predict future growth.

loan.use: buy lotions, cosmetics, frozen snacks and other merchandise.

loan.name: Esperanza Josefina Diaz

texts.es: Esperanza de 57 a√±os vive ( machala ecuador) ella empeso este negocio hace 2 a√±os de vender ropa por catalogo y Yambal porque una amiga la motivo a hacerlo y a incribirse. Trabaja con mucho esfuerzo todos los d√≠as apartir del medio dia. A futuro ella desea ser directora de Yambal y que su neocio de ropa pueda crecer. Con en pr√©stamo comprara (Yambal y ropa por catalogo) persumes, cremas.
texts.en: Esperanza, 57 years old, lives in Machala, Ecuador. She started this business two years ago, selling catalog clothing, Yanbal, because her friend convinced her to sign up. She works very hard every day, starting at noon. In the future, should would like to be a director at Yanbal and would like her clothing business to grow. With the loan, she will purchase Yanbal and other catalog clothing, perfumes and lotions.

loan.use: purchase mail order clothing, perfumes and creams

loan.name: La Suerte Group

texts.es: El grupo la Suerte lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Lissette de 27 a√±os quien se dedica a la venta de cosm√©ticos y trabaja en belleza de manera a domicilio hace 8 a√±os y su meta es poner un sal√≥n en su casa. Ella es casada y tiene una ni√±a de 12 a√±os. Las otras integrantes son Mar√≠a quien vende frescos en especial pinolillo, tiste, pinol y tiene una tapicer√≠a y Sadia tiene una tortiller√≠a.
texts.en: The group, la Suerte (Luck), is formed by three hard working and enterprising people. One of them, Lissette, 27 years old, sells cosmetics and has provided mobile beauty services for eight years. Her goals is to have a salon in her home. She is married and has a 12 year old daughter. The other group members are Maria, who sells drinks, especially pinolillo, tiste and pinol and she also has an upholstery business. Sadia has her own tortilla business.

loan.use: buy cosmetics, dyes, etc.

loan.name: Vergilita Group

texts.en:
Vergilita is 64 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. She is married with 6 children.
Vergilita has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 30 years. Vergilita requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
Vergilita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. Vergilita is the leader of a 3 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loan.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loan.name: La Lucha Sigue Group

texts.es: El grupo la lucha sigue lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Fatima de 33 a√±os quien vende producto Avon desde hace 4 a√±os. Ella es casada y tiene dos ni√±os de 9 y 5 a√±os de edad respectivamente y su meta es a gran dar el local Las otras integrantes son Raquel quien vende perfumes, cosm√©ticos y ropa desde hace 6 a√±os y Rosalba quien vende tortilla, queso y pl√°tano.
texts.en: The group, La lucha sigue (The Struggle Continues), is formed by three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them, Fatima, 33 years old, has been selling Avon products for four years. She is married and has two children, 9 and 5 years old. Her goal is to make her business bigger. The other group members are Raquel, who has been selling perfumes, cosmetics and clothing for six years and Rosalba, who sells tortillas, cheese and bananas.

loan.use: purchase cosmetics

loan.name: Lorenza Paula Jalca Figueroa

texts.es: Lorenza de 53 a√±os vive (suburbio Guayaquil) . ella a ra√≠z de que su esposo muri√≥ decidio seguir el negocio de los celulares y dejar a cargo de su tienda a su hija pero ella no la supo abministrar asi que decidio tomar las riendas de su tienda . trabaja todos los d√≠as con ganas. A futuro ella desea aumentar su negocio. Con el pr√©stamo comprara ( alimentos) como Enlatados, bebidas, granos.
texts.en: Lorenza, 53 years old, lives in Guayaquil, Ecuador. Since her husband died, she had decided to continue his cell phone business and had left her daughter in charge of her general store. Her daughter didn't know how to run the store so she took the reins of her store back. She works very hard every day. She wishes to increase her business in the future. With the loan, she will buy food such as canned goods, drinks and grains.

loan.use: purchase canned goods, drinks and grains.

loan.name: Luneta's Group

texts.en:
Luneta is married with one child. She is 42 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
Luneta is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more fertilizers for her farm.
Luneta has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Luneta hopes to acquire another parcel of land. Luneta is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loan.use: to purchase more fertilizers for her farm

loan.name: Kiyal

texts.en: Kiyal is 36 years old, she is raising two children. While looking for a source of income for her family Kiyal started her business in 2004 selling vegetables with a starting capital of 2,000 som (KGS). Through persistence and hard work Kiyal was able to grow her business with a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. Today the assortment of goods is not in excess and this is the reason why Kiyal has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 35,000 KGS. She plans to partially invest the income from the loan into purchasing building materials to repair her home and partially into growing of her business.

loan.use: to broaden the assortment of goods.

loan.name: Lucia Wilma

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia tiene 27 a√±os y es casada con 1 hijo de la edad de cuatro a√±os, se dedica a la venta de leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, ella vive en la zona de Coqueni, es cliente antigua de la instituci√≥n, Lucia utilizara este pr√©stamo para la compra de forraje para su ganado, Su raz√≥n para solicitar este pr√©stamo es no tiene dinero y necesita alimentar bien a su ganado para que le proporcione buena cantidad de leche y as√≠ de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos econ√≥micos, Lucia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado, sue√±a comprar otras vacas lecheras.
texts.en: Lucia is 27 years old and is married with a four-year-old son. She sells milk, since she has cattle. She lives in the Coqueni area and is a long-standing client of the institution. Lucia will use this loan to buy feed for her livestock. Her reason for requesting this loan is that she doesn't have money and she needs to feed her livestock well so that they will provide her with a good amount of milk and that way she will improve her income. Lucia confronts challenges in her business, such as the feed that she needs to buy every so often, and she will use the profits to improve her livestock. She dreams of buying more dairy cows.

loan.use: to buy feed

loan.name: Mujeres En Prosperidad Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank Mujeres en Prosperidad (Women in Prosperity) was formed three years ago in Tecp√°n Chimaltenango, a village in the central highlands of Guatemala near where the first capital of the country was founded. Currently, the Trust Bank has nine hard-working women who strive to move forward with their lives every day. The women engage in a variety of businesses, including selling: cosmetics, jewelry and gifts, typical and non-typical clothing, food, and curtains.
Maria Coralia is a member and founder of the Mujeres en Prosperidad Trust Bank. She is 56 years old, married and has nine children, five of which still depend on her. Coralia, as she is known locally, is named in honor of a person who provided work to her father for several years. In the photo, Coralia is the third woman (from left to right), she is wearing a black blouse with purple flowers.
Coralia has operated a food vendor business for the past 13 years. She sells small portions of typical Guatemalan food and operates her business from Monday to Saturday. She wakes up at 4:00 a.m. to prepare everything, and then she goes to the market from 8:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. to sell her products. Her business has slowly grown over the years, and she has been able to help pay for her children's education. While most of her children only completed the sixth grade before they stopped going to school, Coralia is optimistic that at least her younger children will reach high school.
Coralia is excited to receive a new loan, which she will use to start a new business. She is a very innovative woman and recently traveled to another city (three hours from home) for training in baking and decorations. She now wants to use her newfound knowledge to start a bakery. The loan that she receives will be used for two purposes: to invest in the existing business (food), and to buy some materials, such as a mixer, for baking.
"Access to loans for women is a great opportunity for growth; it makes us more independent and allows us to make our own decisions," said Coralia. "My dream for my current business as for my new business is that in the future the two of them can be sustainable, so I further support my children's education."
The Mujeres en Prosperidad Trust Bank is very surprised that people from other countries have the desire to invest in them and are thankful that Kiva lenders reach out and trust them to use the loans wisely.

loan.use: To invest in the existing business (food), and to buy some materials, a mixer, for baking.

loan.name: Marie

texts.fr: Cliente de 37 anas, mari√©e et m√®re de 4 enfants dont tous sont scolarises, a l'obtention de son bac n'ayant pas de moyen pour continuer des etudes universitaires, elle se lance dans la vente de la friperie et des ustensiles en plastique. Ayant beneficiee deja de 3 cycles de pr√™ts,ses ventes ont √©norm√©ment √©volue, elle a rembours√©e avec succ√®s et a fait des √©pargnes consid√©rables et avec ses benefices elle vient d'ouvrir une boutique de chaussures en plein marche. Avec ce nouveau pr√™t, elle va renforcer le stock des ballots de friperie comme les baskets , des sandales pour homme et enfants, acheter de la peinture pour repeindre et am√©liorer ses conditions de vente. Elle tient a aller jusqu'au bout en ce qui concerne son commerce et elle a pour ambition de devenir une grande femme d'affaire.
texts.en: This borrower is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four children who all attend school. After getting her high school degree, she lacked the financial means to go to college, and became involved in the sale of used shoes and plastic utensils. She has already benefited from three loan cycles, which has had a very positive impact on her sales. She has successfully repaid her loans and has saved a lot of money. With her profits, she has just opened a shoe store at the very center of the market. With this new loan, she will increase her stock of second-hand shoes and buy sneakers and sandals for men and children. She will also buy some paint to improve the appearance of her store and therefore her working environment. She is very motivated when it comes to her retail business and her ambition is to become an important business woman.

loan.use: to buy bags of shoes for women and sneakers for men and children.

loan.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia has been in the dressmaking business in Nakuru town for the last two years. She is 29 years old and single. She plans to use this loan amount to buy clothing material for use in her business.
In the future , Julia hopes expand her business and open more dressmaking shops in Nakuru.

loan.use: buy dressmaking materials
