loan.name: Gaudensia

texts.en:
Gaudensia is a 38-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be social and honest.
Gaudenia operates a food stall where she sells doughnuts. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.
Gaudenia will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy food ingredients. Her business goal is to expand her food stall within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standard.

loan.use: buy food ingredients

loan.name: Tessie

texts.en:
This is Tessie, 54, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, 57, a self-employed man. Tessie is a mother of two children, both are high school students. While attending to her family, she also keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband in sustaining their daily expenses.
Tessie owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, Tessie is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more grocery items to enable her to have more stocks. The more items are displayed at the store the better, as they help to attract more customers to buy in her variety store. More sales will result in better profit, which will help her to save more money for the expenses of her children in school.
Tessie hopes that her business will maintain an income that is sufficient for the needs of her family. She dreams that all her children will be able to finish their studies and be able to land a good and stable job someday. She wants to make available additional appliances that they need. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. It strengthens her spiritual life.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old. She is married to Mbogo. Together they have three children.
Jane sells fruits and has been in the business for the past two years. This is her first term loan in KADET LTD. She was brought to KADET LTD by a staff member. She will use this loan amount to purchase more stock of fruits for resale in her business. She hopes to own a supermarket in the near future.

loan.use: buy fruits

loan.name: Adrien

texts.en:
Adrien has one child who is two years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer since 2004. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output as well as make more savings from the profits.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: buy more fertilizer, seeds and pay labor costs

loan.name: Mariana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el cant√≥n Rocafuerte se re√∫nen cada quince d√≠as las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugare√±os que son reconocidos en todo el pa√≠s y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar conocimos a la se√±ora Mariana, tiene 63 a√±os de edad, est√° casada no ha podido tener hijos propios pero tiene dos que crio como que si fueran de ella, uno ya mayor de edad y una chica de 17 a√±os que este a√±o empieza a estudiar en la universidad, ambos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.
Ella es maestra jubilada y ahora se dedica a al comercio, tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual tambi√©n vende electrodom√©sticos y productos de bazar, trabaja todos los d√≠as desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00 y su hija le ayuda en su negocio, lleva con su negocio m√°s de 12 a√±os.
Este cr√©dito es para comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda y ciertos art√≠culos de bazar. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y es la tesorera del mismo, lleva 10 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los cr√©ditos le han ayudado mucho.
Sus sue√±os son seguir trabajando y que cresca m√°s su negocio.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.
Here we met Mariana, who is 63 years old. She is married. She was not able to have children herself but she has raised two as if they were her own. One is now an adult and the other is a 17 year old girl who starts university this year. Both still live with her. Her husband is a farmer.
She is a retired teacher and now makes a living in retail. She has a food store in her house where she also sells electrical appliances and general items. She works every day from 7:00 am until 20:00 pm and her daughter helps her in this business. She has had this business for over 12 years.
This loan is to buy staples goods to stock her store and certain other items. She is a founding member of the communal bank and is its treasurer. She has been part of this communal bank for ten loan cycles and she likes it because the loan have helped her a lot.
Her dreams are to continue working and for her business to grow.

loan.use: to buy staples goods and items for her store.

loan.name: Fidelia Santusa

texts.es: La Sra. Fidelia tiene 47 a√±os y es divorciada con un hijo que tiene 24 a√±os, la se√±ora tiene su puesto de abarrotes en el mercado de la zona, la Sra. Fidelia utilizara este pr√©stamo para comprar mercader√≠a abarrotes por mayor como fideo y arroz en cantidad y tenerlo almacenada por estas √©pocas ya que esta subiendo invertir√° tambi√©n en el mejoramiento de su puesto, Fidelia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, pero ella es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que vende muy bien y por esta raz√≥n desea acumular mas mercader√≠a para no dejar su puesto y tener que cerrar por comprar y utilizara los beneficios para comprar mas mercader√≠a, y as√≠ surtir su puesto de venta, Fidelia es una persona muy conocida y trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la instituci√≥n por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 47 years old. She is divorced and has a 24 year old son. She has a grocery stall in the local market. Fidelia will use this loan to buy wholesale products such as noodles and rice in large quantities and have it stored for when its cost increases. She will also invest in improving her stall.
Fidelia faces challenges in her business such as competition, but she is known by her customers as a good seller and for this reason she wants to accumulate more supplies so as to not leave her stall and have to close in order to go and buy. She will use the profits gained to buy more supplies and stock her stall. Fidelia is a well known person who is hard working and she appreciates the helped provided by the MFI.

loan.use: to buy wholesale groceries for her stall.

loan.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is 38 years old and married to Peris. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business in Nakuru town for three years now. Besides the motorcycle business, he also has a dairy shop.
Raymond plans to use this loan amount to expand his dairy shop business by buying more stock of milk for sale. In the future, Raymond hopes to open other businesses and become one of the leading businessmen in the region.

loan.use: buy milk

loan.name: Ignace

texts.en:
Ignace is single. He has been a rice farmer for 8 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output and make savings for a better future.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: To buy fertilisers, seeds and pay labor costs

loan.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 50 years old. She is married to her 54-year-old husband and together they have five children. She owns a chemist shop and has been in the business for the past eight years.
This is Alice's first loan in KADET LTD. She was brought to KADET LTD by a staff member. She will use this loan amount to purchase medicine to stock in her business. She hopes to open a clinic in the area soon.

loan.use: buy medicine

loan.name: El Camino Group

texts.es: El grupo el camino lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la se√±ora Martha Ruth de 47 a√±os de edad la cual se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 3 a√±os. Ella tiene 4 hijos ya todos mayores e independientes. El cr√©dito lo invertir√° en mercader√≠a en ropa camisas, pantalones, shores, camisolas‚Ä¶etc. Las otras integrantes son F√°tima de 32 a√±os vende nacatamales desde hace 4 a√±os y Maribel quien compra y venta de envases desde hace 16 a√±os.
texts.en:
'El Camino' group is formed by three hard working and enterprising women. One of them is Martha Ruth. She is 47 years old and she has made a living selling clothes for the past three years. She has four children, all of whom are adults and independent. She will invest this loan in buying stock such as shirts, trousers, shorts, camisoles... etc.
The other members of the group are F√°tima, who is 32 years old and for the past 4 years has sold "nacatamales" and Maribel, who for the past 16 years has made a living buying and selling packaging.

loan.use: to buy stock such as shirts, trousers, shorts, camisoles... etc.

loan.name: Nieve Moncerrate

texts.es:
En el cant√≥n Rocafuerte se re√∫nen cada quince d√≠as las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugare√±os que son reconocidos en todo en todo el pa√≠s y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar conocimos a la se√±ora Nieve, tiene 53 a√±os de edad, hace varios a√±os su esposo falleci√≥ y enviudo, pero de esta relaci√≥n tuvo tres hijos, todos sus hijos ya son mayores de edad.
Ella para salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sus forma de venta es puerta a puerta y tambi√©n vende en su casa donde tiene un peque√±o local hasta donde llegan sus clientes a ver cuando trae nueva mercader√≠a, la cual la comprar en Guayaquil. Trabaja todos los d√≠as en las ma√±anas, deja a cr√©dito a sus clientes y cobra cada quince d√≠as, tiene este negocio por 15 a√±os y gracias a √©l ha sacado adelante a su familia.
Este cr√©dito lo va emplear en comprar m√°s mercader√≠a como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de ni√±os. Est√° en el Banco Comunal desde hace m√°s de dos a√±os y le gusta porque el grupo que es muy unido.
Su sue√±o es tener un almac√©n donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.
Here we met Nieve, who is 53 years old. Her husband died several years ago and left her a widow but from this relationship she had three children, all of whom are now adults.
In order to get ahead in life she makes a living selling all types of clothes. She sells both from door to door and in her house where she has a small shop where her customers come when she has new stock, which she buys in Guayaquil. She works every day in the mornings, leaves the items with her customers on credit and collects her payment every fifteen days. She has had this business for the past 15 years and thanks to it she has helped her family get ahead.
This loan is to buy more stock such as: trousers, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothes. She has been member of the communal bank for more than two years she likes it because the group is very united.
Her dream is to have a storeroom where she can sell her products.

loan.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothes.

loan.name: Zamiri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha, tr√©sori√®re du groupe d‚Äôaffaire ¬´Zamiri ¬ª, est entrepreneur, √¢g√©e de 30 ans, mari√©e, m√®re de 6 jeunes enfants, qui √©tudient tous. Son mari fait de petits m√©tiers. Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Il y a 5 ans r√©volus qu‚Äôelle exerce ces petites activit√©s g√©n√©ratrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d‚Äôobtenir son 20eme cr√©dit de Hekima. Ce nouveau cr√©dit doit lui servir de s‚Äôapprovisionner avec 1 ballon de friperies. Ce dernier temps, cette cliente a constat√© ses ventes baiss√©es suite √† la crise √©conomique. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir, les faire scolariser et accroitre son entreprise. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Furaha is the treasurer of the ZAMIRI group. She is a 30-year-old entrepreneur, married, and the mother of six young children who all attend school. Her husband works odd jobs.
Furaha sells used clothes. She has been involved in this type of small income-generating activities for over 5 years.
She has just received her 20th loan from Hekima. This new loan will allow her to purchase one bag of bulk used clothing.
Lately, Furaha has noticed a slump in her sales because of the economic crisis. She would like to see her children grow and continue to attend school. She would also like to expand her business.
She thanks Hekima for its action in favor of poor women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loan.use: to buy one bag of bulk used clothing.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Johana Mar√≠a

texts.es:
En el cant√≥n Rocafuerte se re√∫nen cada quince d√≠as las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugare√±os que son reconocidos en todo en todo el pa√≠s y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar conocimos a la se√±ora Johana, tiene 30 a√±os de edad, est√° casada y de esta relaci√≥n tienen un hijo de 12 a√±os de edad que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Ella hace varios a√±os aprendi√≥ belleza en una academia de la localidad. Tiene un sal√≥n de belleza en el cual realiza diversos tipos de trabajo como: tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de u√±as y otros trabajos. Trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta m√°s tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. Tambi√©n vende ropa de todo tipo en su local ya que all√≠ tiene unas vitrinas para mostrar sus prendas, las mismas que les da a sus clientes a cr√©dito y que cobra cada 8 d√≠as, lleva con su sal√≥n de belleza m√°s de 17 a√±os y le ha ido muy bien.
Este cr√©dito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes y ropa de todo tipo para sus ventas. Est√° en el Banco Comunal desde hace cinco ciclos y le gusta porque el banco le ha ayudado para aumentar su negocio.
Sus sue√±os son seguir adelante y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.
Here we met Johana who is 30 years old. She is married and from this relationship has a 12 year old son who studies at school. Her husband is a salesman.
Several years ago she took a beauty course at a local academy. She has a beauty salon where she carries out various types of work such as: hair dying, men's haircuts, hair painting and other jobs. She works from 8:00 am until 21:00 pm and sometimes later if her customers need her services. She also sells all sorts of clothes in her place of business as she has glass cabinets where she can display her items of clothing. She sells to her customers on credit and collect the payment every 8 days. She has worked in her beauty salon for more than 17 years and things have gone well for her.
This loan will be used to buy hair dyes, perms and all sorts of clothes to sell. She has been in this communal bank for more than five loan cycles and she likes it because the bank has helped her to increase her business.
Her dreams are to continue progressing and extending her business.

loan.use: to buy hair dyes, perms and clothes.

loan.name: B√©nida

texts.fr: B√©nida est une femme √¢g√©(e) de 36 ans. Elle est mari√©e √• un gestionnaire dans une banque de la place. B√©nida travaille comme revendeuse de perles depuis 2006. Elle vend dans une boutique √† toutes personnes. Sa difficult√© principale est la m√©vente. B√©nida a requis son troisi√®me cr√©dit de WAGES afin d‚Äôacheter des perles pour revendre. Elle veut r√©investir dans l‚Äôactivit√©. Dans les prochaines ann√©es, B√©nida voudrait vendre ses perles √† l‚Äô√©tranger. Elle dit qu‚Äôavec les profits, Elle pr√©voit de perspectives d‚Äôavenir pour la famille.
texts.en:
B√©nida is a 36-year-old woman. She is married to a manager who works for a local bank.
B√©nida has been working as a bead reseller since 2006. She sells in a shop. Her customers come from all walks of life. Her main challenge is a slump in sales.
She has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy beads for resale. She wants to reinvest in the activity.
In the coming years, B√©nida would like to sell her beads abroad. She says that her profits will allow her family to have a brighter future.

loan.use: to buy beads.

loan.name: Wendtoin Group

texts.fr:
Mme ASSETO est la responsable du groupe WENDTOIN. Elle est mari√©e et m√®re de 06 enfants. Le plus √¢g√©e a 25ans et le moins √¢g√©e a 06ans. 02 de ses enfants vont √† l‚Äô√©cole et elle a 06 personnes √† sa charge.
Mme vend du poisson frit depuis 12 ans. Elle s‚Äôapprovisionne √† Dassasgo en ville. Ses clients sont ses voisins et ses clients de tous les jours.
Mme veut s‚Äôacheter 04sachets de poisson pour frire.
Elle utilise ses b√©n√©fices pour renforcer son activit√© car elle achetait √† cr√©dit. Mme ambitionne s‚Äôacheter une moto pour facilit√© son activit√©.
texts.en: ASSETO is the group leader of the WENDTOIN group. She is married and the mother of 6 children. The eldest is 25 and the youngest 6 years old. 2 of her children go to school, and she has 6 dependents in her household. She has been selling fried fish for 12 years. She makes her purchases in the city in Dassago. Her customers are regulars and they are her neighbours. She wants to buy 4 bags of fish to fry. She uses her profits to strengthen her business, as she buys on credit. She hopes to buy a motorbike to make her work simpler.

loan.use: to purchase 4 bags of fish for frying

loan.name: Filomena

texts.es: La Sra. Filomena tiene 55 a√±os no es casada pero es madre soltera con 3 hijos que son mayores de edad (independientes), ella se dedica a la venta de comida, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de el Alto, este pr√©stamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la instituci√≥n, La Sra. Filomena utilizara este pr√©stamo para la compra de material de construcci√≥n para la construcci√≥n de su vivienda y as√≠ poder vivir c√≥modamente, su raz√≥n para solicitar este pr√©stamo es falta de capital, La Sra. Filomena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, ya que hay muchos lugares donde venden comida por esta zona, pero aun as√≠ tiene mas venta, la Sra. Filomena se siente feliz y agradecida con la instituci√≥n por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Filomena is 55 years old. She is not married but is a single mother with three children who are now adults (independent). She makes a living selling food in her stall which is in a busy city in Alto. This loan is her second cycle with the MFI. Filomena will use this loan to buy construction materials to build a house to be able to live comfortably. Her reason for requesting this loan is lack of capital. Filomena faces challenges in her business such as competition as there are many places which sells food in the area. However, Filomena has good sales and she feels happy and grateful to the MFI for the support given to her.

loan.use: to buy construction materials to build a house.

loan.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: Este Comit√© se formo a trav√©s de la Sra. Anacleta y la Sra. Victoria, quienes se hab√≠an acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya y as√≠ decidieron formar el grupo, son 26 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los d√≠as. Ellas son independientes en sus labores, pero tambi√©n hacen actividades juntas. La Sra. Victoria se dedica a la cr√≠a y venta de pollo, y nos cuenta que es muy sacrificado, pues debe de estar pendiente siempre de sus animales. Este trabajo le ayuda a poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma mantener a sus familiares. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de pollitos para la cr√≠a y tambi√©n alimentos para estos, lo cual le ser√° de mucha ayuda en sus proyectos de trabajo.
texts.en:
This committee was created by Anacleta and Victoria, who went to the office of the Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya, and from there, they decided to form the group. The group has 26 hard working, humble woman who must earn a living each day. They are independent in their work, but they also do some activities together.
Victoria raises and sells chickens. She says that the work requires much sacrifice because she must be constantly devoted to her animals. This work allows her to continue working and thus support her family.
She is requesting the loan to purchase chicks to raise, as well as food for them, which will be a big help for her in her work projects.

loan.use: Purchase chicks to raise and chicken feed for the chicks

loan.name: Grey Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el cant√≥n Rocafuerte se re√∫nen cada quince d√≠as las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugare√±os que son reconocidos en todo en todo el pa√≠s y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar conocimos a la se√±ora Grey, tiene 40 a√±os de edad, est√° casada y de esta relaci√≥n tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 18, 16 y 12 a√±os de edad, los mismos que estudian dos en Universidad y dos en colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
Ella es un ama de casa que para ganar sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de sandalias, agua en bid√≥n y productos Avon (art√≠culos de belleza, cosm√©ticos perfumer√≠a y accesorios para damas). Tiene un peque√±o local en su casa donde vende todos sus productos aunque a veces tambi√©n sale a hacer sus recorridos, trabaja todos los d√≠as desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, lleva 6 a√±os dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este cr√©dito lo va a emplear en comprar sandalias, perfumes, bisuter√≠a, cosm√©ticos, cremas y otros productos. Est√° en el Banco Comunal desde hace 6 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los cr√©ditos.
Su sue√±o es tener una farmacia.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.
Here we met Grey. She is 40 years old, married and from this relationship has four children, aged 22, 18, 16 and 12. Two of them study at university and two at school. All her children still live with her. Her husband is a chauffeur.
She is a housewife who in order to earn her own money makes a living selling sandals, barrels of water and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She has a small space in her house where she sells all her products although sometimes she also travels round to see her customers. She works every day from 8:30 am until 17:00 pm. She has carried out this activity for the past 6 years and things are going well.
She will use this loan to buy sandals, perfumes, imitation jewellery, cosmetics, creams and other products. She has been in this communal bank for the past 6 loan cycles and she likes it because of the help she receives with the loans.
Her dream is to have a pharmacy.

loan.use: to buy sandals, perfumes, imitation jewellery, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loan.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es: 15 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty, se unieron con las ganas de salir adelante y apoyarse las unas a las otras, y de esa forma brindarles un mejor futuro a sus familias. Actualmente se encuentran en en el segundo ciclo, y su meta es poder llegar al nivel m√°ximo del programa. Unice, es una de las integrantes, y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas usadas, comenta que le va muy bien, puesto que la venta de ropas usadas tiene muy buena demanda. Ya que siempre tiene muy lindas ropas y gracias a la calidad y buen precio de las mismas, ha podido formarse ya una buena clientela. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de prendas, con las cuales podr√° tener mas en stock y de esa forma tener mas clientes. Ellas est√°n contentas por la ayuda que est√°n recibiendo por parte de kiva y de fundaci√≥n paraguaya.
texts.en:
15 women from the city of Curuguaty met up with the desire to get ahead and support each other and in this way provide a better future for their families. At the moment she is in her second loan cycle and her goal is to be able to get to her maximum level in the program.
Unice is one of the members and she tells us that she makes a living selling all sorts of used clothing. She comments that it is going very well, given that the sales of used clothing has a high demand. As she always has pretty clothes and thanks to the quality and good price of these, she has been able to form a good client√®le.
She requests this loan to buy items of clothing with which she will have more stock and so have more customers. She is very happy for the help they are receiving from Kiva and Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya.

loan.use: to buy clothing items for resale.

loan.name: Gisele

texts.fr:
Cliente de 38 ans, mari√©e et m√®re de 5 enfants √©tant tous sur le banc de l'√©cole. Il y'a de cela 3 ans ,elle a commence a vendre la viande de brousse , les gibiers qu'elle allait acheter dans les villages forestiers et elle livrait ses produits aux restaurateurs et foyers qui aiment ce genre de mets , son activit√© a bien marche et elle a eu a faire des ventes de 50.000 fs a 200.000 frs par jour.
Elle a rembours√©e ses pr√™ts avec succ√®s et a fait des √©pargnes consid√©rables et en ce qui concerne sa vie familiale, elle nous dit qu'elle a pu am√©liorer les conditions sociales et a aide son mari pour payer les frais d'√©colages et ils sont entrain d'investir pour construire une nouvelle maison.
Avec ses √©pargnes et son nouveau pr√™t,elle vient de lancer une nouvelle activit√© et elle a ouvert un d√©p√¥t de ciment , elle a acheter 5 tonnes de ciments pour un d√©but,et elle continue a g√©rer les deux activit√©s celui de la vente de la viande de brousse et la vente de ciment simultan√©ment.
Tres fi√®re d'elle , elle veut aller loin dans son commerce et veut √™tre une importatrice de ciment dans les ann√©es avenir
texts.en: The client is 38 years old, married and the mother of 5 children - all of whom are in school. 3 years ago, she began selling bushmeat and game that she goes to buy in the forest villages, and she then delivers these products to restaurants and households who appreciate this sort of food. This business has worked well and she has generated daily sales of 50,000 to 200,000 frs. She has successfully repaid her loans, and has built up considerable savings; in terms of the family's living standards, she tells us she has been able to improve the social conditions and has helped her husband in paying the school fees, and they are in the process of saving to build a new home. With her savings and this new loan, she has recently begun a new business and has opened a cement store. She has bought 5 tonnes of cement to start with, and she is continuing to manage both businesses at the same time - the sale of bushmeat and the sale of cement. She is highly self confident, and wants to progress her business, becoming a cement importer in the future.

loan.use: to purchase 5 tonnes of sacks of cement.

loan.name: Assana

texts.fr: Assana est une femme √¢g√©e de 51 ans. Elle est mari√©e √• un revendeur. Elle a 3 enfants. Assana travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1992. Elle vend des tissus pour tous clients au grand march√© de Lom√©. Elle ach√®te les produits au grand march√© de Lom√©. Elle travaille avec 01 personne. Au moment, sa difficult√© principale est de ne pouvoir pas satisfaire toutes les demandes. Assana a requis son premier cr√©dit de WAGES afin d‚Äôacheter des coupons de soie et de popeline. Elle veut r√©investir dans l‚Äôactivit√©. Dans les prochaines ann√©es, Assana voudrait agrandir la taille de l‚Äôactivit√© en ouvrant une boutique.
texts.en:
Assana is a 51-year-old woman. She is married to a reseller and has three children.
She has been working as a reseller since 1992. She buys and sells fabrics at the Grand Market in Lom√©. Her customers come from all walks of life. She works with one person. Currently, her main challenge is that she cannot meet all of the demand.
Assana has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy sets of silk and poplin. She wants to reinvest in her activity.
In the coming years, Assana would like to expand her business and open a shop.

loan.use: to buy fabrics.

loan.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es: El grupo las √Åguilas lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Indiana quien es estilista y vende cosm√©ticos desde hace 10 a√±os. Ella invertir√° el pr√©stamo en productos de belleza y su meta es tener un sal√≥n. Las otras integrantes son Aracely quien tiene una pulper√≠a y Jesica de 26 a√±os quien tiene un kiosko, vende prendas de oro y plata y ropa.
texts.en:
'Las √Åguilas' group is formed by three hard working and enterprising women. One of them is Indiana who is a stylist and she has sold cosmetics for the past 10 years. She will invest the loan in beauty products and her goal is to have a salon.
The other members are Aracely who has a general store, and Jesica, 26 years old, who has a kiosk, and sells gold and silver items and clothes.

loan.use: to buy cosmetics.

loan.name: Nere 02 Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA est la repr√©sentante du groupe NEERE 02. Elle est mari√©e et n‚Äôa pas d‚Äôenfant. Personne ne va √† l‚Äô√©cole et elle a 02 personnes √† sa charge.
Mme est couturi√®re depuis 2008 soit (04ans). Elle s‚Äôapprovisionne dans une boutique au secteur 17 en ville. Ses clients sont les amis et les voisins.
Mme veut s‚Äôacheter une machine √† coudre ; 10 roulettes √† fils et ¬Ω douzaine de tissus.
Elle √©pargne ses b√©n√©fices et aide √† la scolarisation des enfants. Mme ambitionne acqu√©rir d‚Äôautres machines √† coudre et ouvrir un grand atelier pour son activit√©.
texts.en: AMINATA is the representative of the NEERE 02 group. She is married and has no children. Nobody goes to school and she has 2 dependents. She has been a seamstress since 2008 (4 years). She buys her supplies in a store in sector 17 in the city. Her customers are friends and neighbours. She wants to buy a sewing machine, 10 reels of cotton and half a dozen pieces of cloth. She saves her profits, and helps to put children through school. Her ambition is to get more sewing machines and to open a big workshop for her business.

loan.use: to purchase a sewing machine, 10 reels of cotton and half a dozen cloths.

loan.name: La Union Group

texts.es: El comit√© est√° compuesto por 10 integrantes de la ciudad de Encarnaci√≥n. El comit√© est√° tratando de promover su trabajo grupal, ya que son pocos los meses que trabajan juntas, se re√∫nen cada semana para compartir, comunicar e interiorizarse de las novedades que se generan dentro del grupo. Una de las miembros es catalina, y ella nos comenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, de donde compran sus vecinos y personas de zonas aleda√±as. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y tiene muchas ganas de progreso y un gran esp√≠ritu emprendedor. Su meta es seguir agrandandando su local, y de esa forma ir progresando como microempresario. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lateos y dem√°s insumos, con los cuales podr√° abastcerse y de esa forma tener bien surtida su despensa.
texts.en:
This communal bank is formed by 10 member from the city of Encarnaci√≥n. The communal bank is trying to promote teamwork. As they have only worked together for a few months they meet every week to share, communicate and take in the new changes within the group.
One of their members is Catalina. She tells us that she has a well stocked store, where her neighbours and people from nearby areas come to buy. She is a hard working and enterprising woman who has desires to progress and a great enterprising spirit. Her goal is to continue extending her store and in this way to progress as a micro businesswoman.
She is requesting a loan to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other supplies, which will stock her store and give her a good range of products to offer.

loan.use: Comprar insumos para la despensa. to buy supplies for her

loan.name: Reinaldo Noguera

texts.es: El Se√±or Reinaldo tiene 28 a√±os de edad, est√° acompa√±ado con la se√±ora Gloria, tienen un hijo, viven en la ciudad de Villarrica. El cuenta que se dedica a la venta de art√≠culos electr√≥nicos como ser DvD¬¥s, Cd¬¥s, equipos de sonido, Pendrives, Blue-Ray y ya que el negocio es rentable est√° en constante crecimiento, tiene como clientes a los Funcionarios de una empresa con muchos empleados de esa ciudad, que son clientes seguros. El nos dice que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por darle a su familia todo lo mejor, que no tengan que pasar por privaciones y necesidades, es por ello que siempre se esfuerza al m√°ximo en todo momento. El solicita pr√©stamo para la compra de pendrives, Cd¬¥s, DvD¬¥s y dem√°s art√≠culos que vende y as√≠ podr√° generar m√°s ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia. El se√±or agradece a la Fundaci√≥n por haberle otorgado esta oportunidad de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is 28 years old. His partner is Gloria, they have a son and live in the city of Villarrica. He tells us that he makes a living selling electronic goods such as DVDs, CDs, sound equipment, pen drives, Blue-ray. His business is profitable and in constant growth. He has customers who include government workers in a company who has many employees in this city, who are certain customers.
He tells us that all the effort he makes is to give his family the best, so that they don't have to go without anything or in need. This is why he always gives his all at all times.
He is requesting a loan to buy pen drives, CDs, DVDs and other articles that he sells. In this way he will be able to generate more income and improve his and his family's standard of living. He appreciates this chance to progress given to him by the MFI.

loan.use: to buy pen drives, Cd¬¥s, DvD¬¥s and other articles.

loan.name: Oul√®ye

texts.fr: Madame Oul√®ye est une brave femme qui s‚Äôactive dans l‚Äôagriculture depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle poss√®de un champ qui se trouve √† environ 22 km de la ville principale. Elle est √† son 4√®me cr√©dit √† l‚ÄôIMCEC et aimerait renouveler pour acheter des semences et des intrants agricoles mais aussi construire un bassin pour l‚Äôirrigation compl√®te de toute la surface cultiv√©e. Comme on voit sur la photo, elle est partie acheter du ciment pour entamer d‚Äôabord les travaux de ma√ßonnerie du bassin. Avec le cr√©dit, elle va aussi acheter 4 pots de semences de choux, 100 litres de gasoil, 15 sacs de fumier et un litre de produit photo-sanitaire. Dans le foyer, c‚Äôest elle qui assure la d√©pense quotidienne : l‚Äôachat des denr√©es alimentaires (riz, huile, sucre).Elle pense aussi dans l‚Äôavenir, construire un b√¢timent dans la maison familiale.
texts.en: Oul√®ye is a decent woman who has been involved in agriculture for more than 15 years. She owns a field about 22kms from the main town. She is on her fourth consecutive loan from IMCEC and would like to renew it again in order to purchase cabbage seeds, and some agricultural inputs - but also to build a reservoir to completely irrigate the cultivated area. As we see from the photo, she has bought the cement to begin the work of building the reservoir. With the loan, she is also going to buy 4 pots of cabbage seeds, 100 litres of diesel, 15 bags of manure and a litre of phyto-sanitary product. She is responsible for the household expenses : purchase of foodstuffs (rice, oil, sugar). In the future she hopes to build a building in the family home.

loan.use: to purchase cabbage seeds, inputs (diesel, manure); also to purchase cement to build the reservoir.

loan.name: Roger Gauto

texts.es: El Sr. Roger es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Encarnaci√≥n. Comenta que se dedica al comercio, ya que tiene un local comercial en el circuito comercial en donde vende articulo de bazar hace mas de 15 a√±os, por lo que ya tiene mucha experiencia en el ramo. Gracias a los a√±os que lleva trabajando en esto, ya ha podido formarse una clientela bien definida, que siempre compra de √©l, lo que lo ayuda a tener como un ingreso seguro. Comenta que su meta es tener un gran local donde poder tener m√°s productos que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes. El solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de cubiertos, platos, ollas, sartenes y dem√°s, con lo que podr√° seguir vendiendo y generando ingresos. El est√° muy agradecido por la oportunidad que recibe de fundaci√≥n paraguaya y de kiva.
texts.en:
Roger is single and lives in the city of Encarnaci√≥n. He comments that he makes a living in retail. He has a small shop in a commercial area where he has sold store items for more than 15 years, so he has a lot of experience in this branch.
Thanks to the years he has dedicated to this activity he has been able to form a good customer base who always buy from him. This helps him to have a sure income. He mentions that his goal is have a bigger store where he can have more products to offer to his customers.
He is requesting this loan to buy cutlery, plates, pots and pans and other items, with which he will be able to continue selling and generating income. He is very grateful for the opportunity given to him by Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya and Kiva.

loan.use: to buy articles (cutlery, plates, pots and pans and other items) to sell in his store.

loan.name: Villa De Suerte Group

texts.es: El grupo Villa de Suerte est√° conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Janeth del Socorro de 41 a√±os, tiene una peque√±a venta la cual inicio con la venta de mango y poco a poco fue ampli√°ndolo. Ella tiene tres hijos de 19, 14 y 8 a√±os los cuales estudian. Las otras integrantes son Sandra de 42 a√±os quien tiene una pulper√≠a hace 4 a√±os y Gloria de 38 a√±os comercializa sandalias desde hace 3 a√±os.
texts.en:
Group 'Villa de Suerte' is formed by three hard working women. One of them is Janeth del Socorro, who is 41 years old. She has a small store which she started by selling mango and little by little extended. She has three children aged 19, 14 and 8 who study.
The other members are Sandra, 42 years old, who has a small general store, and Gloria, 38 years old, who has sold sandals for the past three years.

loan.use: to buy basic grains

loan.name: Davy Rodel

texts.fr:
Client de 35 ans, marie et p√®re d'un enfant,il a commence a vendre de l'huile d'arachide en d√©tail il ya de cela plus de vingt ans et il √©tait encore tr√®s jeune .
Ayant deja b√©n√©ficie de plusieurs pr√™ts , il a deja r√©alis√© des grands benefices et a rembourse avec succ√®s ces deux pr√©c√©dents pr√™ts .
A l'octroi de son nouveau pr√™t, il va acheter 15 bidons de 25 litres d'huile d'arachide qu'il va acheter chez les grossistes et il vend en d√©tail chez ses potentiels clients.ses recettes sont de 30.000 frs a 75.000 frs par jour, il a des √©normes benefices et il fait ses repayements sans trop de difficult√©s.
A l'avenir il veut √™tre grossiste , avoir un magasin de vente d'huile et s'occuper aussi de sa famille et de leur scolarit√©
texts.en: Davy Rodel is 35 years old, married and the father of one child. He started retailing peanut oil more than twenty years ago, when he was still very young. Having already had several loans in the past, he has already made substantial profits and has successfully repaid his last two loans. On receipt of this latest loan, he will buy 15 x 25 litre cans of peanut oil which he will buy from wholesalers, and will resell via retail to his potential customers. His income varies from 30,000 to 75,000 frs per day; he makes huge profits and can meet his repayments without too much difficulty. In the future, he wants to be a wholesaler, to have a shop selling oil, and to take care of his family and schooling of his child(ren).

loan.use: to buy 15 x 25 litres cans of peanut oil and 10 x 25 litre cans of palm oil.

loan.name: Mar√≠a Dolores

texts.es:
En el cant√≥n Rocafuerte se re√∫nen cada quince d√≠as las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugare√±os que son reconocidos en todo en todo el pa√≠s y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la se√±ora Mar√≠a, tiene 36 a√±os de edad, est√° casada y de esta relaci√≥n tienen tres hijos de 17, 15 y 12 a√±os de edad, todos estudian en colegio. Su esposo es chofer y trabaja en el Municipio de Rocafuerte.
Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares se dedica al comercio, vende productos por catalogo de la marca Avon (productos de belleza, cosm√©ticos, perfumer√≠a y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los d√≠as de dos a tres horas al dia de preferencia en las ma√±anas, deja sus productos a cr√©dito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Lleva 1 a√±o con su negocio y le va muy bien.
Este cr√©dito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisuter√≠a, cosm√©ticos y cremas. Est√° en el Banco Comunal desde hace casi tres a√±os y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la instituci√≥n.
Su sue√±o es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Dulce Amistad get together every 15 days in the Rocafuerte canton. This place is known for its delicious sweets which are prepared by locals and are well known throughout the country. The place is also known for its friendly, warm, and hardworking people.
Maria lives here. She is 36 and married. She and her husband have three children, ages 17, 15, and 12 years old who are all in school. Her husband is a driver and works in the Rocafuerte Municipaliy. Maria is a very good mother and home maker. In order to support her husband and contribute to the household expenses, she sells Avon beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and lady‚Äôs accessories using a catalogue. She works for about two to three hours every day, preferably in the morning. She sells her products on credit and collects every week to fifteen days according to her customers‚Äô preferences. She has been running this business for one year, and it has been going very well.
She will use the loan to purchase perfumes, costume jewellery, cosmetics, and creams. She has been a member of the communal bank for three years, and she likes it because of the support that the institution provides her.
Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and become good professionals.

loan.use: purchase perfumes, costume jewellry, cosmetics, and creams

loan.name: Angelica Mar√≠a

texts.es:
En el cant√≥n Rocafuerte se re√∫nen cada quince d√≠as las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugare√±os que son reconocidos en todo en todo el pa√≠s y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la se√±ora Ang√©lica, tiene 23 a√±os de edad, mantiene una relaci√≥n de uni√≥n libre de la cual tienen una hija de tres meses de edad, la cual requiere de muchos cuidados. Su marido es mec√°nico.
Ella es una joven madre y ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres d√≠as a la semana de dos a tres horas al dia de preferencia en las ma√±anas, ya que a esta hora su mam√° le cuida a su beb√©, deja sus productos a cr√©dito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Lleva 4 a√±os con su negocio y le va muy bien.
Este cr√©dito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, entre otras prendas. Est√° en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la instituci√≥n.
Sus sue√±os son seguir adelante en su negocio y que a su beb√© no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank 'Dulce Amistad' meet every fifteen days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for the delicious sweets its locals, who are known by the whole country to be warm, friendly, hard working people, prepare.
This is where Ang√©lica lives. She is 23 years old and lives in free union from which she has a three month old daughter, who requires a lot of care. Her husband is a mechanic.
She is a young mother and housewife who obtains her own income and with this she can help her husband with the household bills. She makes a living in retail. She sells catalogue clothes and she does this door to door. She works three days a week between two and three hours a day preferably in the mornings, as this is when her mother can look after her baby. She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every week or every fifteen days depending on what her customers want. She has worked in this business for four years and it is going well.
She will use this loan to buy trousers, shirts, blouses and other items of clothing. She has been a member of this communal bank for two loan cycles and she likes it for the help given by the MFI.
Her dreams are to continue ahead with her business and that her baby doesn't go without anything.

loan.use: to buy trousers, shirts, blouses and other items of clothing.

loan.name: Sara

texts.es: La se√±ora Sara tiene 71 a√±os de edad, est√° casada desde hace tiempo con el se√±or Carlos, ellos viven en su casa de Encarnaci√≥n. La se√±ora Sara es propietaria de una Farmacia que tienen en su casa, se dedica a este comercio desde hace varios a√±os y tiene mucha clientela de la zona. Su esposo es Jubilado y colabora en la casa y en el negocio. Tienen hijos ya adultos e independientes. Gracias a este trabajo ellos han podido salir adelante y mantener su hogar. La se√±ora Sara se define como una persona muy trabajadora que desea seguir luchando y de esa forma tener una vejez digna, sin privaciones. Ella solicita el cr√©dito para la compra de medicamentos en general, con lo cual podr√° tener un buen stock y de esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sara is 71 years old. She has been married for some time to Carlos and they live in their house in Encarnaci√≥n. Sara is the owner of a pharmacy which she has in her house. She has made a living in this activity for several years and has many customers in the area. Her husband is retired and helps out in the house and the business. They have children who are adults and independent. Thanks to this job they have been able to get ahead and keep their house.
Sara considers herself to be a hard working person who wants to continue fighting and spend her old age in a dignified way, without lacking anything.
She requests this loan to buy medicines in general, with which she will be able to have a good stick and be able to comply with her customers demands.

loan.use: to buy medicine to sell.

loan.name: Daniela Burgos

texts.es: La Sra. Daniela tiene 47 a√±os de edad, es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ella trabajo desde muy joven en el rubro de la confecci√≥n y despu√©s de casarse monto una despensa con la que cuenta actualmente. La Sr.a Daniela ya tiene una clientela bien formada en los alrededores del barrio, con este trabajo logro mejorar su vivienda y ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del d√≠a a d√≠a. El necesita de este cr√©dito para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, con los cuales podr√° abastecer su despensa, estos productos son: az√∫car fideos, porotos, legumbres y dem√°s. Ella agradece a la fundaci√≥n por la oportunidad que ha recibido, pues le ser√° de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
47-year-old Daniela is from the city of San Lorenzo. She worked as a dressmaker from a very young age then, after she got married, she set up a grocery store which she still runs.
Daniela has a well-established customer base in the area surrounding her neighborhood. Through her work, she has been able to improve her home and help her husband with their daily expenses.
Daniela needs this loan to buy basic household products with which to stock her store: sugar, noodles, beans, vegetables, etc. She is grateful to Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya for the opportunity that they have given her as it will be a great help.

loan.use: to buy products for her grocery store

loan.name: Lisandro Ortega

texts.es: El Sr. Lisandro es de la ciudad de Pilar, es soltero, nos comenta que es comerciante, adem√°s posee un centro comercial situado en el pueblo de lomasgrande, es un centro comercial donde se comercializa todo tipos de ropas ya sea para damas, caballeros, etc. Vive en casa de su madre, la comercializaci√≥n de sus productos los realiza en toda la ciudad y nos comenta que se dedica a esto hace tres a√±os, por lo cual ya tiene un poco de experiencia en esto. El mismo solicita el pr√©stamo para invertir en su comercio, ya que desea tener m√°s prendas, las cuales les ayudara a poder tener m√°s variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes. El agradece a la fundaci√≥n y a kiva por la oportunidad recibida.
texts.en:
Lisandro is from the city of Pilar. He is single. He tells us that he is a salesman and also owns a store in the small town of Lomasgrande where he sells all kinds of men's and women's clothing. He lives in his mother's home and sells his products throughout the city. He tells us that he has been in this business for three years and so he already has some experience.
Lisandro is requesting this loan to invest in his business because he would like to buy more garments and thereby have a wider variety to sell to his customers. He is grateful to Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity he is receiving.

loan.use: to buy clothing to sell

loan.name: Melchora Ortiz

texts.es: La Sra. Melchora, es comerciante, tiene su negocio en su domicilio. Ella tiene una despensa y carnicer√≠a bien surtidas, con buen movimiento comercial ya que esta en una zona muy recurrida, tiene una clientela formada, quienes son pasajeros, militares, excombatiente, asalariados, etc. EI marido de ella se dedica a la ganader√≠a, tiene un peque√±o establecimiento en una zona aleda√±a. Nos cuenta que tiene como objetivo mantener y fortalecer su puesto de trabajo, por esta raz√≥n ha recurrido a la fundaci√≥n y agradece para darle la oportunidad de obtener este cr√©dito para abastecer cada d√≠a m√°s su negocio con comestibles, bebidas, l√°cteos y dem√°s insumos necesarios, que salen d√≠a a d√≠a. Ella agradece a la fundaci√≥n y a Kiva por la oportunidad que est√° recibiendo.
texts.en:
Melchora is a shopkeeper whose business is located in her home. She has a well-stocked grocery store and butcher's shop and makes a lot of sales because she lives in a very busy area. She has an established customer base made up of passengers, soldiers, veterans, wage earners, etc. Her husband raises livestock and has a small establishment in a neighboring area.
Melchora tells us that her goal is to maintain and strengthen her work place. This is why she has come to Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya and she is grateful to them for having given her the opportunity to obtain this loan for stocking her business with foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other products that she sells every day. She is grateful to Fundaci√≥n Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loan.use: to buy products for her store

loan.name: Los Tres Girasoles Group

texts.es: El grupo los tres girasoles lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Janeth del Carmen quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y reposter√≠a desde hace 10 a√±os los cuales comercializa en Granada y Nindiri. El cr√©dito lo invertir√° en pantalones y ropa para verano. Las otras integrantes son Gladis quien vende nacatamales desde hace 30 a√±os y Alicia tiene una fritanga y vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Tres Girasoles [Three Sunflowers] group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Janeth del Carmen, who has sold clothes and pastries for 10 years in Granada and Nindiri. She will invest the loan in pants and summer clothing.
The other members are Gladis, who has sold nacatamales for 30 years, and Alicia, who sells fried food and clothes.

loan.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing, especially pants and summer clothing.

loan.name: Milciades Benitez

texts.es: Milciades tiene 33 a√±os vive con su padre en la ciudad de Carapegu√°, es soltero, se dedica como vendedor ambulante en las ciudades de Caaguaz√∫, Coronel Oviedo y alrededores, espec√≠ficamente hace mas de 10 a√±os. Se dedico a este trabajo ya que su padre se dedica a esto y tiene muchos parientes en la ciudad de Caaguaz√∫. Fue su padre quien le inculco ya que el tambi√©n va a esa zona a trabajar tambi√©n como macatero y manejan un buen n√∫mero de clientes y es una zona que est√° creciendo econ√≥micamente. Solicito el pr√©stamo para la compra de productos en general como hamacas, colchas, Sobrecamas, championes, remeras y as√≠ poder cubrir las demandas de pedidos que tiene con su clientela y poder crecer m√°s econ√≥micamente y en lo que se refiere en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Milciades is 33 years old and lives with his father in the city of Carapegu√°. He is single and a street vendor in the cities of Caaguaz√∫, Coronel Oviedo and the surrounding areas. He has done this for more than 10 years.
He does this work because his father does it and he has a lot of relatives in the city of Caaguaz√∫. His father got him started since he works in this area too as a street vendor and they have a good number of customers and the area is growing economically.
He asked for the loan to buy general products such as hammocks, blankets, bed covers, sneakers, and t-shirts. This way, he can cover his orders from the customers and grow more economically in his work.

loan.use: to buy hammocks, blankets, bed covers, sneakers, t-shirts, etc.

loan.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 49-year-old lady from Vihiga and a mother of four children. She is married to Alfred who is a civil servant.
Jane runs a retail shop, a business she has been operating for the last eight years, and makes a monthly income of about KES 39,000. She is now taking her fourth loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy retail stock of sugar, cooking oil and other household goods to sell. She will use the expected profits to educate her children.
Her dream is to expand her business and improve her living standards.

loan.use: To buy retail stock of sugar, cooking oil and other household goods to sell.

loan.name: Munene

texts.en: Munene is a 30-year-old single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a pharmacy where he sells drugs. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His primary customers are patients. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more drugs. Munene's business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will run another pharmacy.

loan.use: to buy more drugs.

loan.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma, 46, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Edilberto, 48, a mechanic, and is a mother of six children. Two of the children are working, two are in high school and the remaining two stay at home. She keeps herself busy attending to her kids and doing business as her way of helping her husband sustain daily expenses.
Norma is into a rug business. She cuts and sews scrap textiles that she purchases in garment factories. She makes different kinds and sizes of rugs. She makes door mats, pot holders and rugs that are being used by drivers in cleaning their vehicles. Her regular customers are the drivers that pass through the area where she sells her items. She also has clients in the market that regularly order rugs from her. Aside from this she also retails mineral water for additional income. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.
To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more scrap textiles that she will make into rugs. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.
Norma dreams that all her children will finish their studies and have a good job. She hopes to maintain good income from her business that will help her to provide a comfortable life for her kids. She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* meeting that allows her to give of her own share of God‚Äôs love and care in her life.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loan.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She sells timber to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as busy, because she has many regular customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy timber to sell.

loan.use: To buy timber to sell.

loan.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 32 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, aged 8 and 6. She has had her sari-sari (variety) store business for 8 months. She sells soy sauce, vinegar, salt, canned goods and other various items that her customers regularly buy from her. She earns about 7,000 PHP per month with her business.
Evangeline needs additional capital for her store. She applied for a loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and toiletries. She hopes to save for her children's education.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and toiletries.

loan.name: Gaudentia

texts.en:
Gaudentia is a 60-year-old widowed lady and the mother of two grown up children, and she hails from Western Kenya.
Gaudentia operates a welding workshop, a business she has been running for the last eight years. She makes a monthly income of about KES 17,000. She is a longtime client of KADET LTD and she is taking her eighth loan, which she will use to buy metals for the welding shop. She will use her profits to pay back the loan.
Her dream is to grow her business through KADET funding.

loan.use: To buy metals for the welding shop.

loan.name: Muraz Musaev

texts.en:
Muraz is 28 years old. He lives in a small village in East Georgia. Muraz is unmarried and lives with his family ‚Äì his mother and a 26-year-old brother.
Agriculture is the main source of income for the family. They have 3 milk cows and 4 calves. Muraz‚Äôs mother produces cheese and sells it on the local open market. The family also sells calves. Along with the above mentioned, Muraz owns 2 mini-buses, which are rented out, and the rent is additional income for him. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,200 Laris.
Muraz requested credit for purchasing calves. He will grow them for 5-6 months and then sell the grown calves in early fall for a higher price. The family will get additional income, which will allow them to improve their living conditions.

loan.use: to purchase calves.

loan.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
This is Bebelyn, 47, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Joerico, 43, a carpenter, and the mother to her children. She keeps herself busy attending to the needs of her family and her business.
Bebelyn is into a rug business. She cuts and sews scrap textiles that she purchases in garment factories. She makes different kinds and sizes of rugs. She makes door mats, pot holders and rugs that are being used by drivers for cleaning their vehicles. Her regular customers are the drivers that pass through the area where she sells her items. She also has clients in the market that regularly order rugs from her. She earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every week.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more scrap textiles that she will make into rugs. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.
Bebelyn dreams that all her children will finish their studies. She hopes that her business will continue to grow. She wants her family to enjoy a comfortable life. She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* meeting that allows her to share God‚Äôs love and care in her life.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loan.name: Ma√±aneras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. ‚ÄúMA√ëANERAS‚Äù iniciar√° el decimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de de Villa Exaltaci√≥n. Est√° compuesta por ocho integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra la se√±ora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociaci√≥n comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, venta de vajillas, tienda de abarrotes, venta de mantas, venta de caf√©, ladrillera, venta de calzados, tienda de abarrotes, venta de cosm√©ticos, almac√©n, venta de ropa, venta de art√≠culos varios, venta de DVD‚Äôs.
La se√±ora Martha, indica que hace seis meses que conforma una asociaci√≥n comunal desde y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de DVD‚Äôs, que viene trabajando hace a√±os. El cr√©dito de este ciclo es para ampliaci√≥n de su mercader√≠a (compra de DVD‚Äôs) que adquiere de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializar√° en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.
Cuando se le consulta qu√© le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.
En la fotograf√≠a no se encuentra el se√±or Abel, por razones personales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Ma√±aneras" or "Morning women" will begin it's 11th cycle with Kiva field partner Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal (Focal center) of the village Exaltaci√≥n. This bank is made up of 8 people and has a governing board. The head of the board is Mrs. Martha. The businesses that the communal bank members carry forward are varied, and among them we have: selling vegetables, selling dishes, running a grocery store, selling table cloths, selling coffee, brick work, selling undergarments, running another grocery store, running a grocer's shop, selling clothes, selling various articles, and selling DVD's.
Mrs. Martha indicates that six months ago the group was formed and since that time until now she has been selling DVD's, something she has been doing for many years. The loan requested is to increase merchandise (to purchase DVD's) that she buys in the city of El Alto, and then later to sell them in her regular stall. This form of work allows her to support her family since she is married and has six children.
When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the meetings.
In the photograph Mr. Abel is not pictured for personal reasons.

loan.use: To purchase DVD's

loan.name: Edith Del Rosario Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andr√©s De Vera de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde hace muchos a√±os como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se re√∫nen cada quince d√≠as las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.
La se√±ora Edith es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque con los cr√©ditos ella ha podido mejorar su negocio y su situaci√≥n econ√≥mica. Tiene 53 a√±os de edad, est√° casada y de esta relaci√≥n tiene seis hijos, cinco de ellos ya son mayores de edad, el menor tiene 16 a√±os, dos de ellos estudian en universidad y colegio y aun viven con ella los dos menores. Su esposo es vendedor de seguros.
Ella hace varios a√±os aprendi√≥ corte y confecci√≥n en una academia de la localidad. Tiene un peque√±o taller de costura en su casa en el cual se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, pero lo que m√°s le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer o de ni√±as, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y en la actualidad tiene un contrato con el Estado para elabora uniformes para escuelas y colegios, con ella trabaja una de sus hijas a quien le paga por su trabajo. Trabaja todos los d√≠as desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta m√°s tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Tiene m√°s de 15 a√±os realizando esta labor y le ha ido muy bien.
Este nuevo cr√©dito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura.
Sus sue√±os son tener un taller m√°s grande y cumplir a tiempo con sus obras ya que tiene bastante por entregar.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the '4 de Agosto' community bank meet in Andr√©s De Vera parish, in the city of Portoviejo. This city has been known for many years as the 'City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.
Edith is a founding member of this community bank and she likes it because she has been able to improve her business and her financial situation through the loans. She is 53 years old, married, and has six children. Five of her children are already adults and her youngest [son] is 16 years old. Two of her children are studying at university and high school and the two youngest still live with her. Her husband is an insurance salesman.
Some years ago, Edith learned how to make clothes in an academy in her town. She has a small sewing workshop in her home where she makes all kinds of clothing. However, what she enjoys making the most is women's and girls' clothes. She works filling orders from private individuals and also currently has a contract with the State for making school uniforms. She works with one of her daughters who she pays for her work. Edith works every day from 6.00am to 10.00pm and sometimes until even later when she has orders to fill. She has more than 15 years experience in her work and has done very well.
Edith will use this new loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing supplies. Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and to complete her jobs on time because she has quite a few orders to deliver.

loan.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing supplies

loan.name: Genis

texts.en:
Genis is a 34-year-old entrepreneur from San Miguel, Bohol. Genis has had a sari-sari (convenience) store business for three years. He sells biscuits, canned goods, instant noodles and spices. He also sells dried fish to his community. Genis earns 6,000 PHP per month with his business. He works hard to save for his future family.
Genis is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice and soft drinks. Genis hopes to experience a better quality of life.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice and soft drinks.

loan.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school.
Aidah sells secondhand clothes at the market. She also sells charcoal. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years and works seven days a week.
Aidah has requested a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land on which to build rental rooms.
Aidah lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees and medication.

loan.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loan.name: Gogo Group

texts.fr:
Mme LUCIE est la repr√©sentante du groupe GOGO. Elle est mari√©e et m√®re d‚Äôun enfant. Il est √¢g√© de 09ans et va √† l‚Äô√©cole. Elle a 03 personnes √† sa charge.
Mme vend des produits de beaut√© et des m√®ches depuis 03ans. Elle s‚Äôapprovisionne au grand march√© de Ouaga. Ses clients sont les voisins et amis.
Mme veut s‚Äôacheter 10 boites de pommade ;10 boites de champoing ;30 paquets de m√®ches et 01 douzaine de crayons pour maquillage.
Elle √©pargne ses b√©n√©fices et aide √† la scolarisation de son enfant. Mme ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin pour son activit√©.
texts.en:
Mme Lucie is group leader of GOGO. She is married with one 9 year old girl who goes to school. Mme Lucie has three people in her care.
She has sold cosmetics and hair pieces for three years. She sources her goods from the large Ouaga market. Her customer base is made up of cousins and friends.
She would like to purchase 10 pots of hair balm, 10 crates of shampoo, 30 packs of hair pieces and a dozen makeup sticks.
She puts aside her profits as savings which help pay for her child's education. Mme Lucie's goal is to open her own store.

loan.use: to purchase 10 jars of hair balm, 10 crates of champagne, 30 packs of hair pieces, and a dozen makeup sticks

loan.name: John

texts.en: John, 29 years old and married to Caroline, has been selling second-hand jackets for the past year. Having been introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member, John is now requesting his first loan to purchase jackets for resale in his business.

loan.use: to purchase jackets for resale in his business.

loan.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: Kossivi est un homme √¢g√© de 27 ans. Il est mari√©e √• une m√©nag√®re et n‚Äôa pas d‚Äôenfant. Kossivi travaille comme revendeur depuis 2011. Il vend des produits cosm√©tiques pour tous clients dans un quartier de Lom√©. Il ach√®te les produits au m√™me lieu. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficult√© principale est la rupture de stock. Kossivi a requis son premier cr√©dit de WAGES afin d‚Äôacheter des produits cosm√©tiques. Il veut r√©investir dans l‚Äôactivit√©. Dans les prochaines ann√©es, Kossivi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activit√©. Il dit qu‚Äôavec les profits, il pr√©voit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossivi is 27 years old and married to a homemaker. They have no children.
Kossivi has been working as a reseller since 2011. Working alone, he sells beauty products to all types of customers in a district of Lom√©. He buys his merchandise in the same area. At this time, his main difficulty is a depletion of stock.
Kossivi is seeking his first loan from WAGES to buy cosmetic products. He wants to reinvest in his activity.
In the coming years, Kossivi would like to expand his business. He plans to use the profits earned to provide for his family.

loan.use: to buy beauty products for resale.

loan.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 48-year-old married woman and she has five aduls children. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is a very energetic and happy woman.
She is enterprising and sells retail items for daily consumption from her home. Her principal customers are her neighbors, family members and friends. She has worked at this activity for several years and has shown an ability to grow and maintain her clientele due to the length of time she has been in business.
Fatima is requesting a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to invest in her business and buy more products such as soft drinks, sugar, biscuits and eggs to offer her customers.
Her main dream is to get ahead with her family and give them a better life.

loan.use: to buy more products such as soft drinks, sugar, biscuits and eggs to offer her customers.

loan.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a 35-year-old married man and has two children who live with him in Taiz, Yemen.
He has been operating a women's clothing sales business for two years. He started out for financial reasons. Since he didn't have an income, he decided to obtain money and help his family this way.
He has a lot of ambition to succeed in his business, that's why he wants the loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy dresses, skirts, blouses and ladies' accessories for his business.
In addition of his current business, he hopes to open a men's clothing sales business.

loan.use: to buy dresses, skirts, blouses and ladies' accessories for his business.

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 54 years old and married to Otachi. She is the mother of one child. They all live in Nakuru, Kenya.
Josephine practices dairy farming. From the sale of milk, she is able to cater to her family‚Äôs needs.
She plans to use this loan to buy dairy feed for her cows. In the future, Josephine hopes to own a dairy farm and become a milk supplier.

loan.use: buy dairy feed for her cows.

loan.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 37-year-old married woman. She has five children ranging from 6 months to 14 years old. She describes herself as honest and a go-getter.
Julia operates a food stall where she sells French fries. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high price of potatoes.
She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more potatoes for preparing French fries for selling. Julia's business goal is to run a restaurant within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standard.

loan.use: to buy potatoes for preparing French fries for selling.

loan.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 54 years old. He is married to Alice and together they have two children.
Francis is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for the past seven years.
This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.
He will use the loan amount to purchase a dairy cow.
In the future, he hopes to be the leading dairy farmer in his area.

loan.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loan.name: Kaija

texts.en:
Kaija is a 45-year-old father of four children living in Kagadi, Uganda.
For three years he has been operating a retail shop where he normally sells food. His major challenges are customers not paying on time and price fluctuations. He dreams of having his children educated and buying a car.
He would like to diversify his business to include a supermarket. Kaija wants a loan to buy groundnuts, maize and beans for sale.

loan.use: to buy groundnuts, maize and beans for sale.

loan.name: Andrew Muchangi Waihenya

texts.en:
Andrew is 37 years old and married. He has three children.
He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and has employed one person.
To earn extra income, he does farming.
Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future.
He has applied for 80,000 KES to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking oil to resell.

loan.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and cooking oil for resale.

loan.name: Mariano

texts.en:
Mariano is a 53-year-old married man with seven children between 7 and 27.
Mariano works as a farmer in San Miguel, Bohol. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Mariano earns 5,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Mariano works hard to provide for his family's needs. He also sells fish to his community to earn an extra income.
Mariano has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and more fish to sell. Mariano hopes to earn better and be able to sustain his children's education.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers and more fish to sell.

loan.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 47 years old and married with three children. She does pig raising to earn a living. She has been in the business for 16 years and has employed one person. To earn extra income she does farming. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more pigs.

loan.use: To buy more pigs.

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 29 years old and married with one child. She sells tea and snacks to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able improve her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy milk, tea leaves and sugar.

loan.use: To buy milk, tea leaves and sugar

loan.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 28-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She and her husband are both farmers. Marilyn's husband mainly manages their farm. Marilyn helps cultivate their land and plant rice crops. She also rents a stall at the market to sell their harvest. Marilyn does her best to manage her time between business and her children.
