Valdivia is a city in southern Chile, located in the Los Rios region. It is known for having one of the few navigable rivers in Chile, the Calle-Calle. Valdivia has, among its main economic activities, a shipbuilding industry, a timber industry, a paper mill, a pulp mill (Celco), a brewery and mills. Tourism plays an important role, as well as educational services, led by the Universidad Austral de Chile.

loan.use: buy shirts and socks

loan.name: Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Luis tiene 57 a√±os y es viudo, es de ocupaci√≥n electricista y se dedica a todo tipo de instalaciones el√©ctricas, el vive por la zona 26 de Mayo, este pr√©stamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la instituci√≥n, El Sr. Luis utilizara este pr√©stamo para la compra de escalera para su negocio as√≠ esta escalera le facilitara ya que por ser altas las conexiones tenia problema ya que no pod√≠a alcanzar, y as√≠ esto le permitir√° hacer un buen trabajo, el Sr. Luis enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia en el rubro y utilizara los beneficios en la construcci√≥n de un cuarto, su deseo del Sr. Luis es tener un veh√≠culo que le ayuda a transportar sus herramientas, se siente agradecido con la instituci√≥n por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Luis is 57 years old and a widower. He is an electrician by trade and he carries out all kinds of electrical installation work. He lives in 26 de Mayo neighborhood and this loan is his second with the institution. Luis will use his loan to buy a ladder for his business. This will help him in his work because he was having problems in reaching some high connections. It will allow him to do a good job. Luis faces challenges in his business such as competition. He will use the profits he makes to build a room. Luis would like to own a vehicle as this would help him in transporting his tools. He feels grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loan.use: to buy a ladder for his business

loan.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 40-year-old married man with six children; he lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. David is a farmer and has been growing tomatoes for 12 years now. His challenges include unpredictable seasonal weather changes, price fluctuations, and inflation.
David needs this loan to buy chemicals for spraying so that he can produce high quality tomatoes. He hopes to use his profits to build a permanent home, buy a motorcycle, and buy more land to grow crops.

loan.use: to buy chemicals for spraying his tomatoes.

loan.name: Jenny Elizabeth Roque Gomez

texts.es: Jenny Elizabeth es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundaci√≥n Le√≥n 2000, durante el tiempo que ha tenido el cr√©dito ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y muy luchadora tiene metas en la vida, su mayor sue√±o es que su hijo culmine sus estudios y sacar a su negocio adelante ir creciendo cada d√≠a. Jenny Elizabeth nos expresa que con el apoyo que se le ha brindado ha aumentado su mercader√≠a y sus clientes que la visitan para comprar su producto, tiene bastante pedidos para entregar por tanto esta nuevamente solicitando financiamiento para abastecerse y as√≠ cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes lo cual comprara con el cr√©dito cremas, tratamientos, shampoo, l√°piz labial, brillos, l√°piz de ojos entre otras.
texts.en: Jenny Elizabeth is an entrepreneur and an existing client of Fundaci√≥n Le√≥n 2000. Over the time she has been receiving loans, she has shown herself to be a responsible and very tenacious woman. She has goals in life. Her biggest dreams are for her son to finish his studies and to make progress in her business, growing it further every day. Jenny Elizabeth tells us that, with the support she has received, she has increased her merchandise and also the number of customers who visit her to buy her products. She has quite a lot of orders to deliver and so she is requesting a new loan in order to stock up. She will use her loan to buy creams, treatments, shampoo, lipsticks, lip gloss, eyeliners, etc.

loan.use: to buy creams, treatments, shampoo, lipsticks, lip gloss, eyeliners, etc.

loan.name: Lida

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo como contadora,ella tiene un estudio contable,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante,el sue√±o de la socia es mejorar en su trabajo.La socia solicita el credito para implemtar su estudio contable como un escritorio.
La socia est√° feliz por el pr√©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues working as an accountant. She has an accountancy office where she works from 8.00am to 7.00pm. Through this work, she would like to make progress in life. The member's dream is to improve in her work. She is requesting this loan to equip her accountancy office with a desk.
The member is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: to buy a desk for her accountancy office

loan.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man, and he has two children, who are 10 and 17 years old. Charles describes himself as an honest man. He operates a retail stall where he sells fruits such as watermelon, and he has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a market area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes shortage of watermelons as his biggest business challenge.
Charles will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more watermelons. Charles's dream and business goal is to build his own retail location within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children.

loan.use: to buy more watermelons for selling.

loan.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 34 years old and single. She has operated a snack shop and milk bar business in Nakuru town now for the last three years.
Tabitha plans to use this loan to buy more soft drinks, milk, and snacks for sale. In the future, she hopes to become a cake distributer in Nakuru town and thereby increase her income.

loan.use: to buy soft drinks, milk, and snacks for sale.

loan.name: Sedrack

texts.en:
Sedrack is a 31-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been selling goats for six years now, and he got the capital to start the business from brick laying. His major challenges are the steadily increasing price of goats and the difficulty of finding customers.
Sedrack's dream is to educate his children to higher levels and to diversify his business to include cattle sales. He needs this loan to buy more goats for sale.

loan.use: to buy goats for sale.

loan.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 35 years old. She is married to Charles and together they have four children. She sells roasted maize and has been in the business for the past six years.
This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was brought to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of maize for roasting and selling to her customers.
She hopes to own a retail shop in the near future.

loan.use: to purchase more maize to roast

loan.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 24-year-old married woman. She has four children (three daughters and a son). She describes herself to be a social and jovial woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as mangoes, tomatoes, onions, kale, etc. She has been involved in this business for one year.
Catherine‚Äôs business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of vegetables and fruits.
She will use the KES 5,000 loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be selling vegetables and fruits wholesale within five years. Catherine's dream and hope for the future is to venture into another business of providing rental house services.

loan.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loan.name: Delina

texts.es: La se√±ora Delina actualmente vive en alquiler en la ciudad de Cochabamba, aunque el lugar de nacimiento es otro departamento donde hay mucha pobreza raz√≥n por la cual tuvo que inmigrar con sus dos hijos, es madre soltera ya que el marido le ha abandonado con sus dos hijos. La actividad principal es el comercio de frutas, vende en la ferias semanales de las provincias de Tiraque y Punata, la se√±ora trabaja para mantener a sus hijos diariamente adem√°s es una mujer humilde, el destino del cr√©dito es para capital de operaci√≥n, con lo cual ampliara su negocio y diversificara m√°s los productos que vende y de esa manera incrementar sus ingresos econ√≥micos en los pr√≥ximos a√±os. Entre sus metas esta que sus dos hijos estudien hasta tener una carrera profesional, para que de esa manera puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Delina lives in a rental home in the city of Cochabamba. However, her birthplace is in another department where there is a lot of poverty. For this reason, she had to immigrate with her two children. She is a single mother since her husband abandoned her and the two children. Her main business is selling fruit. She sells them at the weekly fairs in the provinces of Tiraque and Punata. She works in order to help her children every day. She is a humble person. The loan is destined for operation capital. With the money, she will expand her business and diversify her products more. In this way, she will be able to increase her earnings in the coming years. Her goal is for her two children to study until the reach professional careers, so that they can have a better quality of life.

loan.use: with operation capital for the purchase of fruit.

loan.name: Cerafina

texts.es: La socia pertenece al banco comunal ‚ÄúREYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS‚Äù; El banco est√° ubicado en el distrito de Urquillos, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco. La socia es la Sra. Cerafina tiene 57 a√±os de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cr√≠a gallinas y cuyes, la socia desea poder invertir el pr√©stamo en la compra de alimento para sus animales ella comprara sutuchi, pasto, alfa alfa; la socia tiene cerca de 200 cuyes, y de 50 gallinas; La socia desea invertir el pr√©stamo en la compra de animales menores para la venta. La socia est√° feliz por el pr√©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'Reyna de los Angeles de Urquillos' community bank which is located in Urquillos district, in Calca province, in Cusco department.
Cerafina is 57 years old, married, and has six children. Her business is animal raising. She raises hens and guinea pigs. She would like to be able to invest her loan in buying feed for her animals. She will buy sutuchi (a by-product of the brewing industry), fodder and alfalfa. She has almost 200 guinea pigs and 50 hens. She would also like to invest her loan in buying animals to later sell.
Cerafina is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: to buy animals to sell

loan.name: Clotilde

texts.es: La socia pertenece al banco comunal ‚ÄúREYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS‚Äù; El banco est√° ubicado en el distrito de Urquillos, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco. La socia es la Sra. Clotilde tiene 53 a√±os de edad y es viuda y tiene 6 hijos la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cr√≠a gallinas y tiene hasta el momento 150 gallinas y 65 patos y tambi√©n tiene una peque√±a tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y es muy amigable, la socia en esta ocasi√≥n desea poder invertir el pr√©stamo en la compra de productos para implementar su tienda de abarrotes como arroz, az√∫car, leche, fideos entre otros productos, y con una peque√±a parte comprar alimento para sus animales como pasto, alfa alfa entre otros minerales. La socia est√° feliz por el pr√©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'Reyna de los Angeles de Urquillos' community bank which is located in Urquillos district, in Calca province, in Cusco department.
Clotilde is 53 years old, widowed, and has six children. Her business is livestock raising. She currently has 150 hens and 65 ducks and also has a small grocery store. She is a very hard-working woman and is very friendly. On this occasion, she would like to invest her loan in buying products with which to stock her grocery store such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc. She will also use a small portion of her money to buy feed for her animals such as fodder, alfalfa and other minerals.
Clotilde is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: to buy products for her grocery store (rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc.), and to buy feed for her animals such as fodder, alfalfa and other minerals

loan.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka is a married woman. She has two children between 4 and 6 years old. She describes herself to be a social and responsible woman. She operates a retail business where she sells snacks such as sweets, doughnuts etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents and business people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of operation charged by the municipal council. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more snacks. Mwaka's business goal is to run a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children .

loan.use: to buy more snacks to sell.

loan.name: Philys

texts.en:
Philys is 47 years old and married to William. Together they have a three-year-old child. She has been a farmer for the last nine years. She plans to use this loan amount to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting on her farm during this planting season.
She also plans to use part of this loan amount for labour purposes. In the future, Philys hopes to invest more in her farming and to be able to buy a large parcel of land and build rental houses.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings.

loan.name: David

texts.en:
David is 30 years old and married to Mercy. They have been blessed with three children. He is a mason and from his hard work, he has been able to provide for his family‚Äôs needs.
Apart from the being a mason, he also buys and rears sheep and then sells them later at a profit. He plans to use this amount to buy sheep for rearing and later sell them at a profit.
In the future, David hopes to invest more in his business and make more income, thereby improving his family‚Äôs living standards.

loan.use: to buy sheep to rear and sell later at a profit.

loan.name: Nama

texts.en:
Nama, 46, lives in Caldwell with her husband and three children. Her children are between the ages of 10 and 20, and they are in school. For the past ten years, she has been selling rice, soft drinks, palm oil, and other items.
She is requesting a loan to purchase more commodities for sale. She hopes to build a new home for her children in the future to come.

loan.use: to purchase items like rice, palm oil, and soft drinks for sale.

loan.name: Patterson

texts.en:
Patterson is 38 years old, and he and his wife Martha have three children, all of whom are going to school. He has been a farmer in Olkalou for the last five years.
Patterson plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings to plant during the coming planting season. In the future, Patterson hopes to improve his farming methods and become one of leading farmers in the area.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loan.name: Shedrack

texts.en:
Shedrack describes himself as an honest man. He is single, and he operates a general store where he sells items such as brushes, ink, tubes, and bulbs. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a residential area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes the high price of electronics and plastics as his biggest business challenge.
Shedrack will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more electronics and plastics for sale in his store. His business goal is to run several such general stores within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be able to build a house.

loan.use: to buy more electronics and plastics for sale.

loan.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 42 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and has three children between 10 and 26 years old who are in school and live at home. For the past 10 years, she has been selling charcoal and rice. She started this business with money given to her by her oldest sister and learned this way of selling from her mother. Oretha is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal and rice for her business. Oretha hopes to improve her children's education and build a house.

loan.use: to purchase more charcoal and rice for her business

loan.name: Armine Avetisyan

texts.en:
Armine is still running her trading business, which allows her to help her husband to provide for their family. Recently, Armine has shifted the emphasis of her business to shoes, as she says that it is more profitable.
Armine use her first Kiva loan to buy autumn season clothes and shoes to resell. Now Armine is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of spring season shoes and clothes to resell.

loan.use: to buy a large lot of spring season shoes and clothes for resale.

loan.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 38 years old and lives in Caldwell, Liberia. She is a widow, and she has two children, ages 7 and 11, who are in school and live at home. For ten years now she has been selling charcoal.
Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business. In the future, she hopes to own a house and to educate her children.

loan.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loan.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
Phyllis is 41 years old, married to Michael, and the mother of three school-going children. They live in Nakuru, where she has been selling a variety of fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers.
Phyllis plans to use the loan to buy assorted fruits for sale. In the future, Phyllis hopes to grow her business and supply fruits to all the markets in Nakuru. The profits from this expansion would improve her family's living standards.

loan.use: to buy assorted fruits for sale.

loan.name: Dollipine

texts.en:
Dollipine is 25 years of old and married to Samuel. She operates a metal shop business in Nakuru town where she makes and sells charcoal burners and metal boxes .
She plans to use this loan to buy more metal material for making the boxes and meeting her customers‚Äô demands.
In the future, Dollipine hopes to grow her business, make more income and own residential houses.

loan.use: To buy more metal material for making the boxes for sale.

loan.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi, a 56-year-old mother of two and wife of Nyale, has operated a scrap metal sales business from home for the last 10 years, with town residents as her primary customers. Mnyazi's other source of income is farming. She describes her greatest business challenge to be a lack of scrap metal, and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mnyazi joined Yehu access capital to improve her business, and will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase a stock of scrap metals to sell. Mnyazi aspires to expand her business in the future.

loan.use: to purchase a stock of scrap metals to sell.

loan.name: Munah T.

texts.en:
Munah is 42 years old and lives in Caldwell. She‚Äôs married, and her husband works at a beer factory. They have three children between the ages of 7 and 26, all of whom are attending school. Munah started her business with money given to her by her husband.
Munah is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to build a house for her children in the future.

loan.use: to purchase more used clothes for sale.

loan.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de cafetin,ella prepara sandwich,cafes,leches,tortas y pasteles,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negcoio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sue√±o de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de cafetin.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como leche,panes,pollo y carne.
La socia est√° feliz por el pr√©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member continues to work in her cafe. She makes sandwiches, coffee, cakes and pastries. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. With this business, the member supports her children. The member's dream is to expand and to improve her cafe. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase products for cooking like milk, bread, chicken and meat. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loan.use: purchase products for cooking like milk, bread, chicken and meat.

loan.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi, a mother of four children, is married to Zuma who works as a farmer. Mnyazi has operated a vegetable stall for 10 years, selling her goods at the market. Her primary customers are neighbouring residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of services, and her highest monthly expense as food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mnyazi will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase stocks of vegetables, tomatoes and onions, and aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to purchase stocks of vegetables, tomatoes and onions.

loan.name: Maima

texts.en:
Maima is 36 years old and has two children. She lives in Logan Town. She sells rice, onion, oil, and others items, which she has been doing for six years. She started this business by selling to friends.
Maima is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more rice, onion, oil, and others items for her business. In the future, she wishes to build a store.

loan.use: to purchase rice, onion, oil, and others items.

loan.name: Violo

texts.en: Violo is 40 years old and lives in Caldwell. She‚Äôs married and her husband works with a construction company. They have six children that are attending school and live at home. Violo has been selling juice, rice, oil, and cold water for the past six years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more juice, rice, oil, and cold water for her business. She plans to send her children to college in the near future.

loan.use: to purchase more juice, rice, oil, and cold water for her business

loan.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 27-year-old married woman. She has three children and two are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Emmanuel and he operates a posho mill grinding maize. Joy raises goats for their meat and sells her animals at the market. She's worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are neighbours.
Joy's other source of income includes income from her husband. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Joy will use the Kes 30,000 loan to renovate her house and buy goats to raise for meat. Joy aspires to open a butcher's shop in the future. She joined Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to renovate her house and buy goats to raise for meat.

loan.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She has a retail shop at the market selling cereals. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of beans and groundnuts.
Madina's major business challenges are seasonality and increasing prices of cereals in Uganda. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loan.use: To buy more bags of beans and groundnuts

loan.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 49 years old and married with three children. She has practiced farming in Ol‚Äôkalou for the last four years. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting during this planting season.
In the future, Catherine hopes to improve her farming methods and make more profits thereby providing a good living standard for her family.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loan.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 31 years old and has two children. She operates a stationery shop where she also offers printing services for clients in Malindi town. She has been in this business for three years. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.
Peris is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD for 100,000 KES, which she will use to purchase additional stationery and equipment for her business. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She will save the anticipated profit to take care of her children. In the future, Peris hopes to expand her business so that she may be more financially stable.

loan.use: to purchase additional stationery and equipment for her business

loan.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 56 years old, married, and has five children. He is a farmer, which he has been doing for three years. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.
Pius is requesting his third loan for 60,000 KES, which he will use to purchase farm inputs in preparation for the planting season. The anticipated profit will help pay school fees for his children. He dreams of being a successful farmer in the region.

loan.use: to purchase farm inputs in preparation for the planting season.

loan.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is a fishmonger in Nyame Bekyere near Abura. She buys fresh fish and fries it for sale. Afia has been in this business for 15 years now. She is married to a fisherman and has four children. Afia uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a large quantity of fresh fish to fry for sale. With the new profit Afia wishes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase a large quantity of fresh fish to fry for sale

loan.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is a hairdresser. She operates a beauty salon, which she has done for five years now. Abigail is single and she lives at Jukwa near Abura. She uses her income to pay her utility and accomodation bills. She will use her loan to purchase hair extensions, wigs, hair creams and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. With the new profit, Abigail will expand her business.

loan.use: purchase hair extensions, wigs, hair creams and a hair dryer

loan.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 25 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is living with her boyfriend and along with two children ages 3 and 4. For two years now she has been selling rice in the market. She stated this business with one thousand Liberian dollars($1,000 LD) given to her by her boyfriend. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for her business. She hopes to build her own house and improve her children's education.

loan.use: to purchase more rice for her business

loan.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married to a teacher and has one child. She is a seamstress and also bakes meat pies to sell. She has been sewing for 15 years. She uses her income to help to pay their accommodation bills.
Esi is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase fabrics for the dresses she sews to sell. She will also use some of the loan to purchase flour and other ingredients to bake her meat pies. With the profit, she will expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase fabrics for dresses and flour and other ingredient for meat pies.

loan.name: Vitalis

texts.en:
Vitalis is 44 years old, a married man and blessed with five children aged 20, 16, 13, 10, and seven years old. He is in the business of panel-beating, a business he has been doing for the past six years, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.
He has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase a tool box and a gas cylinder for his work. The profit made from his business will aid him in educating his children.
His dream is to see his business expand as well as educate his children, and this is his first loan.

loan.use: To purchase a tool box and a gas cylinder.

loan.name: Sabina Esi

texts.en: Sabina is a fishmonger. She sells salted fish ("kako") and other items at Jukwa near Abura. She is married to a driver and has seven children. She has been in this business for the past nine years now. Sabina uses her income to help her husband in the general up-keep of their family. She will use her loan to purchase to salted fish and other food items for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loan.use: purchase to salted fish and other food items for sale.

loan.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka, a 51-year-old mother of four children, one of whom is enrolled in school, is married to Amri, a farmer. For the past 10 years Mwaka has been operating a poultry farm, selling her goods from home, primarily to neighbours. Mwaka's other source of income is farming. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of food, and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwaka will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase chicks and poultry feeds, and aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to get loans to improve her business.

loan.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 41 years old and a mother of four children. She operates a tailoring business where she mends and also makes new dresses for her clients. This lady has been in the business for the last ten years. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.
She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and is applying for her fourth loan of 100,000 KES. She intends to use the loan to purchase additional clothing material for her business.
The client will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her children. In future, Elizabeth hopes to grow her business as well as venture into other businesses.

loan.use: to buy materials for making dresses for sale.

loan.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in New Kru town. She is 28 years old, single, with two children ages 5 and 9, who are in school and live at home. For the past three years she has been operating a small table market where she sells bitter ball (squash), peppers, onions, Vita, and many other items. She started this business by selling dried fish around in her community with the little goods she could afford, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter ball, peppers, onions, Vita and many other items for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loan.use: to purchase more bitter ball (squash), peppers, onions, Vita and many other items for her business

loan.name: Saul Neptali

texts.es: Sa√∫l tiene 57 a√±os de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos de 28, 24, 23 y 20 a√±os de edad, y vive con su familia en la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Don Sa√∫l se dedica a una actividad de negocio que es la compra y venta de habano. Inicio este negocio hace 9 a√±os empezando con poco producto vio que este se vend√≠a con mucha facilidad y que era rentable. Ahora el cuenta con un inventario mas amplio y los vende en puntos de venta tur√≠sticos dentro y fuera de la ciudad. Con este negocio ha salido adelante con su familia. El esta muy motivado a seguir trabajando y por eso le dedica 8 horas diarias para seguir aumentado sus ingresos. Este pr√©stamo de 6,000 lempiras lo invertir√° en abastecerse en comprar m√°s habano. Aprovechando la temporada alta para vender y poder incrementar sus ventas. Su plan es, que con este pr√©stamo su negocio crecer√° satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Sa√∫l, age 57, is married and has four children, ages 28, 24, 23, and 20. He lives with his family in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Sa√∫l has a business of buying and selling cigars. He started this business nine years ago with little product. He saw that these sold very easily and that it was profitable. He now has a larger inventory, and he sells them at tourist sites within and outside of the city.
With this business he has gotten his family ahead. He is very motivated to keep working, so he works eight hours a day in order to continue increasing his income.
He will use this loan for 6,000 lempiras to stock up and buy more cigars. He will take advantage of the high season for selling, and he will be able to increase his sales.
His plan is to use this loan for his business to grow satisfactorily.

loan.use: to buy cigars to sell.

loan.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 32-year-old married woman. She has two children aged 2 and 4 years old. She describes herself to be an honest, trustworthy and patient woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells second-hand clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located near a busy market and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of room for her operation as it gets difficult to operate during the rainy season. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more second-hand clothes. Lydia's business goal is to run a big boutique within five years.

loan.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loan.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 45-year-old married woman. She has six children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Charles and he works as area Councillor. Christine operates a tailoring business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 12 years and was previously employed as a secretary. Her primary customers are friends, relatives and passersby.
Christine's other source of income includes her husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is fees. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Christine will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. Christine aspires to open a tailoring school in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loan.use: to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loan.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 54 years old and a mother of four children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes and sells dresses to clients in Malindi town. This lady has been in business for the last ten years and earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES.
She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and she is applying for her third loan of KES 80,000. She intends to use the loan to purchase clothing material for her business.
She will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her children. In future, Agnes hopes to grow her business and venture into other businesses as well.

loan.use: to purchase materials for her business

loan.name: Bela

texts.en:
Bela is 48 years old. She lives in a village of Kaspi District, East Georgia. Bela is married and lives with her family: her husband ‚Äì Nugzar, two daughters (25 and 10 years old) and a 19-year-old son. Nugzar is a worker in the village. Bela takes care of a family-owned milk cow. She produces cheese and sells on average 20 kg of this product in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris.
Bela requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. With two milk cows, she will be able to increase production and sales of cheese by 100% and the income of the family will increase by 150 Laris. They will be able to purchase additional household goods and to improve family living conditions.

loan.use: to purchase a milk cow

loan.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a 42-year-old married woman. She has seven children and five are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Kahindi. Tabu operates a vegetable kiosk and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are friends, neighbours and passersby.
Tabu's other source of income includes her husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her highest monthly expense is fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Tabu will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of dried fish for sale. Tabu aspires to open a grocery shop and a butchery in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loan.use: to purchase sacks of dried fish for sale.

loan.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children and only four of her children are in school. She doesn‚Äôt take care of additional family members. She sells second-hand bags at the market. She has sells her products on both wholesale and retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years .She works seven days a week.
Ruth has requested a loan of 1,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second-hand bags. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to start importing second-hand shoes and clothes. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees and rent.

loan.use: To buy more bales of second-hand bags

loan.name: Emzar Tatarashvili

texts.en:
Emzar is 47 years old. He is married and lives in a village of Mtskheta District with his wife Tsitsi. Emzar and Tsitsi earn their living through agricultural business. They have a peach garden and vineyard. In season Emzar and Tsitsi work in their garden and vineyard. In late summer/fall they sell harvested produce locally to greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris.
Emzar requested a loan for purchasing medicines to treat his plants for parasites. After properly performed seasonal work the family can count on a good harvest, which will be sold for an appropriate price. The family will get planned income, which will be used for financing family living costs during the year.

loan.use: to purchase drugs for treating plants for parasites

loan.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a married woman. She has three children and all three are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Iddi.
Annet sells charcoal and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are friends, neighbours and passersby. Annet's other source of income includes her husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food.
She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Annet will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal and renovate her stall. Annet aspires to be a wholesaler in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loan.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and renovate her stall.

loan.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with seven children and five of her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a retail shop at the market. She also sells piped water from home to earn additional income. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of rice, sugar, cooking oil, and boxes of soap. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own a wholesale shop and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loan.use: To buy more bags of rice, sugar, cooking oil, and boxes of soap

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has three children and two are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Gideon and he works as a mason. Mary operates selling food and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for one year. Her primary customers are the general public. Mary's other source of income includes her husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mary will use the KES 20,000 loan to renovate her food stall. Mary aspires to be a wholesaler in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loan.use: to renovate her food stall.

loan.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 25 years old. He lives in Mtskheta District, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife, Tsitsi, and parents. Giorgi and Tsitsi earn a living through agriculture. They work hard in their 180 square meter greenhouse, where they grow tulips. They sell the flowers in the open market of Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Along with farming tulips, Giorgi works as a tractor operator in the village. He provides tractor repair services to farmers from his and nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.
Giorgi requested a loan for renovation of the greenhouse and cultivation of the land in it. He will change broken glasses so that the greenhouse can better maintain the correct temperatures. Also, after proper cultivation and fertilization, the land in the greenhouse will produce better quality tulips, which will be sold for higher prices. The family's income will increase, and they will be able to purchase household goods to improve their living conditions.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers and materials for greenhouse renovation.

loan.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Florence has a food stall at the market, where she sells tomatoes. She has been in this business for the last five years, and she works seven days a week. She earns additional income working as sweeper for the Kampala Capital City Authority. Florence lives in her own house; the family has access to electricity but does not have piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.
Florence has requested a loan of 1,200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of tomatoes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and to start growing tomatoes herself.

loan.use: to buy tomatoes for sale.

loan.name: Jairo

texts.en:
Jairo has owned Chien Inc., a home care veterinary service, for over six years. He founded this company after working extensively in the veterinary field and seeing a need for veterinary services that could be mobile and bring care to the patient. This vision, in addition to Jairo‚Äôs passion to become an entrepreneur, led to his founding Chien Inc., first established out of his Florida home.
Originally from Columbia, Jairo‚Äôs greatest success has come with the creation of his own business to support his family, and being able to create jobs for others. There is much room for expansion within the local community and Jairo would like to see Chien Inc. continue to grow. He is asking for this loan for two purposes. First, he would like to buy new medical equipment to keep his business fully functioning and the best it can be for his patients. Second, he would like to expand his marketing to reach further and attract a wider clientele.

loan.use: to purchase new medical equipment and expand marketing

loan.name: Irene

texts.es: La socia pertenece al banco comunal ‚ÄúREYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS‚Äù; El banco est√° ubicado en el distrito de Urquillos, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco. La socia es la Sra. Irene tiene 70 a√±os de edad y es viuda y tiene 5 hijos la socia se dedica a la artesan√≠a y lleva a vender sus productos al poblado de Pisac, Ollantaytambo, ella realiza con mantas mu√±ecas, pantalones, chompas, porta lapiceros entre otros peque√±os trabajos. La socia desea invertir en la compra de materiales para seguir elaborando sus productos, ella comprara lanas de alpaca, oveja, sint√©tica, botones, forro para el cuerpo de los mu√±ecos, pinceles, agujas, hilos entre otros. La socia est√° feliz por el pr√©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en: The member, Irene, belongs to the Reyna de Los Angelos de Urquillos Communal Bank, located in the district of Urquillos, province of Calca, department of Cusco. She is a 70 year old widow and has five children. She is an artisan and sells her products in Pisac and Ollantaytambo. She makes blankets, dolls, pants, sweaters, pencil holders, and other small crafts. She is requesting the loan to purchase materials in order to continue creating her products. She will buy alpaca wool, synthetic sheep wool, buttons, covers for the dolls‚Äô bodies, paintbrushes, needles, thread, and other materials. Irene is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loan.use: to purchase materials in order to continue creating her products. She will buy alpaca wool, synthetic sheep wool, buttons, covers for the dolls‚Äô bodies, paintbrushes, needles, thread, and other materials.

loan.name: Resba

texts.en:
Resba is a 45-year-old married woman. She has five children, one of whom is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Gwama, and he works as a contractor. Resba operates a shop where she sells her goods. She's worked in this business for three years, and her primary customers are community members. She describes high prices as her greatest business challenge, and her highest monthly expenses are food, fees, and health. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
Resba will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, and rice. Resba aspires to open a bigger shop in the future. She joined Yehu because it's changing people's lives.

loan.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, and rice.

loan.name: Kaphuli

texts.en: Kaphuli is taking out another Kiva loan of 40,000 KES to boost her retail shop business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, and maize flour. She dreams of establishing another stall to improve her business in the future.

loan.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, and maize flour.

loan.name: Crisologa

texts.en:
Crisologa is a 58-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is engaged in farming and fishing.
Crisologa is a food vendor in Dauis, Bohol. She makes pancakes, banana cue, and rice cakes to sell to her community. Crisologa earns 2,000 PHP per month with her business. She requested a loan to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, and bananas. Crisologa hopes for her business to grow and for her family to experience a better quality of life.

loan.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, and bananas.

loan.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 31-year-old married man with three children. He sells men's clothing and some home products in the central bazaar. He has 10 years of experience in this field.
Samir sells seasonal clothes, which are very popular, especially jeans and shirts. He changes his stock every months to keep clients satisfied. His monthly income is 120 AZN. His wife helps him to choose the clothes and home products. The home products he sells are buckets, basins, baskets, and so on.
This business is only one financial income for Samir's family and he is trying his best to work harder and cover the needs of his family. He applied for 1500 AZN to purchase more seasonal clothes and home products to sell. He promises to pay on time. This will be his 5th loan and AqroInvest CU trusts him!

loan.use: buy clothes and home products

loan.name: Tai Group

texts.en:
Neema, who is in her late 30s, is single with one child who is still going to school. She has been selling kitchen ware and sandals for six years now. She works from 9:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more kitchen ware and sandals and for household expenses because she is single. She has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to increase her business stock. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.
She will share this loan with her loan group "Tai" which has a total of 21 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loan.use: to increase her kitchen ware and sandal stock.

loan.name: Zaza Patarkalashvili

texts.en:
Zaza is 41 years old. He lives in Kaspi District with his family: his wife ‚Äì Irma, two sons (16 and 13 years old) and his parents (retired). The children go to school. Zaza sells greengrocery produce from his mini-bus. He purchases greengrocery produce from farmers in his and nearby villages, takes the produce on his mini-bus to nearby towns and sells the products there. Irma is busy with the family agricultural business. In particular, she runs a dairy farm with 2 milk cows and 2 calves. Irma produces yogurt and cheese and sells them in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 1200 Laris, including the monthly pensions of Zaza‚Äôs parents.
Zaza will use the requested credit for increasing turnover in his greengrocery business. In particular, he will increase the assortment and volume of fruit and vegetables, purchased for resale. Zaza will sell more products and his profit will increase. The family will use the increased income for creating better living conditions for their children, as well as other family members.

loan.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loan.name: Flor Mar√≠a

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andr√©s De Vera de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde hace muchos a√±os como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se re√∫nen cada quince d√≠as las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.
En este lugar conocimos a la se√±ora Flor, tiene 39 a√±os de edad, est√° casada y de esta relaci√≥n tienen dos hijos de 18 y 12 a√±os de edad, ambos estudian en colegio y universidad y aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en un hotel.
Ella aprendi√≥ belleza y arreglo personal en un centro de estudios en esta ciudad. Con los pocos recursos que tenia y aprovechando sus conocimientos en arreglos y belleza hace varios a√±os instal√≥ en su casa un sal√≥n de belleza en el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de u√±as entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los d√≠as desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta m√°s tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. Tambi√©n vende productos de belleza, para lo cual tiene unas vitrinas, ella lleva m√°s de 14 a√±os dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este cr√©dito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes y algunas herramientas de trabajo. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco.
Su sue√±o tener un SPA
texts.en:
The members of 4 de Agosto Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the Andr√©s de Vera parish in the city of Portoviejo, known for many years as the Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos [City of the Royal Tamarind Trees].
Here we met Flor. She is 39 years old and married, and from this relationship has two children, ages 18 and 12. Both are studying, in high school and the university, and still live with her. Her husband works in a hotel.
She learned beauty and personal care in a school in this city. With the few resources she had, and taking advantage of her knowledge of beauty and personal care, several years ago she set up a beauty salon in her house, where she does a variety of jobs such as dyes, haircuts, and nail painting, among other things. She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., and sometimes until later if her customers need her services. She also sells beauty products, for which she has some display cases. She has been doing this work for more than 14 years and it is going very well for her.
She is going to use this loan to buy dyes, perms, and some work tools. This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because of the help and the profits she receives from the bank.
Her dream is to have a spa.

loan.use: to buy dyes, perms, and work tools.

loan.name: Kema

texts.en:
Kema lives in New Kru town. She is 30 years old and single with two children, ages six and eight. Both her children are in school and live at home. For the past three years, Kema has been selling onions, peppers, vita, and other items. She started her business selling rice around in her community with the little goods she could afford. She learned this type of business from her mother.
Kema is requesting a loan to purchase more stock for sale. She plans to expand her business and build a house.

loan.use: to purchase more onions, peppers, and other items for sale.

loan.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is a 49-year-old married woman with two children, aged 13 and 16. She is a farmer, working in Bien Unido, Bohol. Adelaida and her husband work together cultivating their land and growing rice to sell. Adelaida does her best to keep their farm productive and their children at school. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies. Adelaida hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She also hopes to venture into other kinds of business.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loan.name: Revelina

texts.en:
Revelina is 61 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. She is a farmer and works with her husband on their farm. Revelina helps cultivate their land and plant rice crops. She makes sure to manage her time between farming and taking care of her children.
Revelina is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and other farm inputs. Revelina hopes to have a stable income with farming.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and other farm inputs

loan.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives in New Kru town. She is 33 years old, married and her husband is a businessman. They have four children. For the past four years, she has been selling garri (an African food made of cassava). She started this business with a loan from her friend and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more garri for her business. Her plans is to expand.

loan.use: buy garri (a local food)

loan.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Ever since arriving in the United States, Gustavo has had an entrepreneurial spirit and the work ethic to support it. When he arrived in the United States in 2007, he took his first job as a gardener's assistant, but strived to work for himself. He soon decided to open his own lawn care service under the name Gustavo Lawn Service. He used his own money to purchase a van and the equipment that it would take to support his business. As he began to acquire clients, he changed the name of his business to Black Pearl Enterprises and began to see even higher success. The heightened success allowed him to buy more equipment and begin to employ assistants.
Gustavo now serves 260 accounts in his Florida community and hopes to continue to grow his business. He has set up an organized schedule in which he serves his clients and has made room for immediate growth. He would like this loan to purchase more equipment to more efficiently run his business. At this point he sees this as his only set back to further expansion.

loan.use: to purchase more equipment to suit more clients

loan.name: Bonaventure

texts.en:
Bonaventure has five children who are between 7 and 20. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 25 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output. Other agriculture borrowers were standing behind the picture.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers, and to support labor costs.

loan.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a dynamic entrepreneur with the fire it takes to own and operate a successful business. He has participated in other self-owned businesses in the past, including his last venture in real estate, and now looks to operate his own courier service. He founded Progressive Concepts Inc. in the greater Boston area and quickly forged a relationship with a large courier contractor, but also wanted to continue to serve local businesses as well.
Mainly he has targeted his business to support local laboratories, transporting lab results, as well as active experiments. However, in late January, an unlucky twist of fate threatened his business greatly. His main vehicle was involved in a car accident. Jocelyn worked hard to find a temporary solution for this problem, but now needs a new vehicle to continue his business. Jocelyn is looking for a loan to purchase a new vehicle for his courier service so that he can once again operate at full capacity.

loan.use: to purchase a new vehicle for courier service

loan.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, 49, lives in West Point with five children between 19 and 28 years old. For years now she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in her community. She received a small amount from her husband to start her business, and she learned it from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more Bonnie fish, spare ribs, rice, charcoal and pig's feet for her business. Her plans is to build a house for her children.

loan.use: to purchase more Bonnie fish, spare ribs, rice, charcoal and pig's feet for her business

loan.name: David Israel

texts.es: David, habitante de la ciudad de Estel√≠, de oficio mec√°nico. Nos dice que su primer pr√©stamo Kiva lo utilizo para comprar repuestos de veh√≠culos y motos le sirvi√≥ de mucho pues pudo surtir su negocio de piezas que necesitaba vender , le ayudo tambi√©n a conseguir nuevos clientes que antes no ten√≠a pues no contaba con suficientes repuestos para vender. Ahora est√° solicitando este cr√©dito para comprar balineras, bombas de frenos, fricciones, arranques, bovinas pues son repuestos y piezas que necesita tener su negocio para vender adem√°s de invertir en compra de repuestos para motos. Pues sigue con su firme prop√≥sito de lograr ampliar su tienda y trabajar duro por el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en: David lives in the city of Estel√≠ and is a mechanic by trade. He tells us that he used his first Kiva loan to buy better inventory for his shop, which served him well as he was able to stock up on spare parts to sell. This helped him bring in new customers, since previously he didn‚Äôt have enough inventory. Now he is soliciting a loan to buy more inventory and spare parts such as ball bearings, brake pumps, brake pads, starters, ignition coil, as well as, spare parts for motorcycles. He‚Äôs still going after his goal of expanding his business while working hard for the well-being of his child.

loan.use: buy ball bearings, brake pumps, brake pads, starters, and ignition coil.

loan.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a farmer, and she has been planting and selling rice for five years. She earns 3,000 PHP per month, and she works hard to support her family: a husband and six school-aged children. Alejandra's husband works as a fishpond operator.
Alejandra needs additional capital for her farm. She requested a loan to purchase four sacks of fertilizer and one sack of rice seeds. Alejandra plans to use any extra income she earns for her children's education.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seed.

loan.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is 42 years old. She lives in a village in the Tetritskaro district with her family--her husband, Mamuka, her 23-year-old son, and a daughter-in-law. Mamuka is unemployed at the moment, while Irina‚Äôs son serves in the country‚Äôs army forces. Irina manages the agricultural business of the family. She has a milk cow and makes cheese, which she sells to local dairy product retailers in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris, including the salary of Irina‚Äôs son.
Irina requested a loan for cultivation of the family-owned plot of land, where she plans to sow vegetables. Irina and Mamuka will work hard during the spring and summer months. They will harvest vegetables in the summer, which will be sold in the village to greengrocers. The income of the family will increase, which will help them satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loan.use: to rent a tractor for land cultivation.

loan.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells items like shampoo, toothpaste, soy sauce, softdrinks and rice. Lucila earns 8000 PHP per month with her business. She works hard to support her family of a husband and 5 children.
Lucila is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, softdrinks and snacks. This loan will help increase her profitability. Lucila hopes for her business to grow and for her children to have bright futures.

loan.use: restock her store

loan.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 28 years old. She is married and lives with her family: her husband Ilia and her parents. The family lives in a village in the Mtskheta district, near the capital city of the country. Ilia works as grader driver in the district and gets a monthly salary. Madona and her parents are involved in a family agricultural business, which is the main source of the income for the family. They have a dairy farm with 3 milk cows. Madona produces yogurt and sells it in this and the nearby villages. The total average monthly income for the family is 1000 Laris.
Madona requested credit to purchase calves. She will raise them for 5-6 months and sell the grown cows in early fall for a higher price. The family will get additional income from the sale. Madona plans to reinvest part of the income in the family farm for its further development, and the other part will be used to purchase needed household goods to improve the family's living conditions.

loan.use: to purchase calves

loan.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married. He has one child who is four years old. He has been a rice farmer for five years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and make savings for better sustainability.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loan.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs.

loan.name: Grace Mary

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! From Tengbehtown, this is 45-year-old Grace, a resident of the western area in Freetown and married mother of three children between the ages of 18 and 25 years. Two of her children attend school.

For 10 years, Grace has operated a pharmacy in Congo town, selling baby cream, multivites syrup, aspirin, choroqiune, injections, and anti-malarial drugs. Working at the business seven days per week, and with one employee, she also works as a private nurse to earn additional income. Grace says that the main challenge to her business is low capital for investment.

Grace has requested a loan to buy more cosmetic and medical drugs. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her children. In the future, she plans to open a bigger medical store. She thanks you for your support!

loan.use: to buy more cosmetics, baby cream and medicines such as anti-malarial drugs.

loan.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Mabel from Krootown central area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is a widow with one child aged 21. Her child is currently at the university. She also takes care of two relatives.
Mabel runs a boutique at her store; she sells shoes, clothes, perfume, belts, watches, and trousers. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business 10 hours a day and 6 days per week, and has two employees working for her. Her other source of income comes from relatives abroad. Mabel says that her business is doing well.
Mabel has requested a loan in order to buy more boutique items such as shoes, clothes, perfume, watches, etc. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her savings. In the future, she plans to travel in and out of the country doing larger business. She thanks you for your support!

loan.use: To buy more boutique items such as shoes, clothes, perfume, watches, etc.

loan.name: Ermita√±a

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion de helados y tambien la socia vende yogures,la socia vende a las diferentes tiendas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sue√±o de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de helados y yogures.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos apra comprar leche y azucar al por mayor.
La socia est√° feliz por el pr√©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member, Ermita√±a, continues her ice-cream making business and also sells yogurt. She sells her products at various shops and works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Through this business, she helps her children get ahead. Her dream is to expand her ice-cream and yogurt business. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies as well as wholesale milk and sugar. She is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loan.use: to purchase supplies as well as wholesale milk and sugar

loan.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a 22-year-old married woman with a four-year-old child; her husband works as a driver.
Anastacia has been in the business of raising pigs for two years. She says she had to learn how to earn an income because she has a family now. Although Anastacia married at a young age, she does her best to take care of her family and find ways to provide for their needs. She applied for a loan to purchase feed and vitamins, and she hopes her business will grow.

loan.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loan.name: Water

texts.en: Watta live in New Kru town. She is 29 years old, single and has two children ages 5 and 9 who are attending school and live at home. For the past 3 years, she has been selling potatoes, peppers, bitter balls and many other items. She is requesting a loan to purchase more potatoes, peppers, bitter balls and others items for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and to see her children out of high school.

loan.use: buy vegetables and other products

loan.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with has 4 children and two of her children are in school. She supports one additional family member (mother).
Zam sells bunches of bananas at the market. Her other sources of income include poultry farming and running a restaurant. She has been in business for the last 10 years and she works seven days a week.
Zam has requested a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas to sell. Her major business challenges are defaulters and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loan.use: buy bananas
